Este es su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con él comprará  una vitrina calentadora para exhibir sus fritos y un mayor número de cajas de cervezas para la venta de los fines de semana , además planea  adquirir dos planes para vender minutos a celulares, aprovechando la gran demanda de clientes a quienes puede captar y ganar un poco más de dinero.
texts.en:
Luisa Elena is 30 years old and lives in the La Playa housing development together with her four young children.  She dreams of supporting her children until they become successful adults.  Luisa's household income comes from her business called "Estadero mi Padrino y Yo" where she sells beer, natural juices and fried food.

A little over one year ago, Luisa's cousin, who started the business, went to live in a very beautiful place on the Caribbean coast in Colombia: La Sierra Nevada de Santa Marta.  He suggested to Luisa that she take over his business, making her a gift of a cooler.  Although she accepted the idea, she considered it a very big challenge taking over the business, especially on Saturdays and holidays when things are at their busiest.  Luisa is a single mother with four children which makes things difficult.  However, she accepted the challenge and started soda, soft drinks, natural juices and fried food.  She also asked a cousin to work with her on weekends.  In carrying out her business every day, it has gradually become stronger.  She started the business in her home but currently works in her uncle's house because he has the infrastructure she needs: a cooler, a blender and equipment for storing the beer and juice.

Luisa's dream is to diversify her business and increase her sales since her number of customers has increased and she doesn't have much capital with which to respond to demand.  Her biggest challenge is serving in her business since it is very difficult for her as a woman living on her own.  Her children are not yet able to support her because they are still young.  Luisa continues working to fulfil her dreams, making profits of no less than 26%.  She dreams of increasing her profits.

This is Luisa's first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy a heated cabinet to display her fried food, and a larger number of crates of beer to sell on weekends.  She also intends to acquire two phone plans so that she can sell cell phone minutes, taking advantage of her customer demand, attracting customers and earning a little more money.

loans.use: to buy a heated cabinet to display her fried food, and more crates of beer to sell on weekends.  She also intends to acquire two phone plans so that she can sell cell phone minutes

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio is 39 years old and lives in the community of Sta. Josefa,  Agusan Del Sur. He is a rice farmer and a piggery owner. He has been in these businesses for 11 years. His monthly income from his businesses is PHP 4,000.

With a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc., he will buy farm and agricultural supplies such as seeds and fertilizers. He will also buy pig feed and pay school fees for his children.

Rogelio has two children. His dream is to become successful in his swine fattening and rice farm businesses.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa sells boodo at Elmina. Boodo is made from flour, sugar, maize and other ingredients. The process of cooking boodo is by baking. As you can see in this picture, Adjoa has filled the oven with boodo to bake. 

She wishes to expand her business so she needs a loan to buy maize, flour and other things to bake for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to buy maize, flour and other things to bake for sale

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydia has practiced farming in Olkalou town for the last 13 years. She is 64 years old and married to Joseph. They have four children. She practices small-scale farming and sells her harvest at the local market. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy potato seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Lydia hopes to buy more land and practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Genty

texts.en: Genty is a 32 year old married woman whose husband is business man. They have 4 children, 3 of whom go to school. Genty is currently in the business of selling fruit like tomatoes, mangoes, and pineapple, and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  With the extra profits from her loan, Genty hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba smokes a variety of fish at Abura for resale. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. Aba has been selling smoked fish for five years. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke to expand her business. She hopes to reinvest her new profit.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to smoke

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her industrial stove and to purchase corn, pork, and cheese.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace works hard to support her family. Grace is married and has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines.

Grace requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad.

Grace has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David desde el municipio de Malambo, área metropolitana de Barranquilla nos informa que planea recibir su segundo credikiva, para surtir su negocio con ropa y sandalias y dar respuesta a un mercado fijo con el que cuenta. Con su anterior credikiva compró insumos para fabricar pan de bonos y también invirtió en calzado. Su mensaje a los financiadores es el siguiente:
“Gracias  a esta entidad es la segunda vez que me apoyan,  espero que continúen haciéndolo y también seguirles pagando muy bien.”
Si usted quiere conocer la historia de David, ingrese al siguiente enlace:
http://kiva.org/lend/203257
texts.en:
From the town of Malambo, Barranquilla metropolitan area, David tells us that he plans to receive his second Kiva loan to stock his business with clothes and sandals to meet the demand he has from his steady customers.  

He used his previous Kiva loan to buy ingredients to bake "pan de bonos" [Colombian cheese bread] and he also invested in footwear.  His message to all the lenders follows:

“Thanks to this entity, this is the second time they’ve supported me.  I hope they continue to do so and also to continue to repay them very well.” 

If you’d like to know David’s story, please click on the following link:
http://kiva.org/lend/203257

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals.

loans.name: Dimar

texts.es: El Sr. Dimar, nacido en Chuquisaca no es casado pero convive con la Sra. María, tienen dos hijos. Ella es ama de casa, y él se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería, hace más de 10 años, ellos viven en el Porvenir  en la provincia cordillera. Distante a 40 km. De Limoncito Torno,  donde tienen su parcela donde siembran sandia, maíz, cítricos y yuca, el crédito que han solicitado es para la siembra de sandia y los gastos que implica el preparado de la tierra y también siembran maíz, sorgo, y poroto. Todo lo que ellos siembran lo venden directo al consumidor en el mercado de la zona.
texts.en:
Sr. Dimar was born in Chuquisaca. He is not married, but he lives with Sra. María and they have two children. She is a homemaker while Dimar engages in farming and raising livestock. He has been in this business for more than 10 years. Dimar and his family live in El Porvenir in a mountain province that is 40 km from Limoncito Torno.

He has a parcel of land where he grows watermelon, corn, citrus fruits, and cassava. Dimar is requesting a loan for growing watermelon and covering the expenses related to preparing his land. He also wants to plant corn, sorghum, and beans. Everything he produces is sold directly to the consumer at the local market.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing watermelon and to prepare his land for planting.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
"Touching and knowing the life of the client" is the secret of Lilibeth, 36 years old. She is married and has five children. She would like to have more clients and to invest in her personal collection business of plates, spoons and glasses. She has been engaged in her business for five years.

Lilibeth is asking for a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase different products that she can offer to her neighbors. She dreams that someday she will see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy glasses, spoons and plates for her business.

loans.name: Reina De Los Angeles

texts.es:
la sra. Reina de los Angeles tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada y es madre de 4 hijos, Reina se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, sus ventas son por pedidos diarios, tiene muchos clientes permanentes, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para elaborar las tortillas y luego repartirlas a sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leña, cal, maiz y agua, en estos momentos los pedidos de sus clientes han aumentado y no se de abasto con la produccion que tiene, es por tal razon que desea comprar mas materiales para tener una mayor produccion.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Reina de los Angeles is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Reina makes and sells tortillas. Her sales are by daily request, and she has a lot of permanent clients. Her business is located in her home. Every day, she gets up very early to produce the tortillas and later to deliver them to her clients. 

She will use the loan to purchase firewood, quicklime, corn, and water. Currently, the requests of her clients have increased, and she does not have the supplies to keep up. Because of this, she wants to purchase more materials to make more products. 

She needs the earnings to help her family get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase firewood, quicklime, corn, and water.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nelida es socia del Banco Comunal Solidaridad, tiene 24 años, no tiene hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 4 años. 
Nélida vende ropas en las ferias, ella desde muy pequeña trabajaba, recuerda que se inició vendiendo medias, y poco a poco pudo tener un pequeño capital para poder iniciar con la venta de ropas, Finca le ayuda mucho a poder valorarse y a poder administrar mejor su dinero, y todo lo que puede aprender lo practica en su negocio, ahora lo que mas anhela es poder tener una tienda de ropas, ahora con el préstamo que esta sacando comprará mas ropas para poder llevar a la feria.
texts.en:
Nélida is a member of Solidaridad Communal Bank.  She is 24 years old and has no children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years.

Nélida sells clothing in the markets.  She began working when she was very young.  She remembers that she began selling stockings, and little by little she managed to have a little capital to be able to begin selling clothes.  FINCA helped her a lot to be able to assess herself and manage her money better, and in her business she practices everything that she is able to learn.

What she wants most now is to be able to have a clothing store.  With the loan that she is taking out now she will buy more clothes to take to the market.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to take to the market to sell.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida sells slippers and cloth at Takoradi by moving from one place to another. She is married and has 1 child. Her husband is a sand-winner. Vida has been selling cloths for 2 years. She assists her husband to take care of their home. 

Her loan will be used to buy more cloths to sell. She hopes to reinvest the new profits.

loans.use: to buy cloths to sell.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en:
Alphonsine is married with two children, ages three to six years old.  Both attend school. 

Alphonsine, age 28, sells a variety of products in her store, such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, lotions and spices. 

She has requested a loan to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products in her store, such as sugar, rice, cooking oil, lotions and spices.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 33 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has been operating a small retail shop for the last four years, with a monthly profit of KES 6,000. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a credit officer, and she is applying for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET Ltd., which she plans to use to add additional stock of maize flour, cooking oil, Royco (a spicy seasoning) and tea leaves for sale. 

The client will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for her children. In the future, the lady hopes to grow her business and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy maize flour, cooking oil, Royco and tea leaves.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 31 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. Rosalie has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for the pigs

loans.name: Progrès Plus Group

texts.en:
Julienne is the chairwoman of the community bank named Progrès Plus. It consists of 13 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the microfinance institution HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Julienne has been in the microenterprise world since 2001. She has been running a restaurant located southwest of the city of Kinshasa. She is a loyal client of HOPE RDC, who has already received six different loans and has repaid them properly. She intends to use the next loan to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying a sack of flour, fish, and beans with the aim of increasing her profits. Each week, her business brings in a profit of $70. Her ambition is to open a big restaurant in her area. 

Julienne is 58 years old, married and has seven children whose ages vary between 21 and 35 years old. One of them goes to school.

loans.use: to increase the stock of her restaurant by buying flour, beans, and other foods

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 37-year-old man from Western Kenya. He is married to Marry and they don’t have kids.

George operates a computer bureau business. He has been doing this business for the last six years and makes a monthly profit of 11,000 KES. He is taking his second loan with KADET Ltd. and will use the loan to complete his own premises and piping works and boost his supplies. He plans to plough back the anticipated profits into the business.

His dream is to open another branch at Muhuru Bay.

loans.use: to complete building and initiate piping works

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es:
Reina, se dedica a vender ropa en los hogares, ella vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 22 y 25 años de edad, el negocio lo aprendió hace dos años hasta ahorita no ha presentado ningún problema, trabaja  todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo utilizara para comprar más variedad de ropa para niños, damas y caballeros como: pantalones, camisas, faldas, blusas y de esa forma podrá tener más ingresos.
El sueño de Reina es mantener estable su negocio apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios que ellos tengan lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Reina makes a living selling clothing door to door.  She lives with her husband and two children who are 25- and 22-years old, respectively.  She started the business two short years ago and is satisfied with her progress.  
Reina will use this loan to buy clothing for men, women and children: trousers, shirts, skirts, blouses, etc.
Reina wants a steady income so that she can help her chldren get a good education.

loans.use: to stock her retail clothing business.

loans.name: Alan

texts.es: Alan, de 30 años de edad, es de profesión técnico en enfermería, siendo un hombre trabajador y empeñoso, es soltero, vive en compañía de su madre y su hermano, a los que quiere mucho y apoya en lo que puede, habitando cómodamente la casa de su madre. La actividad que desea iniciar Alan es la de abrir un tópico de enfermeria ya que cuenta con el conocimiento por la carrera que estudió. Por eso tiene planes de asociarse con sus colegas de trabajo, donde él colaborará con parte del capital y sus futuros socios con el local, así formará una pequeña empresa.  Lo que espera es tener ingresos adicionales y así podrá apoyar a su madre con los gastos de su hogar, a parte de que tiene planes de independizarse buscando comprarse un casa propia, para ello deberá trabajar duro y ahorra. Mas adelante espera formar una botica. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecido por la oportunidad de contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera ser buenas personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en su totalidad en el negocio de un tópico de enfermería que tiene planeado.
texts.en:
Alan, 30, is by profession a nursing technician and a hard-working man.  He is single and lives comfortably in his mother's house with his mother and brother, whom he loves very much and supports as much as he can.

The job Alan wants to start is opening a basic health care facility, since he has the knowledge because of his studies.  This is why he has plans to get together with his work colleagues to set up a small business in which he will collaborate with part of the capital and his future associates with the location.

What he hopes for is to have additional income so he will be able to help his mother with the household expenses.  Besides, he has plans to become independent and is looking to buy his own house, for which he must work hard and save.  Later on he hopes to set up a pharmacy.

This will be his first loan with the MFP institution.  He feels grateful for the opportunity to have a line of credit to get ahead with his goals.  He also comments that he feels at home with his communal bank because he knows the majority of the members and considers them to be good people.

He will invest the requested loan of 1000 PEN in its entirely in the health care facility business that he has planned.

loans.use: to set up a basic health care facility.

loans.name: Wilmer Jose

texts.es: El joven Wilmer tiene 26 años de edad de familia agricultora él tiene 8 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, es casado con un hijo no asiste a la escuela porque esta pequeño todavía la esposa es ama de casa, al inicio él tuvo dificultad con el financiamiento y otros problemas de plagas que atacaron su cultivo, pero gracias a Dios logro salir adelante; para tener cuidado de esto solicita su segundo crédito para darle mantenimiento a 1 manzana de piña, para el cual necesitara comprar abono, urea e insecticida. En un futuro desea poder sembrar más manzanas de piña para darle un mejor futuro a su hijo quien a medida que va creciendo sus gastos son mayor.

loans.use: Para comprar abono, urea e insecticida.

loans.name: Ciriaco

texts.es: El Sr. Ciriaco tiene 55 años de edad, vive en la Población de Mariposas, de la provincia Carrasco, de la ciudad de Cochabamba, él está en concubinato con la Sra. Emeteria. Ciriaco tiene 7 hijos,  se dedica a la producción de plátano y la producción de cacao ya que el no pudo tener ingresos suficientes para poder mantener a su familia, ellos vivían en el departamento de Potosí  hace 31 años atrás ellos se volvieron a levantar  junto a su Esposa tomaron un nuevo rumbo en su camino empezaron de cero.  El préstamo que solicita Ciriaco es para la compra de Rondanas para Cablevia  y de esa manera podrá tener más ingresos y poder ayudar a sus hijos a terminar alguna carrera sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos y quiere que sus hijos si puedan realizar una carrera y poder ayudar a las personas de la zona.
texts.en:
Ciriaco is 55 years old.  He lives in the town of Mariposas in the Carrasco province in the city of Cochabamba.  He is married to Emeteria and they have seven children.  He works growing bananas and producing cacao.  They used to live in the department of Potosi, and he was not able to earn enough money to support their family, so 31 years ago, they returned to take a new path, starting from nothing.  

Ciriaco is requesting this loan to purchase pulleys for a cable system for his banana plants.  This will allow him to earn more income and help his children finish their career.  He dreams of giving his children a better future and hopes that they will become professionals and be able to help people in the area.

loans.use: to purchase pulleys for a cable system.

loans.name: Aichatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même zone. La représentante du groupe, nommée Aichatou (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo)âgée de 34 ans n’a pas fréquentée l’école. Aichatou est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Ibrahim. Le couple a deux enfants, certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Aichatou vit ensemble avec son conjoint et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. C’est pour cette raison, que Aichatou vend  du maïs depuis trois ans environs. Aichatou s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Aichatou ensemble avec les membres de ce groupe sollicite pour une première fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs.

loans.name: Myrlina

texts.en:
Myrlina is 64 years old and married with ten children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to provide for her family.

Myrlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc.

Myrlina has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from selling rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soap, sugar, coffee, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: Zonia de 45 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa alquilada con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos, agua, gaseosas, jugos, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la clienta está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y poderle dar a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: comprar refrescos, agua, gaseosas, jugos, etc. por mayor

loans.name: Stefan

texts.en: Stefan R. is private agricultural producer in Kardjali. He is 39 years old ad has s pedagogic education which he graduated in Plovdiv. His wife is also a pedagogue. While he was a student he tried some jobs such as teacher and taxi driver, but living in big city was not easy for him so he went back to his native city Kardjali. In 2001 he started his agricultural business. He hired 5 decares of land and started to grow peppers on it. On the next year he hired another 5 decares and now 6 years later Stefan cultivates 10 decares of pepper and 2 decares of watermelons. Stefan R. wants to buy a mechanic water sprayer for his farming and needs $ 2 000.

loans.use: To buy a mechanic water sprayer

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a seamstress who is very good at her vocation. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation. She understands the TEACH Lending program and is comfortable using book-keeping skills to run her business. She needs a loan of $750 to expand her business and employ more hands to help her.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire the resources needed to expand her business

loans.name: Aura

texts.en: Aura sells in a "Ventorrillo" which is a place where she sells vegetables, and various kinds of meat. She has been in the business for almost 2 years and before that she had a stand where she sold "Pastelitos" .She goes to the market in Santo Domingo to resupply and only goes every time she needs to restock. She is married with 3 children 1 girl and 2 boys. She also has her own place to sell the goods.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her business

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 24-year-old self-made woman living with her parents in Dekwaneh in Beirut. She strives every day to pay her university tuition fees through the embroideries she makes for wedding and evening dresses. She learned that skill from her mother and wanted to develop it into a sustainable business.

Rania has received 2 loans from Al Majmoua prior to this one. Now she needs USD 700 to buy fabrics and accessories to continue expanding her work. Once she graduates, her dream is to transform the small business she runs from home into a registered company. For sure, Al Majmoua will do its best to help her reach this goal.

loans.use: Purchase fabrics and accessories for the embroidery work

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
VERONICA, age 30, has had 14 years of experience in hairdressing. Three years ago, she started her own business, “Vero Natural Beauty Hair Salon” and now employs 3 full-time workers to assist her. Business is going well and they have around 15 customers a day, bringing in about $35-40. Problems come when the electricity and water are not stable.

Knowing the potential of her growing business, Veronica hopes to get a loan to upgrade her salon with mirrors, shelves, and other salon furnishings. Living with her husband, 9-year-old son, and 3-year-old daughter, Veronica spends the profits from her business on school fees and improving their quality of life at home.

Veronica belongs to the group Ruaha (the name for a river in Tanzania), which consists of 19 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase salon furnishings

loans.name: Sophos's Group

texts.en:
These two families live in a small village off of National Road 2, about fifteen kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They are requesting this, their first group loan from Maxima, to buy a second cow and to buy a moto-remorque taxi. Mrs. C. Sophos was selected to be a group leader by members requesting a loan from Maxima.

1. Mrs. C. Sophos (age 25) and her husband (age 28) have been married for two years. They have one child. C. has worked in a nearby garment factory for six years. Her husband drives a moto-remorque taxi. They also raise cows (see image on right of photo). She is requesting a loan from Maxima of US$400. She will use this loan to purchase a cow to raise.

2. Mrs. N. Chanthorn (age 26) and her husband (age 33) have been married since 1997. They have three children, two of whom study in primary school in their village. N. has been working in a garment factory for a year. Her husband also drives a moto-remorque taxi (see image on left of photo -- her husband and son are pictured on one as an illustration.) Closer to Phnom Penh, National Road Two is lined with garment factories. At each shift change, thousands of workers, mostly women, need to be ferried to and from the surrounding villages. Cambodians use the moto-remorque, a very economical combination of a trailer pulled by a 100 or 125cc motorbike. They typically hold as many as eighteen or more people. N. is requesting a loan from Maxima of US$200. She will use this loan to purchase a moto-remorque carriage to provide transportation.

loans.use: Group loan to purchase a cow and a moto-remorque taxi.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence I. is 51 years old.  She is married, has four children, and lives in Benin City. She sells female clothing. She is requesting a loan of $450 to enable her to buy more clothing to sell.  She spent three years learning about her trade before starting her own business in 2003.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Nabidongha B South D Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jesca N.. She is currently in the business of water selling and is requesting a loan to start up a retail shop. Jesca is 48 years old and is married. Her husband is a mechanic. She has 7 children ranging from age 6 to 21 and five of them go to school. Each week, Jesca makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits, and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to cater to home expenditures. Jesca has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her water business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jesca is joined in her small group by Zaina N., Harriet N., Farida T., and Zaitula N.. Zaina N. has a business in selling clothes and groceries and wants to uplift the clothes business. Harriet N. is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to start up a permanent clothes shop. Farida T. operates a local restaurant business and wants to invest in her restaurant. Zaitula N. is currently in the grocery business and is requesting a loan to increase the stock of items.

loans.use: To start up a retail shop and also add to the water business

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Mrs. Duong S. Ley, age 28, runs a butcher shop at a market. She sells chicken that she buys from her nearby poultry breeder in her community , earning around $5 each day of income. Her husband is an electrician and makes on average $5 each day. She has four little children. Mrs. Duong S. would like to request a loan to purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to use for her business’s transportation.

loans.name: Angel's Muongozo Group

texts.en:
Angel is 34 years old, married, and has 2 children. Angel sells vegetables, and began her business in 2004. Everyday she begins work at 7 AM and ends at 10 PM. She earns about $20 a month from her sales.

Angel would like a loan to increase her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Mwajuma, who also owns her own vegetable business.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Isabel Teofila

texts.es:
Isabel is a partner of the Comunal Pantipampa bank. She carries this name because all of her partners are from the community of Pantipampa which is located two hours from the city of Ayacucho.

Isabel is married. She is 40 years old and has four children. Isabel has a small grocery store in her house. She also makes bread that she sells in her shop and also through other shops in her community. In addition, Isabel has a small café in the high school of her community where she sells candy, food, and fruit. Isabel also is devoted to farm work and the rearing of animals.

Isabel needs a loan of 2,500 soles which will be invested in the purchase of flour, candy, rice, sugar and vegetables.

Isabel’s dream is to have her own money, that her business prospers and that her children obtain a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva volunteer.

Isabel es socia del banco Comunal Pantipampa, lleva este nombre porque todas sus socias son de la comunidad de Pantipampa que se ubica a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Isabel es casada, tiene 40 años y 4 hijos, Isabel tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, también elabora panes que vende en su tienda y reparte a las tiendas de su comunidad. Además Isabel tiene un cafetín en el colegio de su comunidad donde vende golosinas, comidas, frutas. También Isabel se dedica a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Isabel necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, golosinas, arroz, azúcar y verduras.

Los sueños de Isabel son tener capital propio, que su negocio prospere y sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: Isabel needs a loan of 2,500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of flour, candy, rice, sugar and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Del Socorro

texts.es:
The sale of shellfish is the activity to which señora Maria del Socorro Gómez is very vigorously dedicated. She lives in the municipality of San Rafael del Sur in Managua, Nicaragua. She has carried out her sales for over eight years and this has permitted her to maintain her family nucleus composed of herself and her two small children of school age.

It is very important to emphasize that since she start her business she has sold on foot along the streets of her community, but as time has elapsed she managed to improve her business by obtaining a cooler where she stores her shellfish. This achievement has been thanks to the support of Ceprodel, which has supplied her with loans which she has utilized for the improvement of her business. Currently she requests one more loan for the purchase of shellfish such as fish, shrimp, crabs, etc. in order to market them.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de mariscos es la actividad a la que muy esforzadamente se dedica la señora Maria del Socorro Gómez en el municipio de San Rafael del Sur en Managua Nicaragua. Su actividad la realiza desde hace más de ocho años y esta le ha permitido mantener su núcleo familiar compuesto por ella y sus dos pequeños hijos en edades escolares.

Es de mucha importancia destacar que ella desde que inicio su negocio vendía ambulante por las calles de su comunidad pero a medida que el tiempo ha transcurrido ella logró mejorar obteniendo una mantenedora donde almacena sus mariscos. Estos logros los ha tenido gracias al apoyo de Ceprodel el cual le ha proporcionado créditos los cuales los ha utilizado para la mejora de su negocio. Hoy en día solicita una vez mas para la compra de los mariscos como peces, camarones, cangrejos, etc. para comercializarlos.

loans.use: To buy shellfish for resale.

loans.name: Paulina, Juliana And Maria Group

texts.en:
Paulina, Juliana and María belong to the Chiara Village Bank. Chiara is the town where they live, located an hour from Ayacucho. All three of them earn income farming cereals and tubers and selling other food items.

Paulina is 39 years old, married, and has 4 children. She earns income selling meat. Paulina purchases animals from the local communities, raises them and then sells them. In addition, she also sells traditional clothing. Juliana is 52 years old, married, and has 7 children. She raises bovines and produces cheese that she then sells to middlemen. María is 37, married, and has 4 children. María and her daughter weave pullovers and sell them to people living in the local district. Additionally, she also sells cheese.

Paulina, Juliana and María currently need a loan to buy goats, pigs, cows, wool, and cheese for sale.

They all dream about improving their households and about acquiring more farm animals to improve their businesses.

loans.use: Purchase of goats, pigs, cows, wool, and cheese for sale

loans.name: Khem

texts.en:
Khem S., 38, lives in Phnom Penh with her husband, Tith Yorn, and their three children. She and her husband work together purchasing vegetables from the growers and reselling them in the markets in their area. They typically make US$ 3 each day, and they are also supported through the income of their daughter who sells sugar cane juice. The sugar cane juice business usually brings in US$ 5 each day in revenue.

The family is seeking to increase its income and improve its standard of living. Khem S. has asked for a loan of US$ 1200 to purchase more vegetables and invest in their business. She can increase her income through increasing her inventory and she believes that she has a good business plan that will help the family in the long-term.

Khem S. was unavailable for a photograph, so her daughter and her sugar cane juice business is pictured above.

loans.use: Purchase more vegetables and invest in their business

loans.name: Yoath's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yoath O., 40, who both farms and raises pigs, earns around $1.00 per day while her husband, Mr. Clin Heuy, 46, works in construction. They live with their five children, all of whom are students. In order to improve the farming business, Yoath is requesting a loan of $100 to purchase more fertilizer for her rice crop. Yoath is the leader of a group with two other members:

1. Mrs. Thoeup S., 29, raises pigs. She is requesting a loan of $50 to purchase more fertilizer, thereby increasing her family’s income. 2. Mrs. Tha S. , a 31-year-old farmer, lives in Lvear Commune in the Siem Reap Province with her five-member family and is requesting a loan of $50 to purchase fertilizer. The loan will improve her farming business and increase her income to help support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more fertilizer for her rice crop

loans.name: Suon

texts.en: Mrs. Suon H. is a villager in Khvet Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small grocery store in the local village. Because this business is going well, she wants to expand it; so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods for her inventory. Mrs. Suon H. is a 55-year-old widow with two children, one of whom helps her with the business, while the other immigrated to work as a laborer in Malaysia.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her inventory

loans.name: Mardely Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Mardely tiene 46 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Anexo Villa Libertad,  tiene tres hijos de 10,23 y 30 años de edad, el menor esta estudiando y dos trabajan su esposo trabaja como conductor, el negocio de la Sra. Mardely es la venta de cosmético desde hace doce años, inicio con  dinero propio con dinero de la venta de una camioneta que tenia. Con la solicitud de préstamo es para comprar más producto de cosméticos y aprovechar la buena temporada como es la navidad. A largo plazo es poder establecer una tienda  en  un lugar céntrico donde pueda captar clientes, y elevar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Mardely is 46 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Liberty Annexed Village in the capital city of Managua. She has three children, ages 10, 23 and 30. The youngest is in school and the two eldest work with husband as drivers. Mardely's business has been selling cosmetics for 12 years. She started with money she got from selling a van she had. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cosmetic supplies and take advantage of the Christmas season. Her long-term goal is to establish a centrally located store where she can attract customers and increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Mercedes es madre soltera, vive con uno de sus 4 hijos, que es soltero, trabaja y la apoya en lo posible.Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas y helados en su vivienda desde hace 2 años. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que está en contacto con muchas personas. Le es rentable debido a que sus productos son de consumo diario y ya cuenta con sus clientes desde hace mucho tiempo. Lo difícil para ella es no contar con un local adecuado para la venta de sus productos. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP. En esta oportunidad desea mandar a construir un kiosco para poder vender con mayor tranquilidad, comodidad y dar mejor acogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mercedes is single and she lives with one of her 4 kids who is single and works and supports her where possible. She has dedicated herself to selling drinks and ice-creams from her house for 2 years. What she likes about her work is that she comes into contact with many people. It is profitable as her products are for every day consumption and she has many long-term clients. The difficult thing for her is that she does not have an adequate store from which to sell her products. This is her second loan with MFP. With this opportunity she wants to build a kiosk to be able to sell more calmly and comfortably and to welcome her clients better.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kiosk to sell her drinks/Construccion de un kiosko para la venta de sus bebidas

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es: Rufina tiene 47 años, es madre soltera de dos niños, Janet de 16 y Brolin de 13 años, con quienes vive. Preocupada por el bienestar de sus pequeños hijos incursionó en el negocio de la venta de pescado, negocio con el cual viene manteniendo a su familia durante 13 años. Rufina vende el pescado de manera ambulatoria, generalmente pejerreyes, ya que estos tienen más demanda por su escasez y se usan en múltiples platos como en el ceviche, frituras, etc., los cuales buscan bastante las cocineras de los restaurantes. Lo difícil es adquirir los pescados, tiene esperar largas horas para la distribución. Rufina se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de pescado para vender y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Rufina is 47 years old, single and lives with her two children, Janet 16 and Brolin 13. Worried about the well being of her small children, she got into the fish selling business which has supported her family for 13 years. Rufina travels to sell the fish. She generally sells silversides since there is more demand due to its scarcity. It is used in many dishes such as ceviche, fried food, etc. and many restaurant cooks look for it. It is difficult to get the fish. She has to wait long hours for delivery. This is Rufina's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she has requested, she will buy larger amounts of fish to sell and increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase larger amounts of fish

loans.name: Rakhila

texts.en: Rakhila N. is 48 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Rakhila breeds calves and cows. She buys the calves at the market for a low price, then feeds them and resells them at the same market for a more profitable amount. Her husband also helps with this business. Rakhila works hard in order to make the business successful and generate a stable income for the family. Now, Rakhila is planning to purchase three baby calves to raise and then sell. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan of 1200 USD. Rakhila would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations or delinquency.

loans.use: Purchase three calves

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Julia es casada, tiene 56 años y 7 hijos, Julia venD. comida D. manera ambulatoria en una calle adyacente al mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días con apoyo D. sus hijos.
Julia necesita un préstamo D. 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. una cocina a gas.
El sueño D. Julia es tener un local estable y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Banco Comunal Morenita II community bank. She is 56, married with 7 children. Julia sells food from a stall in the street besiD. the Magdalena market; she works seven days a week, and her children help her.

Julia needs a loan of 750 sol to buy a gas cooker.

Her ambition is to have a stable premises and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by John Rynne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Luz  Magaly

texts.es:
Luz es socia D. Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando
Luz es soltera, trabajo como cajera para una empresa grande, por varios años, aprendió hacer anticuchos, parrilladas, participa  en los festivales gastronómicos  realizados por la municipalidad, D. distrito donde vive. Con sus ahorros hace ocho años  pudo alquilar un local donde puso una bodega, ella trabaja todo el día.
Desde que está en Finca, agradece por a los préstamos puede invertir, aprendió la importancia de ahorrar y ha ser solidaria.
Necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para comprar arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos para surtir su bodega.
El sueño de Luz es tener una casa propia, ella vive con sus padres.
texts.en:
Luz is a partner of the Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando (Communal Bank of Progressing Women). Luz is single and works as a cashier in a large business. For several years she’s learned to make grilled “anticuchos.” She participates in the food festivals held in her municipality in the district where she lives. With her savings from eight years ago she was able to rent a space to sell groceries and works all day long. Since she’s been in the Finca (co-op), she’s thankful for the loans she can use to invest, and for learning the importance of saving and to show solidarity. She needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy rice, sugar, milk, and noodles to supply her grocery store. Luz’ dream is to have a house of her own; she lives with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Needs a loan of 1000 soles, to buy rice, sugar, milk and noodles to supply her grocery store.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond N. is a photographer who goes to cover programmes and ceremonies with his video camera at a fee in Abura. Raymond has received a senior high education. He is married and has one child.

Raymond has been a photographer since 2004. He is responsible for providing food, clothing, and the other basic needs of his family. His loan will be used as additional capital to enable him buy photography items to improve the quality of his services to his customers. He hopes to reinvest the new profits back into his business for the expansion of his photography work.

loans.use: To buy photography items to improve the quality of his services

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Monsieur Ibrahima S. « Go » est professeur de Français à Bambey, une petite ville de 100 kilomètres de Dakar, le capital de Sénégal.  Il a enseigné les étudiants au lycée de Bambey depuis 5 ans.  Il a déjà reçu un crédit auprès de l’IMCEC qu’il a bien remboursé, et maintenant il sollicite son deuxième crédit pour l’équipement de sa maison.  Monsieur S. a 32 ans et il est célibataire.
texts.en:
Mr. Ibrahima S. "Go" is a French teacher in Bambey, a small city located 100 km from Dakar, the capital of Senegal. He has been teaching students at the Bambey lycée (high school) for five years. He had received a loan from IMCEC that he repaid. And now he's requesting his second loan for equipping his house. Mr. S. is 32 years old and unmarried.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip his house

loans.name: Enestina

texts.en:
Enestina owns a small grocery store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the Maendeleo A2 group loan (Group code 2014). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.  


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more grocery items to add to her current stock for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Enestina is 40 years old, married, and has four children: ages 18, 15, 13 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Allen Aakyanzi‘S Group

texts.en:
Allen is the leader of a five-member group. She is the 29-year-old mother of two children aged one week and 4 years. The 4-year-old goes to school. She resides in and owns a two-roomed house where she is staying with four people. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members There is electricity and piped water at her home and the family gets three meals a day.

Allen resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She operates a ladies’ salon in Lungujja, Kosovo. She works upon an average of seven people a day, mainly women and children. She works seven days a week.

Allen does her shopping from shops in Kampala. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises, electricity and medication. She has been in this business for the last four years. Her main challenges are defaulters and seasonality.

Allen has been with MCDT for over four years and is servicing her tenth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more steaming dryers and more tins of creams. Allen is hopeful of opening up other branches of salons in different areas.

loans.use: To buy a steaming dryer and more creams

loans.name: Itzel

texts.es:
CASADA Y TIENE UN HIJO DE 4 AÑOS EDAD 

SE DEDICA A A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE JOYERIA DE PLATA.

COMENZO CON EL NEGOCIO, POR LA RAZON DE QUE QUERIA APOYAR A SU ESPOSO CON LOS GASTOS DEL HOGAR, DESDE EL AÑO 2005 QUE LA IDEA DE UN NEGOCIO PROPIO SE HIZO REALIDAD, GRACIAS AL APOYO DE SU MADRE QUIEN LE ACONSEJO QUE SERIA BUENA IDEA.

EL CLARO EJEMPLO DE SU MADRE QUE SE DEDICO ALA VENTA DE LIBROS, PARA MANTENER A SU FAMILIA, LA IMPULSO PARA PODER SEGUIR ADELANTE, AHORA PIDE AL APOYO PARA ASI COMPRAR MAS JOYERIA Y PODER OFRECER MAYOR VARIEDAD A SUS CLIENTES.
texts.en:
Itzel is married and has one 4-year-old child. She dedicates herself to the purchase and sale of silver jewelry. She started this business because she wanted to help her husband with household expenses. Her idea of her own business became a reality in 2005 thanks to the support that her mother gave her by advising her that it would be a good idea. Her mother who dedicated herself to the sale of book to support her family set the example, which impelled her to continue moving forward. Currently she is asking for support to purchase more jewelry, which will allow her to offer a better variety to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy goods.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn R. is from the city of Pandan, Gingoog City. She is 33 years old and is married. Ailyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Ailyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alicia Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Alicia Margarita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Medalla Milagrosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito de Pomata, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo.  Alicia tiene estudios de secundaria completa, vive en la plaza de Armas de Pomata.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 06 años,  su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizó para la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 2,000.00 Nuevos soles, Alicia nos indica que una parte del dinero será utilizado para la compra de ganado menor, otra parte para comprar abarrotes para su tienda, y por ultimo también comprará insumos para la preparación de comida. Que es también uno de sus negocios.

Su deseo es comprase una casita en Pomata.

A ella le gusta la ayuda que dan a las mujeres para sacar adelante sus negocios, también le gustan las charlas.
texts.en:
Alicia Margarita belongs to the Communal Bank “Medalla Milagrosa” [“Miraculous Medal”] which is located in the Pomata District, Province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is 58 years old, is a single mother, and has 1 child. Alicia finished secondary school, and lives in La Plaza de Armas in Pomata. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 6 years, and her first loan was of 300 PEN, which she used to purchase minor livestock. Currently she requires a loan of 2,000 PEN. Alicia tells us that one part of the loan will be used to purchase minor livestock, another to purchase groceries for her store, and the last to purchase supplies to prepare food, as this is also one of her businesses. Her dream is to buy a small house in Pomata. She enjoys the help that the Manuela Ramos Movement gives women to move forward with their businesses, and she also likes the discussions.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase minor livestock and groceries.

loans.name: Ruslana

texts.en:
Ruslana is married, with three boys. She is an entrepreneur from the Novomoskovsk region, where she owns several cafes and cafeterias. Ruslana offers public catering services and sells food in her cafeterias. She owns 3 neat and clean cafes in busy neighborhoods, which makes her business very successful.

Ruslana has been in business for 10 years. Presently, she has about 20,000 hryvnias invested in her trade. This time, Ruslana is requesting a loan of 12,800 hryvnias to purchase new microwaves for her cafes. New equipment will improve the quality of service and will help serve customers much faster than before. Ruslana is very energetic. She has a vision and is hoping to implement all of her ideas. We believe all this will help her repay the current loan and succeed in her business endeavors.

loans.use: To purchase new microwaves

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old. Girlie is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Girlie owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Girlie has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Girlie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Girlie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future. Girlie is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Girlie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Félix Antonio B. M.  tiene la edad de 38 años. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Esto surge por la idea de buscar una alternativa de otros ingresos económicos sus propósitos son de mantener a su familia y darle el beneficio de darle un lugar donde vivir ya que con su negocio es que puede salir adelante, sus sueños son edificar su casa y darle las condiciones necesarias. El un hombre muy responsable ya que le preocupa que su hijo obtenga los estudios necesarios. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo de ropa, calzado, perfumes y colonias.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: El señor Adán M. vive con su esposa la señora Alicia Campechano, tienen un hijo de edad escolar, por el cual están luchando día a día para salir adelante, el trabaja en una empresa donde vende y reparte agua purificada desde hace 3 años, su esposa labora para una fabrica en el área de operador con una antigüedad de 2 años, son una familia muy estable y trabajadora, ellos tienen su casita para la cual tienen varios proyectos, el principal de ellos es la construcción de una barda en la parte trasera de su vivienda para mayor protección de la familia; motivo por el cual están solicitando este crédito.
texts.en:
Mr. Adán M. lives with his wife Mrs. Alicia Campechano. They work hard each day so they can provide a good life for their son. Mr. Adán has worked for a company for three years selling and distributing purified water. His wife has worked at a local factory for two years. They are a hard working and stable family. They are also homeowners hoping to complete several home improvement projects. They particularly want to build a wall behind their house for more security, which is why they are soliciting a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall behind their home.

loans.name: Leonarda Yamileth

texts.es: Leonarda Yamileth C. O. tiene la actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Leonarda tiene 42 años y tiene 4 hijos a su cargo, que son la razón por la que ella trabaja tan fuerte. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por cuenta propia, ella empezó a ofrecer ciertos productos como cremas y colonias a ciertas amistades cercanas, por lo que esto le logro dar resultado ya que recogía algo de dinero y esto fue ocupándolo para invertir en más productos. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, ropa, cremas, camisetas, pantalones y perfumes. Su deseo es comprar su propia casita en donde pueda vivir con sus hijos.
texts.en:
Leonarda Yamileth C. O. sells general merchandise. She is 42 years old and cares for her four children, who are the reason for her hard work. She started as an independent businesswoman by offering creams and colognes to a few close friends. This undertaking gave good results and she invested some of her profit in more products.

Leonarda applies for this loan to have working capital to buy shoes, clothes, creams, shirts, pants and perfumes. Her wish is to buy her own small house in which she can live with her children.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosanne

texts.en: Rosanne has been married to her husband, Alvin, for more than three years. They have one child who is two years old. Rosanne is a rice farmer. In November of 2008, she became a member of Community Economic Ventures, Inc., which is now a Kiva partner. She particularly likes the low interest rate offered by the MFI. She applied for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies she needs for her farm to grow.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay K., 57, is married and lives with her six children in the Takeo province. She works in a grocery store, making around US$1.30 each day. Her husband works as a moto-taxi driver. Her husband makes about US$2.60 each day. Food prices have soared in the past year as inflation has gotten out of control in Cambodia. Unfavorable climate conditions have also played a factor in making the price of rice very high. Lay K. is asking for a loan of US$1100 for her husband to purchase a trailer and a motorbike to run a moto-taxi business.

loans.use: To buy a trailer and a motorbike

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes E. is 49 years old and married with seven children.

Agnes sells groceries and drinks in order to meet her immediate family's basic needs and other necessities. She has been in this business for five years. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 Nigerian naira (NGN) to purchase more drinks and groceries to sell. 

She thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en:
Rudy C. is from the village of Quirino, Solano, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 40 years old and single. To make a living, Rudy sells Avon and Natasha cosmetics products. He has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately $138 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rudy joined the Kiva field partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation by engaging in business activities. Rudy is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his 1st loan  from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his general living conditions. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Macarina

texts.en:
Macarina N. is  a 31-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Cabacungan, La Castillana, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a pig farm. Macarina’s husband  is a sound-system operator. They have 7 children who range in age from one to 10 years old. All are currently in school and also help their parents as part of their daily chores.

Macarina joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 in the hope that she would be able to help her  husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income. She now earns an average monthly income of  PHP 2,500 from her work.

Macarina is a member of good  standing of our organization, and has made good use of previous loans for PHP 15,000 to expand her business and improve her family's life. She is now applying for her 13th loan, for PHP 15,000, and hopes to use it to continue provide her family with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros  Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of  thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path  that will ultimately make them Dungganon-- a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through  a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand a pig-farming business

loans.name: Bou

texts.en:
Bou S. was born in 1952 and was married a long time ago, but her husband died of senility. Currently she has two married and three younger children who are no longer in school. One of her daughters is a garment-industry worker. 

To make a living, Bou S. has used her own farmland to farm rice for a profit. Bou S. planted drying rice a month ago and now she lacks a watering system for her crop due to the weather becoming too dry everywhere. Because of this obstacle, Bou S. requested a loan to purchase a pumping machine to irrigate her rice crop.

loans.use: To purchase a pumping machine to irrigate her rice crop

loans.name: Cora Maurelina

texts.es: Cora Maurelina labora en la escuela Miguel Lareynaga como docente en colonia El Serrano, estudia en la universidad URACCAN para prepararse mejor e impartir sus conocimientos a los niños de su comunidad. Ademas realiza actividades agricola y ganadera, en coordinación con su marido y su papá que le brindan su apoyo. Cora Maurelina está solicitando  a AFODENIC, su primer crèdito para la compra de una computadora con sus accesorios, con el objetivo de equipamiento de un medio de trabajo, pues adquirir este equipo le ayudaria en gran manera la realizacion de los materiales que utilizaria para impartir sus clases,  ya que en esta comunidad no hay acceso a estos equipo, Cora es una joven con muchos deseos de superaciòn, con buenas costumbres, honesta y responsable.
texts.en:
Cora Maurelina works as a teacher in the school Miguel Lareynaga, in the district of El Serrano. She is studying at the university URACCAN in order to better prepare herself and impart her knowledge to the children in her community. Additonally, she works with agriculture and livestock, in coordination with her husband and her father who provide her with support. Cora Maurelina is requesting her first credit from AFODENIC in order to purchase a computer with accessories, because acquiring this equipment would help her in a great way for giving her classes, since in her community there is no access to such equipment. Cora is a young woman with a lot of desire to get ahead and good habits, as well as being honest and responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia Albertina pertenece al Banco Comunal “Qory Orcco” D. la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Albertina alterna sus actividades del hogar con la atención D. su molinera.  La socia nos cuenta como es su trabajo cotidiano, ella compra los días domingos D. la ciudad D. Izcuchaca granos como maíz, cebada y trigo y después los lleva a su molinera y los muele luego ella venD. los granos molidos a precios económicos a sus vecinos D. Pucyura. La socia requiere el crédito para aumentar su capital D. negocio, específicamente ella comprara trigo, cebada y maíz.        

Albertina es socia fundadora del banco comunal “”Qory Orcco”  hace 3 años, pero por motivos D. negocios se fue a la ciudad D. Puerto Maldonado donD. se dedico a la venta D. comida en el mercado. Albertina actualmente regreso a la ciudad D. Pucyura a retomar sus negocios.     

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.

(La ciudad D. Pucyura es distrito D. la ciudad D. Anta del Departamento del Cusco, Pucyura se encuentra ubicada a 40 minutos D. la ciudad D. Cusco).
texts.en:
Albertina, 56, is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Qory Orcco" communal bank. She is married and has four children. Albertina sees both to her domestic chores and to tending her mill. She described her daily routine for us: Every Sunday she buys grains like corn, barley and wheat in the city of Izcuchaca. Then, she takes the grain to her mill and grinds it. She then sells the ground product at affordable prices to her neighbors in Pucyura. She needs funding to buy wheat, barley and corn. Albertina was a founding member of the "Qory Orcco" communal bank three years ago. However, due to business needs, she moved to Puerto Maldonado where she sold food in the market. Currently, however, Albertina has returned to Pucyura to retake her business here. She is grateful with the opportunity provided by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. (The city of Pucyura is a district in the city of Anta, Cusco department; it is 40 minutes away from Cusco)

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat, barley and corn.

loans.name: Nellie's Group

texts.en:
Nellie Q. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is the leader of a three-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Nellie Q. Group.
Nellie is 61 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Nellie owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Nellie has been engaged in her business for over 31 years and earns approximately 4,900 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2005, Nellie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Nellie is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her eighth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Taofeek

texts.en:
Taofeek sells tires to make a living in Ibadan, Oyo state, Nigeria. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He hopes to grow his business to become bigger and stronger. He has been in this tires business for a long time and he is well known in his community.

Taofeek is 41 years old and is married with four children. His children are excelling in school and this gives him joy. He is requesting a loan of N150,000 to purchase more tires to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tires to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of pea seed, manure, and insecticides

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 56 años, es madre de 5 hijos mayores, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo. Su actividad cotidiana de Flor, es la venta de ropa y calzados, negocio que le dedica todas las tardes, yendo a las casa de sus clientes llevando la mercadería previamente solicitada y al cabo de 15 días empieza con la cobranza. Está contenta con el trabajo que realiza, sobre todo por la modalidad negocio que hace, permitiéndole captar mayores ganancias, además le da la facilidad de disponer su tiempo, ya que así puede apoyar a su esposo en el alquiler de maderas, puesto que él es albañil. Lo que más le atrae de su oficio, es apreciar la diversidad de prendas que obtiene, sin embargo hay mercadería que no logra vender, de esta manera es que ha logrado trabajar por más de 15 años en este negocio. En adelante le gustaría tener su galería de ropa en su casa y no tener que salir a ofrecer. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP y renueva su compromiso de seguir pagando como hasta ahora. En su grupo solidario es una compañera muy responsable y preocupada por el bienestar y el desarrollo de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará edredones y cubre camas al por mayor, para así cumplior con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Flor is 56 years old, the mother of 5 grown-up children, and lives in her own house with her husband. Her daily activity is selling clothing and shoes, a business to which she devotes her afternoons, going to her clients' houses with the requested merchandise. After 15 days have passed, she begins collecting payments. She is content with her job, because it allows her to earn a good income and also provides her with free time. Therefore, she is able to help support her husband, who is a bricklayer. The thing that most attracts her to this trade is appreciating the diversity of the garments that she obtains. However, there is merchandise that she cannot manage to sell. Despite this, she has worked in this business for over 15 years. In the future, she would like to have a clothing store in her house, so she doesn't have to go out to sell her merchandise. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she renews her commitment to continue making her payments as she has done up to this point. In her solidarity group, she is a very responsible partner and concerned for the well-being and development of her activity. With the loan she is now requesting, she will purchase comforters and bed sheets wholesale, in order to fulfill her clients' requests.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets and comforters

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok O. is a villager in Kamnab village in Kandal province and she is 31 years old. She is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Her problem is that it is time to plant, but she does not have enough money to start this year's crop. So to improve the production of rice, Mrs. Sok O. is asking for a loan for her farm in order to increase the rice yield this current year. Her husband, Mr. Sambath Mech, is a construction worker. She is the mother of two children who are both too small to work or study. On the day of the loan disbursement, Mrs. Sok O. was busy working in the field, so her husband, Mr. Sambath Mech, received the loan for her. The photo above shows Mrs. Sok O.'s husband.

loans.use: To start a crop this year

loans.name: Soy's Group

texts.en: This group has four people who live in Preak Ta Pov village in Kandal province.  Soy H. is the group leader.  Group members will use a portion of the loan to run their own businesses.  Soy owns a massage shop and she also sells food. Since her business is going well she wants to expand.  Soy is seeking for a loan to buy some chairs and a table to support her massage shop.  She is a widow who supports two children by herself.  One sells beer and the other works with her mother.

loans.use: Buy chairs and table to support her massage shop.

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es: Gonzalo H. de 59 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su grupo familiar el cual esta conformado por su esposa la cual trabaja vendiendo fruta en el mercado de Santa Tecla, y junto a sus dos hijos. Gonzalo se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, de forma ambulante, las cuales comercializa por diferentes colonias de Santa Tecla, día tras día Gonzalo trabaja con la ilusión de poder contar con más ventas, las cuales beneficien a su familia y así mismo su negocio, ya que esto le permite poder invertir un poco más en el. Es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual cuente con el monto de dinero necesario para poder comprar mayor variedad de frutas y verduras, y todas por mayor. Así mismo Gonzalo desea comprar huevos por mayor, esto con el fin de poder brindar más productos a sus clientes, ya que los huevos son muy solicitado, es por esto que desea invertir en estos, así de esta manera podrá ofrecerles a sus clientes un mejor servicio en el cual complazca todas las necesidades de ellos y de esta forma contar con toda la confianza de consumidores, lo cual se traduzca en más ventas para Gonzalo.
texts.en:
Fifty-nine year old Gonzalo H. resides in the Santa Tecla municipality, located in the La Libertad department. He lives with his family, made up of his wife, who works selling fruit in the Santa Tecla market, and his two kids. Gonzalo itinerantly sells fruits and vegetables, which he markets in different Santa Tecla neighborhoods. Day after day he works with the hope of counting more sales. This benefits his family and his business, since it allows him to invest a little more in it. This is why he asks for a loan, to have the money necessary to purchase more of a variety of fruits and vegetables, and by wholesale. Gonzalo also wants to buy eggs by wholesale with the goal of being able to provide more products to his clients, since eggs are in demand. This is why he wants to invest in eggs, so that he will be able to offer his clients better service. In this way, Gonzalo will fulfill all of their necessities and so count on the confidence of his customers, which will transform into more sales for him.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits, vegetables, and eggs by wholesale

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: By God In Power I Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “By God in Power I” group. They are women with small-scale businesses based in Waterloo, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. They are seeking a loan of SLL 4,700,000 for the entire group to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living.

The leader of this group is Lamrana B. who is age thirty-one. She was born in Waterloo, near Freetown. She is married to a businessman and they have three children.

For fifteen years now, Lamrana has been selling vegetable oil, rice, Margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. With the help of this loan, she will buy more oil, rice and Margi wholesale to add to her stock.

loans.use: To buy more oil, rice and Margi wholesale to add to her stock

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El Sr. Simon, vive en la Ciudad de Santa Cruz, por el Barrio los Olivos Zona Santos Dumont, vive con su esposa que es ama de casa y sus cuatros hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, vive en casa familiar. El Sr. Simon tiene la actividad de maestro albañil - pintor, actualmente se encuentra realizando la contrución y pintado de un inmueble, tiene un contrato, el prestamo solicitado sera destinado en la compra de una amoladora para su trabajo, que es de muchas utilidad para cortar fierro, ya que esta recibiendo bastantes solicitudes de trabajos, su objetivo es seguir trabajando para poder llegar a comprarse su lote y constriur su propia casita, es muy trabajador siempre pensando en el bienestar de toda su familia, esta muy agradecido con la institucion por darle un apoyo.
texts.en:
