Señor Simon lives in the city of Santa Cruz near the Los Olivos neighborhood in the Santos Dumont zone. He lives with his wife, who is a housewife, and their 4 school age children. He lives in the family home. He is a master mason/painter. Currently, he is working on the construction and painting of a building for which he has a contract. He is receiving a lot of requests for work, so he is soliciting a loan to buy a grinder, which is very useful for cutting iron. His goal is to continue working in order to buy a lot where he can build his own house. He is very hard-working, always thinking of the well-being of his family. He is very grateful to the organization for supporting him.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a grinder

loans.name: Fatoumata Moussa's Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKADI 7  sont des femmes mariées  qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 38ans ont en moyenne 4  enfants et  vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygames à COMOROW un des villages de la commune de LOULOUNI dans la sous préfecture  de LOULOUNI, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués.
FATOUMATA MOUSSA D., la présidente du groupe,  fait la culture du riz.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et les petits matériels pour entretenir : 0,5hectare. 
Les productions sont vendues au niveau du village et au marché de LOULOUNI après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 25.000FCFA en fin de  campagne, qui lui permettra de payer son prêt  et aussi d’aider la famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
Elle souhaite entretenir  cette collaboration avec Soro Yiriwaso afin d’ exploiter un espace cultural encore plus grand pour mieux en tirer plus de gains.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi 7 group are married women who average 38 years of age and have an average of four children each; the majority of them live in polygamous families in Comorow, one of the villages in the municipality of Loulouni, which lies in the sub-prefecture of Loulouni, the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to manage successfully their agricultural activities during the winter season. They are on their fourth loan from the institution and the three previous loans were all repaid correctly. Fatoumata Moussa D., the president of the group, cultivates rice. With her loan, she is planning to buy agricultural intrants and small equipment to maintain her half a hectare of land. Once the crop has been harvested, it is sold to a customer base made up of men and women in the village and at the market in Loulouni. She is planning to make an average profit of 25,000 FCFA at the end of the season, which will allow her to reimburse her loan and also to help her family with the daily expenses. She would like to continue this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, in order to be able to cultivate a larger area of land and make more money.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of intrants and small farming materials

loans.name: Patricidra

texts.en: Patricidra S. is from the village of Rizal. She is 58 years old, married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Patricidra owns and operates a business selling personal products from Avon and MSE in the local community. Patricidra has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2008, Patricidra joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Patricidra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Patricidra is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Patricidra from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Didier

texts.es: Didier Q. B., tiene la edad de 29 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa y un hijo de 2 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales para hacer producir los cultivos de la finca (hortalizas), la idea es mejorar y aumentar la capacidad de producción y aumentar el área del cultivo.  Don Didier cuenta con área tiene diversos cultivos como: culantro, lechuga, rábano, apio, entre otros. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento y lograr una mejor calidad y  obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de su cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Didier también trabaja desde hace varios años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una mayor estabilidad económica, y así poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Didier Q. B., 29, is married and lives with his wife and 2-year-old son. He needs the loan to buy supplies to help his vegetable crops grow. The idea is to improve and enlarge production capacity and to expand the planted area. Didier has space for several kinds of crops: coriander, lettuce, radish and celery, among others. He wants to provide his crops with proper care and maintenance to obtain the best quality so that when he sells his crops he’ll get the best possible price for them. This is the first time he’s negotiated a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the loan terms he was offered. He has been a farmer for several years. He hopes to improve his quality of life in the future and to have better economic stability in order to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Daisy Caballa Group

texts.en:
Daisy C. is from the village of Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Daisy is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Daisy C. Group.

Daisy is married and has 5 adult children. To make a living, Daisy owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Daisy has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 10,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Daisy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Daisy is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Daisy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en:
Amal is a student from Jenin who studies in Arab American University of Jenin. Amal's husband supports her and cover all her education expenses, but for personal reasons her husband couldn't pay next course's tuition fees. Amal came to FATEN and took $1000 for this purpose.

Amal is a good student and full of hopes of finishing school to start work as she is married and would like to contribute to her household responsibilities. 
Amal appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: Pay tuition fees

loans.name: San Pedro Sur Group

texts.es:
el grupo San Pedro Sur esta ubicado en la ciudad de Choluteca, integrado por tres mujeres muy trabajadoras y dedicadas a sus familias, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan;

la sra. Esperanza de Jesus F. es una mujer emprenderora, a pesar de su edad es muy trabajadora, es madre de 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, trabaja duro para mantener la casa.
Esperanza se dedica a moler maiz, su esposo tambien le ayuda con el trabajo moliendo maiz, sus tiempos libres se lo dedica a la iglesia.

doña Julia E. P. se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, es madre de 2 hijos los cuales ya estan en edad mayor, todos los dias se levanta las 5 de la mañana  para atender a sus clientes.
junto con su esposo se ayudan mutuamente para salir adelante.
su tiempo libre lo dedica a visitar a sus hijos.

doña  Leticia P. M. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, es madre de 4 hijos, los cuales tienen edad pequeña. Leticia cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo para sacar adelante su familia.
su esposo  se dedica  a la construcion, Leticia en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia.
el credito lo utilizaran para comprar ropa, repuestos y abarroteria.
texts.en:
The San Pedro Sur group is based in the city of Choluteca and consists of three women who are very hardworking and dedicated to their families. Below are details on each one of them:

Esperanza de Jesus F. is an enterprising woman. Despite her age she is very hardworking. She has 5 grown up children and works hard to support her household. Esperanza grinds corn and her husband helps her. In her free time she helps at the church. 

Julia E. P. sells popular consumer products. She runs a small store from her home. She has 2 grown up children. Every day she gets up at 5 in the morning to see to her customers. She and her husband support each other to prosper. In her free time she visits her children. 

Leticia P. M. sells second hand clothing. She has 4 young children. Leticia's husband, who works in the construction sector, also supports her. In her free time Leticia goes to church. 

They will use the loan to buy clothing, spare pats and groceries.

loans.use: Ourchase of clothing, mill spare parts, soft drinks, butter, oil, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, biscuits, juice, sweets, corn and wheat flour, soups, noodles, toilet paper, toothpaste, candles, matches and batteries.

loans.name: Elizabeth Adjoa Adjeiwa

texts.en: Elizabeth Adjoa Adjeiwa A. sells smoked and fried fish at Abura.  Elizabeth has junior high educational background. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a driver. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. The loan will be used to buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to reinvest her additional income.

loans.use: buy more fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Marianita Esther

texts.es:
Marianita de 46 años, vende pescados. Vive con sus dos hijos  en Primavera de Duran (zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil). 

Hace 5 años atrás el hermano de Marianita comenzó a comprar pescados en Encabao a un precio muy económico para venderlos en la ciudad.  Debido a la necesidad ella le compraba los pescados a su hermano y los vendía a sus vecinos poco a poco obtuvo una clientela fija para vender los pescados y mariscos. En la actualidad vende la liba de pescado a $ 2.90, la libra de camarón a $ 2.80 las ventas de los mariscos la realiza por pedido. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pescados, camarones, ostión para que sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere comprar un carro para hacer por pedido mas frecuentes.
texts.en:
Marianita, age 46, sells fish. She lives with her two children in Primavera de Duran, a periurban area outside of Guayaquil that has a deteriorating ecosystem.

Five years ago, Marianita’s brother began buying fish in Encabao at a very affordable price to sell in the city. She decided to buy fish from her brother to sell to her neighbors. Gradually over time she built up an established customer base for selling fish and shrimp. She currently sells fish for $2.90 per pound and shrimp for $2.80 per pound. Her seafood sales are made by request.

With this loan Marianita wants to acquire fish, shrimp, and oysters so that her customers will have more variety from which to buy. In the future, she wants to purchase a car so that she can make more frequent deliveries.

loans.use: Purchase fish, shrimp, and oysters

loans.name: Amer

texts.ar:
عامر عمره 33 سنة فهو متزوج وله 2 ولدان يحب عائلتها فهي كل اهتماماته بالاضافة الى عمله الذي له فيه اكثر من 10 سنوات 
فهو يعمل في دهان السيارات  يحب مصلحته وقد تتطور بها منذ ان بدء لكنه يحلم بأن يصبح له المكان الخاص به للعمل فهو يريد من خلال طلب قرض
له من المجموعة الى شراء كومبراسور هواء +  واجهات للمحل + عدة يدوية لكي يطور مصلحته لقد تلقى عامر دعم كبير من العائلة يتميز بعمله بالجودة والمثابرة
له زبائن من محيطه وجيرانه واصدقاءه عائلته تحتاج الى تطوره لكي تتطور معه
texts.en: Amer is 33 years old. He is married with two children. Amer loves his family and work. He has been working in the auto repair business for more than 10 years. Amer has been able to develop his work, but aspires to own a private business. Through a loan from Al Majmoua, he wants to purchase an air compressor, shop signage and a tool kit, which will help him start his own business. Amer has received great support from his family. He is diligent, active and persistent. His clients are his neighbors and friends. Amer’s family supports his development as it will enhance their income and status.

loans.use: Purchase an air compressor, shop signage, and a tool kit

loans.name: The Juliet Asuncion Group

texts.en:
Juliet A. is from the village of Sinippil, Reina Mercedes, Isabela. Juliet is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Juliet is 39 years old and married and with four school-aged children. To make a living she owns and operates a general store. Her main source of income comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

Juliet joined ASKI in 2009 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase products to sell. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP also to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Juliet from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products to sell

loans.name: Ayanou

texts.fr: M. K.  a 39 ans  et est marié. Il a en charge  3 enfants. Il est né à Ahépé et habite  quartier Adidogomé.  Il   fait le commerce de produits congelés et cumule déjà  5 ans. Il s’approvisionne à Togo frigo et revend les produits dans une boutique devant son domicile mais il n’a pas de stocks. Il compte acheter 6 cartons de Sardinelles, 12 cartons de chinchards et 4 cartons de Tilapias.
texts.en: Mr K., aged 39, is married. He cares for three children. He was born in Ahépé and lives now in the neighborhood of Adidogomé. He sells frozen foods and has a five-year experience in this trade. He gets his supplies from the company Togo Frigo and resells them in his store in front of his home. But he ran out of inventory. He intends to buy 6 boxes of sardinella, 12 boxes of chinchard and 4 boxes of tilapia.

loans.use: To buy frozen foods

loans.name: Luís Alfredo

texts.es:
Luís Alfredo T. C. tiene 38 años, es casado, vive con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. DIVINO NIÑO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Estero Lindo pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Luís Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz cacao y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Farma-Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa

Le gusta compartir con su  familia
texts.en:
Luís Alfredo T. C. is 38 years old, he is married and he lives with his in Ventanas, a canton of the Los Ríos province. He has 4 children.

The V.R.C. Divino Niño (Divine Child Communal Bank) is located in the Estero Lindo precinct, located in the Ventanas canton; it is composed of 12 members who engage in short-cycle agricultural labor, growing crops like maize and rice.

Luís Alfredo engages in agriculture, sowing maize, cocoa and rice. He buys his products in the Farma-Agro and sells them in the same place.

The loan he is requesting will be used to sow maize and rice by buying supplies and seeds. The loan will help him economically, as thanks to it he will fulfill his needs, as well as face challenges such as pests, illnesses and climate changes. He dreams of buying a house.

He likes spending time with his family.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and four school-aged children. He started to work in the car mechanics field 27 years ago.  He is the only income source for the family. He repairs different types of cars. Due to his long experience in this field, he has been able to gain a good number of clients passing by his garage asking for his services. 

 Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase required machinery and tools so that he can complete his work competently, allowing him to increase his income.

loans.use: to purchase required machinery and tools

loans.name: Husein

texts.ar:
حسين في عمر 35 سنة يعمل في تصليح السيارات له في عمله 16 سنة متزوج وله ولد يحب عائلته وهي مصدر استمراره يريد دائما التجدد والتطور في العمل يسعى الى تحسين وضع عائلته وتطوير عمله فهو مجد نشيط وله زبائن كثر يقصدونه من جيرانه واقاربه 
يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى استأجار محل جديد وشراء بضاعة جديدة لتطوير العمل وزيادة الزبائن يتميز بالصدق
والمعاملة الطيبة مع كل زبائنه وهو يتقن عمله بشكل جيد جدا
texts.en: Husein is a 35 year old mechanic who has been in the business for 16 years. He is married and has a son. He loves his family very much, and this is why he strives to develop his business, as he wants to improve their opportunities. He has many loyal clients amongst his relatives and neighbours. With this loan he hopes to rent a new shop and buy new goods to help develop his business and increase his clientèle. He is known for his honesty and good customer service, and is a diligent and skilled worker.

loans.use: Rent new shop and purchase new goods

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio, de 22 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su pareja Mayra (19); a pesar de su juventud busca progresar cada día. 

Cuando era muy pequeño observaba a su abuela que atendía en su panadería, y con el pasar de los años cuando empezó a trabajar no dudo en instalar un sala de  panadería en su casa, desde entonces tiene dos  ayudantes que preparan toda clase de panes. Y luego comercializa su mercadería a los panaderos ambulantes de la zona; le gusta mucho el negocio porque es rentable ya que le permite ahorrar y pagarles a sus trabajadores. Además paralelamente a la administración de su panadería, se desempeña como albañil y trabaja por horas en diversas obras de construcción; a pesar de su juventud tiene grandes planes para el futuro como por ejemplo estudiar educación, además de instalar  una panadería estable, donde pueda vender en un lugar fijo, sin necesidad de desplazarse. 

Julio tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de ingredientes (harina, huevos, manteca, entre otros) al por mayor que necesita para continuar preparando sus panes y pastelillos pues dice que se acerca la época escolar y tiene bastante salida. 

Es el tercer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.
texts.en:
Julio, 22, lives in his own house alongside his life partner, Mayra, 19.  Despite his youth, he strives to progress daily.

When he was little he watched his grandmother run her bakery.  As years went by and he started to work he didn’t hesitate to set up a bakery in his house.  Since then, he has two assistants that prepare all kinds of bread.  He sells his merchandise to area bread peddlers.  He enjoys his business very much because it’s profitable, allowing him to save and pay his workers.  In addition to running his bakery, he also works as a bricklayer working hourly at various construction projects.  Despite his youth, he has great plans for the future.  For example, to study Education and set up a stable bakery where he can sell from a fixed locale and not have to travel around.

Julio plans to use the requested funds to buy ingredients (flour, eggs and lard, among others) at wholesale that he needs to continue making bread and pastries since the new school term is approaching and sales increase quite a bit.

This is his 3rd loan with MFP and he promises to pay his installments punctually because he does not want to disappoint the people who made the money possible that will allow him to stay in business in search of progress.

loans.use: For flour, eggs and lard, among others.

loans.name: Marcos Tulio

texts.es:
Don Marcos de 47 años de edad, reside en  Puerto el Triunfo departamento de Usulután, se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando maíz, pipián y plátanos, vive con su esposa y dos nietos que está a su cargo, él aprendió de su padre la actividad agrícola, hoy día tiene 26 años de estar dedicándose por completo a la siembras, de las cuales comercializa y de sus ganancias mantiene a su familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para el alquiler del terreno, para realizar la siembra, el piensa alquilar dos parcelas de tierra para 5 años, al igual que comprar insumos para el mantenimiento del cultivo, esta ayuda es muy importante para él, pues lograra continuar con su trabajo y dar en cuido necesario para tener una buena producción.
El objetivo de don Marcos es aumentar el tamaño de terreno para cultivar, ya que así podrá sembrar más y tener una mayor cosecha, este será un gran aporte para su familia ya que dependen de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Marcos is 47 years old and lives in Puerto el Triunfo, in Usulután department.  He works as a farmer, growing corn, 'pipián' (a type of squash) and bananas.  He lives with his wife and two grandchildren who are in his care.  Marcos learned how to farm from his father and he has been working on his own crops for 26 years.  He sells his crops and uses the profits to support his family.

Marcos is currently requesting a loan to rent some land so that he can sow it.  He is thinking of renting two plots of land for 5 years.  He will also buy some supplies to maintain his crops.  This help is very important to him since it will enable him to continue with his work and provide necessary care to his crops so that he achieves a good production.  Marcos' goal is to increase the size of the land that he works on as this will enable him to grow more and enjoy bigger harvests.  This will be a great support for his family since they depend on his work.

loans.use: to pay rent for some land so that he can grow crops on it

loans.name: Juan Rafael

texts.es:
Juan Rafael R. G., tiene la edad de 54 años de edad, está casado  y vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa que son sus mayores prioridades. El pretende comprar con el dinero cerdos para el engorde y mejorar las instalaciones de sus chiqueros para tenerlos en mejores condiciones para su explotacion. El cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para seguir adelante con el proyecto y fortalecerlo aun más. El pretende generar ganancias para su bienestar familiar y darles una vida más digna y con mayores facilidades a sus hijos, al igual darles es estudio para que sean unos profesinaloes en el futuro.  
Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Rafael R. G., 54, is married living with his two children and his wife who are his main priorities.  He intends to use the money to buy pigs to raise and to improve the pigsties to have them in better condition for their exploitation.  He has the required experience to continue forward with the project and strengthen it still more.  He intends to generate profits for his family’s wellbeing and provide them with a more proper life and more ease for his children as well as a good education so that they will become professionals in the future.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR.   He hadn’t had any previous loans with state banks but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to improve the pigsties.

loans.name: Jadambaa

texts.en: Jadambaa is 57 years old, and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live together in a house that they built recently. His oldest daughter Oyunbileg, 32, graduated her university in Germany and works at Mongolian international airport as a foreign relations officer and his youngest daughter Anand, 18, attends a local secondary school. Jadambaa has worked at Mongolian Airlines as a storekeeper since 2002. He built a house by using his salary after he purchased his apartment. He is a very hardworking person who has good communication skills. He is requesting a loan to purchase constructiion materials to fix his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction material to fix his house

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John O. S. is fifty-six years old and married to a teacher. He and his wife have four children between twelve and seven years old whom they hope to give a good education, up to the university level. 

His business is located in a busy market in Nairobi. He owns a shop well known as Bojso Investment where he makes and sells picture frames, furniture and metal items which include doors and windows. He has been in this business for ten years now and has managed to give employment to six people. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is financial constraints; at times he lacks the raw materials to make the items that he sells. 

However, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy wood for making furniture to sell to his customers. He hopes to open outlets in other towns. He sees himself become a millionare in the future. He describes himself as dedicated and God fearing.

loans.use: to buy wood for making furniture

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: Amalia tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Es una madre de familia muy dedicada a cuidar de sus hijos, ella es capaz de sacrificar muchas cosas por ellos y esta por esta razón que dedica en la venta de animales entre carneros y cerdos; asimismo cría estos animales en su propia casa, actividad que lo realiza desde hace 5 años. Por otro lado también se dedica a la venta de carne de pollo en un puesto de mercado que se encuentra en la ciudad. Su morada es humilde pero reina la armonía de una familia unida en donde su esposo es un humilde triciclero que ofrece servicio de carga en el mercado, muchas veces los ingresos diarios no satisfacen las necesidades es por ello que trabaja en la venta de sus animales para que los pueda vender a buen precio en la feria ganadera de su zona, siendo un apoyo económico que solventa su hogar. Amalia y su esposo son concientes de que solo una buena educación será la que compense su arduo trabajo ya que muchas veces el no tener un oficio dificulta obtener un buen empleo; por ello se compromete a ofrecer a sus 4 hijos una buena educación que les permita enfrentar la vida con éxito. Por el momento su esfuerzo ya esta dando sus frutos por lo que ha decidió tener más animales. Es su crédito número  10  que tiene con MFP, en todo este tiempo de trabajo ha visto las ventajas de formar parte de su banco comunal, una de ellas que  adquirir el hábito del ahorro de la cual esta muy agradecida. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más animales y otra parte en la venta de menudencias de pollo que realiza.
texts.en:
Amalia, 42 years old, lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. As a mother she is very dedicated to caring for her children, and is capable of sacrificing a lot for them. For this reason she sells animals including rams and pigs. She raises the animals in her home. She has done this for 5 years now. In addition, she sells meat from chickens in a stall at the market in the city. Her home is humble but filled with the harmony of a united family. Her husband is a humble tricyclist who offers services carrying loans in the market. Often his daily income does not meet their needs. That's why Amalia works selling animals so that she can get a good price for them at the cattle fairs in the area, which supports her family economically. 

Amalia and her husband are aware that only a good education will be the reward for their hard work, since many times not having a trade makes it difficult to get a job. That's why she has made the commitment to offer her 4 children a good education that will allow them to be successful in life. At the moment her efforts are already bearing fruit which is why she wants to have more animals. This is her 10th loan with MFP. In all of this time that shes been working she's seen the advantages of being part of the village bank. One of them is acquiring the habit of saving which is very grateful for. With the loan that she requested, she will invest in the purchase of more animals and also in the sale of chicken parts.

loans.use: to buy animals and invest in selling chickens.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun resides in Prey Veng province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice producing regions in Cambodia. Oun is a housewife while her husband is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family's expenses. 

Each month, the family has to spend USD 20 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. Oun is requesting a loan of USD 1200 to purchase a plot of farmland to improve her family's farming business. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland.

loans.name: Badenyaton Ii Group

texts.fr:
BADENYATON II est un regroupe de femmes mariées du village de  BIMAWERE dans la préfecture de SAN région de SEGOU quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 37  ans, au moins 6 enfants et cultivent  de l’arachide du gombo, du bisaps etc. Dans le souci de rentabiliser leurs exploitations agricoles, les membres du groupe BADENYATON II ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 2 ans. Après avoir correctement remboursé  les  prêts précédents, elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de campagne.
SALI, qui est debout, troisième à droite la main sur la tête de l’enfant,  compte utiliser le prêt actuel pour acheter, des semences d’arachide,  payer les frais de labour et sarclage,  des petits matériels et des intrants agricoles pour la culture, au grand marché de Kimparana. Après l’hivernage, les récoltes sont stockées pendant un certain  temps pour qu’elles aient de la valeur avant d’être vendues  au grand marché de Kimparana et  dans les  marchés  environnants, en détail (souvent en gros), au comptant  à une clientèle venant généralement des grandes villes.
Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser chacune, après l’écoulement de leurs produits agricoles, un bénéfice de 19500 à 22000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
BADENYATON II is a group of married women from the village of BIMAWERE, in the prefecture of SAN, Region of SÉGOU (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women live in traditional families, and they average 37 years of age and have at least six children. The group members grow peanuts, okra, and hibiscus flowers, etc.

Concerned about making their plantations profitable, the group members decided to join the loan program of the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. After having properly repaid their previous loans, they are now on their second farm loan.

SALI, who is standing third from the right in the photo with her hand placed on her child’s head, intends to use the current loan to pay for plowing and weeding and to buy a sufficient amount of peanut seeds, sundry supplies and equipment, and some inputs for farming. These items are purchased at the main market of Kimparana. 

After wintertime, the harvested crops are stocked for a certain time, so that they gain value. And then they are sold retail (and often in bulk) and for cash at the main market of Kimparana and at surrounding markets. The customers generally come from large cities.

After selling the produce, the group members each plan on making a profit of 19,500 to 22,000 francs CFA that will be used for repaying the loan interest and for covering typical family expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds, and tools and to pay for labor

loans.name: Ezinabala Development Group

texts.en: 30-year-old Teddy has been in a fruits and vegetables sales business for 7 years now. The happily married mother of 3 runs her business from Lugazi in central Uganda. She says she got inspired by a friend to start this business. Before that, fish selling was what occupied most of her time. Weekly she says this business generates profits totaling about 150,000 KES (~$  ). With this loan she says she is going to purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell. In the group photo, one male member's face was partly obscured. I marked him as Unpictured.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Djiguisseme 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les six  membres du groupe DJIGUISSEME  4 sont  des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et  en moyenne 1 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Fissaba, un des villages de la commune de Massigui, préfecture de Dioïla, région de Koulikoro, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont entre autres le riz et l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt,   DIARATOU MOUSSA, qui debout au milieu enfant au dos, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de riz et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de  Massigui après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 35.000FCFA environs par campagne.
texts.en:
The six members of the Djiguisseme 4 group are married women, on average 32 years old with 1 child each. They live for the most part in polygamous households in Fissaba, one of the villages in the district of Massigui in the Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro region, which is the second administrative region in Mali.
They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better organize their businesses at the start of the rainy season. The crops they grow include, among others, rice and peanuts. They are on their fifth loan collaboration with the institution.
With this new loan, Diaratou Moussa, who is standing in the middle with a child on her back in the photo, intends to buy agricultural inputs and small equipment and pay for labour costs to manage about 0.5 hectares of rice and peanuts.
After the harvest, the produce is sold district-wide in Missagui to a clientele composed of men and women. Each member intends to realize an average profit of about 35,000 FCFA for the season.

loans.use: To pay for labour, seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, and small equipment.

loans.name: Edith Akomou

texts.fr:
Édith est mariée et a à charge 4 enfants, qui évoluent très bien à l'école. Elle réside en location avec ses enfants et son mari qui est chauffeur en service à SIBEAU, une société de la place. Elle est aidée dans le ménage par son mari en ce qui concerne les charges du ménage. 
Dotée d'une expérience d'au moins 16 ans, Édith prépare et vend de divers mets dans une boutique à son domicile sise à Calavi. A ceci, elle a associé la distribution des tissus de marques HITAGET, VLISCO et autres à des habitants de sa zone commerciale et de ses environs. Édith fait ses approvisionnements au marché international du Bénin nommé Tokpa. Elle sollicite et obtient le renouvellement d'un appui financier à FINADEV pour le développement de son activité afin de faire face aux besoins de sa clientèle. Elle est maintenant à son 3ème crédit. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ledit appui lui permettra d'améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Édith souhaiterait voir son commerce connaître de l'évolution dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
Édith is married and supports four children, who are doing very well in school. She rents a place with her children and husband, who is a driver at SIBEAU, a local company. She is aided at home by her husband when it comes to household expenses. 

Priviledged with at least sixteen years of experience, Édith makes meals and sells them in a stall outside her home located in Calavi. Along with this, she has included the distribution of fabrics with the brand names of HITAGET, VLISCO, and others. Her customers are those living in her commercial district and nearby. She stocks up at the international market of Benin called Tokpa. 

Édith requested and received the renewal of a loan at FINADEV for developing her business, so as to cope with the needs of her customer. She is now on her third loan. The extra revenues generated by this financial support will enable her to improve her family’s living conditions. Édith would like to see her business experience progress in the future.

loans.use: to buy five 25-kg sacks of rice, two sacks of beans, and thirty length of cloth

loans.name: Pv Pub Group

texts.en:
Shani is in her mid-30s and married with four children who go to school. She has been running a business selling fried chicken and chips for 6 years now. She works from 5pm to midnight (evening only) and is able to make a small monthly profit.
 
This will be her first loan from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying more chicken and a sack of potatoes for her business. Her dream is to one day be able to have a good hotel for selling different types of foods.

She will share this loan with her loan group "PV Pub" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy more chicken and a sack of potatoes for her business.

loans.name: Alfonsa

texts.en:
Alfonsa works hard to support her family. Alfonsa is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment. 

Alfonsa has been in this business for five years. 

In the future, Alfonsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Melicia

texts.es:
Melicia es socia del  Banco Comunal “Mujeres al Progreso de Juli”, ubicado en el distrito de Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.  Cuneta con educación primaria.
La señora se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir como casacas, chompas de todo tamaño.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/ 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio.
Con éste nuevo préstamo de  S/ 2000.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuarenta piezas de casacas.  La señora nos cuenta que su mercadería la compra de Desaguadero y la vende en la ciudad de Arequipa.  Trabaja sola en el negocio, su esposo trabaja en la chacra y los ganados.
Su sueño es tener más tiendas,  estantes y ser mayorista, además tener un carro para el traslado de su mercadería.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal  es la facilidad del préstamo, los ahorros y las charlas que se les brinda.
texts.en:
Melicia is a member of the Communal Bank "Mujeres al Progreso de Juli", which is located in the district of Juli in the province of Chucuito and department of Puno.  She is 41 years old, and is married with three children.  She has primary-school level education. 

The Señora works selling clothing items such as jackets and sweaters in every size.  Her first loan was for 300 New Soles, money which she invested in her business.  With this new loan of 2,000 New Soles, she will buy forty jackets.  

The Señora tells us that she buys her merchandise in Desaguadero, and sells it in the city of Arequipa.  She works on her own, her husband works on a ranch with cattle.

Her dream is to have more stores and shelves and become a wholesaler, and also to have a vehicle for transporting her merchandise.

What she likes about the Communal Bank is the loan facility, the savings, and the discussions that it provides.

loans.use: to buy forty jackets.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a thirty-three-year old married man with six children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. The responsibility to look after the family is vested in him and his dream is to educate his children. He has been farming for twenty years and the proceeds have facilitated him in providing the basics for his family. His hardship is unpredictable seasons resulting in low output. His desire is to venture into mechanised agriculture. David needs the loan to plough his garden and buy farm inputs.

loans.use: To plough his garden and buy farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy feed for her pigs and groceries to stock her store

loans.name: Diluvina

texts.es:
La señora Diluvina tiene 30 años de edad y tiene un hijo, Diluvina se dedica a la venta de frutas, sus principales clientes son las personas que visitan el mercado municipal de Nacaome, este negocio le genera ganancias para cubrir los gastos de su hijo.
La señora Diluvina se siente muy bien, nos comento que todo le esta saliendo bien, sus ventas son mayores pero necesita el credito para comprar mas frutas y verduras para tener mas surtido su negocio, a veces se queda sin algunas frutas y queda mal con sus clientes.
la meta a corto plazo de Diluvina es colocar otro puesto de venta de frutas y verduras en otro punto estratégico de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Diluvina is 30 years old and has a son.  She sells fruit and her main customers are people who visit the municipal market of Nacaome.  This business provides income to cover the expenses for her son. 

Diluvina is content.  She told us that things are going well.  Her sales are increasing but she needs a loan to purchase more fruit and vegetables to have more selection.  She sometimes runs out of certain fruit and her customers are unhappy.  Her short term goal is to set up another fruit and vegetable stand in another strategic location in town.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, watermelons, plums, bananas, potatoes, avocadoes, plantains, cabbage, and carrots.

loans.name: 2K Suma Ampara Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “2K SUMA AMPARA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Justa. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: cría y venta de conejos, confeción de mantas, bordados de caporal, confección de chamarras y macramé, venta de productos, taller de textiles, tienda de barrio.

La señora Justa,  indica que es primera ves que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de crianza y venta de conejos, la que viene trabajando hace años atrás.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de conejos y construcción de corrales) que adquirirá de la feria 16 de julio y posteriormente los criará en su casa. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The 2K Suma Ampara Community Bank will begin its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Centro Cascada. The group is comprised of eight members led by a Board of Directors headed by Sra. Justa. The members of the association run a variety of businesses such as raising and selling rabbits, making ponchos, embroidery, making jackets, macrame, textile workshop, and running a corner store.

This is the first time that Sra. Justa has worked with Pro Mujer and she was invited to join by the promotor. She has a business raising and selling rabbits, something she’s been doing for many years.

The loan that Justa is seeking will be used to buy rabbits and to make pens for them. She plans to buy them at the 16 de Julio Market and raise them in her house. The income will allow her to support her family; she is married and has five children.

Justa really likes the information about savings and health that she gets from Pro Mujer.

loans.use: to buy rabbits and to make pens

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime de 27 años de edad es soltero y sin compromisos. Vive en la casa de sus padres con algunos de sus hermanos en la comunidad de Pucharini. Jaime se entrega su tiempo y dedicación a dos actividades, una de ellas es la agricultura. En sus parcelas de terrenos agrícolas que su comunidad les designa, siembra piñas, paltas, café y plátanos. Por otro lado, con una camioneta que heredó de sus padres, brinda servicios de transporte a pobladores que trasladan sus productos desde sus comunidades hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki. “Estos dos negocios son rentables, por que de la siembra obtengo cada ciertos meses, pero del transporte saco dinero diario, los dos me convienen”.
Quizás por tener pocas responsabilidades en la vida, Jaime no ha experimentado fracasos hasta el momento, pero aún así anhela tener una familia e hijos, a los que mantendrá y cuidará, “siento que puedo solventar una familia y hacer cargo de ella, es uno de mis deseos para más adelante, además de tener una casa propia”, confiesa algo avergonzado. Mediante su ayuda, Jaime obtendrá su préstamo número 4 de MFP, por esa razón promete ser puntual en sus pagos y constante en la organización y participación en su banco comunal, de l que se siente agradecido. Si se concretiza el crédito, comprará abonos para sus extensas parcelas, lo cual calcula costará 800 soles. Del mismo modo invertirá en semillas de piñas para esta nueva temporada.
texts.en:
Jaime, who is 27 years old, is single and without commitments. He lives in his parents' house with some of his brothers in the community of Pucharini. Jaime gives his time and dedication to two activities; one of them is agriculture. In his parcels of agricultural land that his community designates, he plants pineapples, avocados, coffee, and bananas. On the other hand, with a truck that he inherited from his parents, he offers transportation services to the people who carry their products from their communities to the city of Pichanaki. "These two businesses are profitable, because from the planting I obtain earnings every few months, but the transportation brings in money daily. The two work out well for me."

Perhaps because he has few responsibilities in life, Jaime has not experienced failures up to this time, but even so he yearns to have a family and children, whom he will support and care for. "I feel that I can support a family and be responsible for it. It is one of my desires for the future, besides having my own house," he confess with some embarrassment. Through your help, Jaime will obtain his fourth loan from MFP, and for this reason he promises to be punctual in his payments and steadfast in the organization and participation in his communal bank, for which he feels thankful. If his loan is approved, he will buy fertilizer for his extensive parcels of land, which he calculates will cost 800 PEN. In the same way, he will invest in pineapple seedlings for this new season.

loans.use: to buy pineapple seedlings and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan is 44 years old and lives in West Point.  She discontinued her education in 11th grade.   She is single and has two children 16 and 20 years old.  For the past three years she been operating a cook shop (restaurant) in her community.  She liked the community's response to her business, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, rice, pepper and meat for her restaurant.  Her future plan is to buy a piece of land and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more oil, rice, pepper and meat for her business

loans.name: Boston

texts.en:
Boston is a 34-year-old married man with three school-going children. He owns a house with no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family. 

Boston has operated a retail shop for the past ten years; his potential clients are his neighbors. He dreams of expanding his business.

Boston plans to use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase more stock of maize flour, sugar and soap for resale. He decided to join Yehu because of their fair terms and conditions.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of maize flour, sugar and soap for resale.

loans.name: Orhonbaatar

texts.en:
Orhonbaatar is 39 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger(Mongolian yurt) in Bulgan province, Mongolia. His wife runs a garment retailing business, his eldest kid is a school student and the younger one goes to kindergarten. 

Orhonbaatar started his taxi service business in earlier this year. His business is going well, however, he needs winter tires and his wife needs winter supplies, therefore, he is requesting 1,500,000 MNT. He's family's income is increasing, however now that winter is here, his and his wife's business is slowing down.

loans.use: to buy a winter tires for taxi and supplies for garment business.

loans.name: Luis Gonzalo

texts.es:
Luis Gonzalo tiene 25 años de edad es casado tiene 3 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 6, 4 y 2 años de edad en Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC VENTANAL se encuentra formada en la comunidad Guantuncoto, Parroquia Julio Moreno Cantón Guaranda, a una distancia de 30 minutos de la oficina Los habitantes de la Comunidad se dedican a diferentes actividades como son: agricultura, ganadería, crianza de animales (cerdos, pollos, ovejas) comercio y construcción.
Luis se dedica a la actividad de la agricultura, construcción, crianza de animales y carpintería. Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Guaranda. Solicita el crédito para poder sembrar maíz y darle mantenimiento con los abonos, fertilizantes, urea. 
Con la ayuda del préstamo sería mejor la calidad del producto y podrá apoyar a los hijos para que puedan seguir estudiando.
El sueño es poder tener una casa propia y un  terreno. El desafío que se le ha presentado son los problemas familiares. En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval y Semana Santa.
 Con la ayuda del crédito anterior  los ingresos aumentaron y mejoró la economía de la familia, la producción ha mejorado los productos son de calidad.
texts.en:
25-year old Luis Gonzalo is married and has three children. He lives with his wife and children aged 6, 4, and 2 in Guaranda in the province of Bolivar.

Luis belongs to the Guantucoto community bank in the parish of Julio Moreno in Guaranda canton, located half an hour from the main office. The members of the community work in agriculture, raise livestock such as pigs, chickens, sheep), commerce, and construction.

Luis is a farmer but also works in construction, raises animals, and does carpentry. He is seeking a loan so he can sow his corn crop and buy manure, fertilizer, and urea. The purchases will help to improve the quality of his crops and enable him to support his children so they can continue with their education. 

His dream is to have a house of his own and buy some land. The challenges he faces are the usual ones. In his free time he enjoys going to festivities such as carnivals and Semana Santa.

With previous loan money Luis managed to increase his income and improve his family’s economic situation. His crops were also of better quality

loans.use: to buy corn and supplies such as manure, fertilizer, and urea

loans.name: Fidelis

texts.en:
Fidelis, age 38 years, is married to Annastacia and they are blessed with four children. 

He is a dairy farmer and has been in this business for 13 years. He gets a monthly income of KES 8,700 from the business.

This is his first loan term with KADET. He will use the funds to buy milking cans, deworming medicine and seedlings and to repair the cattle shed.

Fidelis hopes to educate his children. His dream is to grow his business into a large-scale dairy farm in the future.

loans.use: To buy milking cans, deworming medicine and seedlings.

loans.name: Oscar Humberto

texts.es:
Oscar, vive con su esposa y su hijo, él tiene su negocio de productos de primera necesidad en su casa y debido a la demanda de los clientes abre su tienda todos los días de lunes a domingo.
El préstamo lo necesita para incrementar sus productos  y comprar más mercadería como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, sopas instantáneas, café instantáneo y de esa forma podrá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y podrá obtener mejores ingresos.
El objetivo de Oscar es tener un negocio más grande con  variedad y tener éxito dandole lo necesario a su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar lives with his wife and his son.  He has a business selling staple products from his home.  Thanks to customer demand, he opens his store every day from Monday to Sunday.  

He is asking for this loan to increase his products and purchase more merchandise such as rice, beans, sugar, instant soups, and instant coffee.  He will be able to satisfy the needs of his customers and earn a better income.

Oscar's goal is to have a larger business with a variety of products and to be able to provide his family with everything they need.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, instant soups, and instant coffee.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El señor Domingo es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor quien es propietario de una mueblería desde hace 10 años.  El inicio con poco y luego con arduo trabajo fue creciendo su taller donde realiza sillas, mesas, muebles de sala estos los comercializa en Masatepe.
El crédito lo invertirá en materia prima principalmente madera, clavos…barniz…etc.
Él está casado y tiene tres hijos los cuales le ayudan en el negocio en tiempo libre después de clases.
texts.en:
Domingo is a hardworking and enterprising man who has owned his own furniture store for 10 years.  He started out small, and then through hard work he expanded his workshop where he makes chairs, tables, and living room furniture.  He sells his products in Masatepe.

He will invest this loan in raw materials: mainly wood, nails, varnish, etc. 

He is married and has 3 children who help him in the business after school in their free time.

loans.use: to buy wood to make sets of chairs

loans.name: Rehoboth Group

texts.fr: Léontine est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle vend des plats en plastique dans son quartier et cela fait 10 ans qu'elle exerce cette activité. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter des plats de grande taille quantité 10, et aussi des plats de petit modèle quantité 10 également, et diversifiés à 125 000 francs. Le lieu de commerce de Léontine fait face au marché central ce qui fait que la vente de ses plats en plastique marche bien et en plus de cela, elle propose  la qualité à ses clients. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de faire de l'épargne, de s'occuper de sa famille et aussi de continuer ses activités. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt et à rembourser à la date prévue à ACFIME
texts.en:
Léontine is married and has four children. She sells plastic dishes in her neighborhood and has been doing so for ten years. She needs a loan to purchase ten large dishes and also ten small dishes, and various other dishes for 125,000 francs.

Léontine's shop faces the central market which makes her plastic dishes sales successful. In addition, she has quality goods for her customers. After her sales, she would like to have enough profit for savings, to take care of her family, and also to continue her business. She has already received a loan and paid back ACFIME on time.

loans.use: to buy ten large dishes, ten small dishes and various plastic dishes for 125,000 francs.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is married and has two children.She lives in Yombo area of Dar es Salaam.Amina sells fried fish near her residence.She collects fresh fish from Indian Ocean shores,spice and fry them ready for sale.She want to make her  business attractive by improving sanitary conditions of her business premises.The display cage, aluminium wrapping materials and transparent plastic bags will even make her business attractive.This will anable her make more sale and thus more profit.Next year her first born will join secondary school.The increased income will enable her save for school fees.To implement her plan she needs USD 400.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Jamavive

texts.en: A 36-year-old experienced trader, Mrs. Jamevive B. makes foodstuffs available for people in her environment. She will use the loan of $800 to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and drinks for sale

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is a married mother of two children. She is an experienced gardener who knows important secrets for growing healthy vegetables and fruit. She owns a little kiosk where she sells seeds and fertilizers in the market at Kamenka-Dneprovskaya, which is in a large farming area. Yuliya has been in this business for 10 years.

Yuliya’s customers know that she can always give good advice on how to plant seeds and look after plants. This keeps them coming back to her kiosk to get everything they need for the spring gardening season – and some practical tips, too. Eight loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have promoted the growth of Yuliya’s business. Today, as the result of financial assistance, she is the happy owner of a spacious and comfortable vending facility in the central town market. She currently has about $4,000 gross income every month.

Yuliya would like to get a loan for $1,000 to purchase a variety of seeds and fertilizers that will help her increase her clientele and profitability as a result. We believe her ability to follow innovations in farming and gardening and her desire to constantly improve her skills prove she is a dedicated entrepreneur who will succeed despite any difficulties or competition she may face.

loans.use: To purchase new types of seeds and increase variety of fertilizers

loans.name: Sandra Aurora

texts.es:
Sandra is a young entrepreneur. She is married and has a small child. For the past three years, she has been involved in the sale of cosmetics. She started the business because her husband's salary is very low, and not having social security, they needed to save money to pay for her maternity costs. Through her work she was able to cover these costs, and after the birth of her son, her customers continued to request her products. She therefore continued with the business and now has many more customers.

Sandra is seeking a loan of $475 to acquire merchandise for filling current orders and to continue to increase business. She is committed to repaying the loan within 6 months. Become an important part of the development of this business and support Sandra. She and her family will be grateful to you.

Translated from Spanish by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Sandra es una joven emprendedora, ella es casada y tiene un pequeño hijo. Desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, inició porque el salario que recibe su esposo es muy bajo y al no contar con seguro social tenían que ahorrar para pagar los gastos de su maternidad, con base en su trabajo logró cubrir estos gastos y después del nacimiento de su hijo sus clientes continuaron solicitando sus productos, asó que siguió con su negocio y ahora tiene muchos más clientes.

Sandra está solicitando un crédito de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y apoya a Sandra, ella y su familia te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: Acquire merchandise

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
R. is a warm and friendly homemaker who, from the time she came to live in the city of Pucallpa, has sold typical foods from the region. She prepared a small place in her home and offered a variety of food for the enjoyment of the diners. With the passage of time, R. has become well known and has received the recommendation of many of her customers, who pack this small place everyday in the company of friends and family. Seeing how business was going, it occurred to her that she could deliver food to client’s homes, with the goal of keeping them happy. Her husband offered make the deliveries so that she could tend to the customers who come to their home.

Over time, their transportation has suffered several problems that causes them losses and inconveniences. Due to this, R. is requesting a loan of $325.00, which she is committed to returning in a period of 6 months. She will buy a tricycle on which they will use to deliver the delicious food, and also soft drinks and other beverages that people request. Let’s make sure that the people in Pucallpa can continue to enjoy R.’s wonderful cooking. Let’s also help her and her husband give their family a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

R. es una cariñosa y amable ama de casa que desde que vino a radicar a la ciudad de Pucallpa, se dedicó a vender comidas típicas de la región, acondicionó un pequeño espacio en su domicilio y ofrecía diversos platos para deleite de los comensales.Conforme a pasado el tiempo R. a cobrado mayor notoriedad y a acumulado muchas recomendaciones de cada uno de sus clientes que día a día abarrotan este pequeño espacio en compañía de amigos y familiares. Al observar lo que estaba pasando se le ocurrió la idea de brindarles el servicio de reparto a domicilio a sus clientes con el fin de mantenerlos más contentos; así es que su esposo se ofreció a realizar exclusivamente esta labor mientras ella atendía personalmente a los que acudían a su vivienda.Conforme ha ido pasando el tiempo la movilidad que utilizaba ha ido sufriendo algunos desperfectos que les ocasiona innumerables pérdidas e inconvenientes. A razón de este hecho es que R. hace una solicitud por un monto de 325 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un periodo de 6 meses para que pueda adquirir un triciclo en el que transportará además de sus deliciosos juanes, también gaseosas y otros potajes que les sea solicitado.Hagamos que muchas personas en Pucallpa sigan disfrutando de la deliciosa sazón de R.. Y para que ella con ayuda de su esposo pueda otorgarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: To buy a tricycle that will serve as transportation for a home food delivery business

loans.name: Ana Laura

texts.es:
Ana is from Cullpa Alta, all her life has been spent in touch with the land since her parents and grandmother taught her how to farm. Agriculture and livestock are her passion and she is highly motivated as this is the source of livelihood for four of her five children.

She raises young cows and bulls until they are large enough to sell. Her dairy producing cows are well fed at the stables she has constructed in her home. Ana´s cattle are very well cared after and she nurtures her animals with such care that she even has a name for every animal.

She would like to build a small milking station which is allready being planned. To reach her aspirations, she calls out to your generous hearts to receive the loan that she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Henry Corral, Kiva volunteer.< Ana, es natural de la zona de Cullpa Alta, su vida siempre ha estado en continuo contacto con el trabajo en el campo, ya que sus padres y su abuelita le enseñaron cultivar sus tierras desde muy pequeña. Las actividades agrícolas y la crianza de animales siempre han sido labores muy apasionantes para ella y ahora más aún que su trabajo y esfuerzo se desplega en beneficio de cuatro de sus cinco hijos que están bajo su cobijo.Día a día se dedica a la crianza de vacas y toros, ella los compra cuando aún están tiernos y luego los engorda para venderlos, también alimenta bien a sus vacas para luego emparentarlas y en época de lactancia poder extraer la leche y utilizarla o venderla; es por ello que ha habilitado en su casa un establo para sus bellas vacas y finísimos toros y les otorga tanta dedicación y cariño que les ha dado un nombre a cada uno de ellos.Tiene en mente construir una pequeña planta lechera para lo cual está preparando y capacitando constantemente y con el propósito de implementar muy pronto su ansiado sueño; apela a vuestro generoso corazón para reunir la suma que está solicitando.

loans.use: Implement a new project

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. M. Mao, 37, and his wife, Kim Chankresna, live along National Road 5, about twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1989 and have seven children who still live under their custody. Mao has been a fisherM. since 1990. It's a skill he learned from his parents. He fishes in the river around his village and sells the fish. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children. One of his daughters is working in a garment factory, four of them are studying, and two are still young and stay at home.

Mao is requesting his third loan from MAXIMA in the amount of $200. He will use this loan to purchase fishing nets to expand his fishing. As Mao has successfully repaid previous loans, we feel sure he will repay this new loan as well.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en: I am Parween M. S. from Borewala, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four: two boys and two girls. We live in a one room brick mud house. My husband trades goats and sheep, and he plans to buy a few additional goats for his business. I also help my husband in his business and take care of his goats and sheep. My group members are: Naziran B., who needs a loan to buy her son a rickshaw; Ramzana B., who needs a loan to buy goats and start our livestock trading; Barkat B. needs a loan to buy her husband a rickshaw; Naziran I., who will invest the money in her husband’s sheep and goat trading; and Zarina B. requires a loan for their rickshaw repairing business.

loans.use: Buy additional goats for the business

loans.name: Enea

texts.en:
Greetings from Mbeya, Tanzania! Enea L. is 32 years old. She is married and has four children, who are between 2 and 13 years old. In 2000, Enea established a vitenge and batik business. Enea has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requests a new loan in order to purchase vitenge and batik in bulk.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not credit worthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: to purchase vitenge and batik in bulk

loans.name: Sithoin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithoin M. and her husband have been married since 1999. They have four children; one son and three daughters. One of her children studies in primary school and other three are still young and stay at home. The family lives along the Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sithoin and her husband are in the business of raising pigs, producing rice wine, and doing farming since 2000. Now Sithoin is requesting a loan for the second time in the amount of $500 for buying feed and baby pigs for raising.

loans.use: For buying feeds and baby pigs for raising

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
María de la Luz started her business as a way of generating additional income in her spare time. This activity allowed her to cover both her personal expenses and her family’s financial necessities, since she has a 14-year-old son who is currently studying, and her husband’s wages could not cover his studies.

For this reason, she started selling cosmetics 20 years ago. Because of her efforts, she has done well, but she would like to expand her clientele and form groups of women who can sell products for her.

She is currently requesting a loan of $775.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, for the purchase of merchandise and display shelves. She fully hopes that she will get what she needs with your support.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

María de la Luz inicio su negocio como una forma de generar más ingresos en su tiempo libre, para así poder solventar gastos personales y las necesidades económicas de su familia, ya que tiene un hijo de 14 años que se encuentra estudiando y con el sueldo de su esposo no pueden solventar estos gastos.

Por tal motivo inicio en la venta de cosméticos hace 20 años y debido a su esfuerzo le ha ido muy bien, pero ella desea seguir incrementado su cartera de clientes y formar grupos de señoras que le vendan productos.

Actualmente esta solicitando un crédito por US $775 que pagara en 6 meses, para la compra de mercancía y compra de exhibidores. Ella tiene toda la esperanza que con tu apoyo lo obtendrá.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise and display shelves

loans.name: Hour

texts.en:
Mrs. Hour H., 44, and her husband, Peng Phoeun, 43, were married in 1985 and have six children, four sons and two daughters. Two of their sons sell coconuts and the others are in school. The family lives across the Mekong River and about 17 km from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Hour has been in the business of selling fish for two years. She buys them from the market to resell in the village. Her husband has been a fisherman for over 20 years and also sells cows. Through their business they can earn between 20,000-30,000 riel/day.

She is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase cows for her husband to resell.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale

loans.name: Vitalina

texts.en:
Vitalina M., 41, is married with 4 children. She has many years experience in the taro/banana business. She sells to the village community and Fugalei market 3 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about US$ 145).

SPBD loans are Vitalina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Other amounts of her loan will be used for improving her household expenses also her education expenses. Her husband did the hard and dirty work of her business by planning everything for the betterment of their project which is a plantation.

loans.use: Purchase cromozone chemicals, insect sprayer, bush knife, shovel

loans.name: Sinaoletavai

texts.en:
Sinaletavai T., 55, is married with 8 children and she lives at Faleasui, Samoa. She and her husband have 3 year(s) of experience in the plantation business. She sells her crop to the village community and and the general public 3 days per week.

Sinaletavai has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She will use this loan to buy the materials needed to repair her house. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (US$166). SPBD loans are Sinaletavai’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: For house repairs

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is 44 years old and a married mother of four children. Two of them are in school; the first two have completed high school. She treks to the farming communities in the Volta region of Ghana to purchase local rice to sell in the market, as she has for ten years now. She says increased prices of rice and fuel have reduced her working capital. She hopes the loan will enable her to inject more capital into the business to meet the demands of the market. She wants to use the loan to buy a bulk supply of rice to avoid price hikes and frequent travels. She hopes to increase her savings to support her husband in paying the children's school fees. She is a member of the group called Diamond Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for one other as social collateral and assist each other to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of local rice.

loans.name: Guldasta.

texts.ru: Рахмонова Гульдаста проживает в городе Норак. Замужем и имеет троих детей. Занимается бизнесом в сфере торговли. Имеет торговую точку на рынке города , где торгует одеждой. Занимается этим бизнесом уже два года. Планирует развивать дело , а для этого , хочет получить кредит сроком на 10 месяцев. Кроме развития бизнеса , получив кредит она сможет увеличить прибыльность и привлечь новых клиентов. Ведь товар она привозит из города Душанбе , а реализует у себя. Этим она помогает населению делать покупки у себя не выезжая за приделы  города.
texts.en:
Guldasta R. lives in the city of Norak. She is married, has three children, and has a business selling clothing at her stall in the city market. This business has been her work for the last two years. She wants to expand it, with the help of a 10 month loan. Beside expanding the business, recieving a loan would allow her to increase profits and attract new customers. After all, she brings the goods she sells at the stall from the city Dushanbe, allowing locals to shop nearby, without leaving their city.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi A. is 28 years old. She is a single mother with three children, all of whom are in school. She is resourceful and very enterprising. She operates a restaurant and sells local foods like cooked rice and gari with beans. Gari is prepared from milled cassava and eaten with beans and fried ripe plantain. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her production expenditure. This has affected production quality adversely. She needs the loan to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of rice, meat, fish, vegetables, vegetable oil and firewood. Naomi is a member of a group called "Nyame mma" Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials for her restaurant business.

loans.name: David

texts.es: David es soltero, tiene 21 años, vive en la casa de sus padres. Es un joven emprendedor que se dedica a la producción de zapatos desde hace ya 6 años, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una profesión. Para David lo mas difícil es armar y cortar los zapatos, pero la experiencia, le ha dado la seguridad para realizar su trabajo correctamente. A pesar de esos pequeños detalles, le gusta su trabajo, le gusta sentirse útil e independiente. Este joven muchacho trabaja motivado por la oportunidad de abrirse un camino en este mundo tan competitivo. Con el dinero del préstamo comprará materiales para elaborar sus calzados y que estos queden con los resultados deseados, así ganar prestigio y convertirse en una de las mejores tiendas de zapatos de la ciudad.
texts.en:
David is single, he is 21 years old, and he lives at home with his parents. He is a young entrepreneur, dedicating his time to make shoes, a business he has been running for the past 6 years. He did not have the opportunity to continue studying for a profession.
