For David the hardest part is cutting the material and assembling it into shoes, but experience has given him the confidence to carry out his work in excellence. Aside from those small details, he loves his work. He loves feeling useful and independent. This young man works hard to open up an opportunity in this highly competitive world. With the funds from the loan he will purchase materials to make more shoes with desired results. He will achieve a level of prestige and then become one of the better shoe stores in the city.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials to make shoes.

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en: Ebenezer M. is a hard-working businessman. He is 62 years old and is married with three kids.  Fortunately, all the kids are independent now, easing his burden. He trades in rubber products like polythene bags; these bags come in various sizes and colors, and are mostly used for packing of all kinds. Ebenezer buys his supply of raw materials from the capital city of Ghana. He enjoys his trade very much but says that prices of raw materials have shot up drastically and transport costs have gone up due to the current fuel crisis. These difficulties have rendered his working capital inadequate to purchase appreciable quantities of materials to sell. He therefore needs this loan to inject additional capital into his business to enable him meet the demands of the market. He wants to use the loan to buy an increased supply of raw materials so that he can turn them into finish goods for his customers and increase his profits. Ebenezer hopes to increase his savings to pay for his house rent. He is a member of the community group called The Voice Trust Group. In this group, members vouch for one another as social collateral to repay their loans. Ebenezer’s picture was taken at one of his group meetings.

loans.use: To buy increased supply of polythene raw materials for the production of final packing goods.

loans.name: Coronel Sanches Group

texts.es: El grupo " Coronel Sanchez" esta conformado por personas pertenecientes a la provincia de Sacaba ellos estan representados por la señora Mirian. Los Socios (as) tienen rubros diversificados, donde se manifestan por lo general negocios de comercio al por menor como a la venta de tarjetas de celulares, comida, abarrotes, ropa, atencion en internet y al transporte público puestos en los cuales esperan surgir y aprovechar las fechas navideñas en la cual existe mayor demanda de productos. El financiemiento esta destinado a la compra de materiales e insumos a la venta y a la mejora de sus herramientas de trabajo para atender las demandas del mercado. Los socios (as) demostraron tener experiencia en grupos solidarios viendo sus antecedentes crediticios en Instituciones similares a la Fundacion Agrocapital demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos y sabiendo administrar bien los fondos otorgados para mejora sus ingresos y llegar a sus objetivos de mejorar su calida de vida y la de sus familias.
texts.en:
The Colonel Sanchez group, represented by Mirian, is made up of people in Sacaba province. The members, both men and women, have various occupations, generally including retail sale of items such as mobile phone cards, food, groceries, clothing, Internet service and public transportation—occupations in which they expect to get ahead, taking advantage of the Christmas season when demand peaks. To meet market demand, this funding is intended for the purchase of materials and supplies for sale and to upgrade work tools. Members have past experience with solidarity group loans, having established their credit worthiness with institutions similar to Fundacion Agrocapital, where they made payments on time and managed the funds allocated towards increasing their income and achieving their goals of improving quality of live for them and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating Capital

loans.name: Seap

texts.en:
Seap T., 26, lives Siem Reap Province, Cambodia and runs a little grocery store at her home. She sells items such as cooked food and sweets for kids. She has many years experience in this business. She is married to Mr. Heam Thach, 33, who is a taxi driver and uses his car to transport passengers and merchandise. He earns an average of US$5 a day from his business. The young couple has one child who is a lovely baby.

Recently, Mr. Thach has had difficulty attracting many clients because he has had frequent problems with his old car. Therefore, after discussions with his wife, they decided to ask for a loan to repair the car. Any remaining money would be used to buy gasoline.

loans.use: to repair their car - used as a taxi

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Corrí Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua.
Maria es casada, tiene 38 años y 2 hijos, Maria tiene un puesto en el mercado Las Américas en donde vende ropa variada, su mercadería lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Maria trabaja en un hotel como personal de limpieza.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de buzos, pantalones Jean.
Los sueños de Maria son ampliar su negocio, terminar de construir su casa y tener una bodega.
texts.en:
Maria is a partner of Banco Comunal Corri Ayllu which means “Golden Family” in Quechua language. Maria is married; she is 30 and has two children. She has a stall in the market “Las Americas” where she sells assorted clothing; she buys her merchandise in the city of Lima. In addition, she works in a hotel as a cleaning lady. Maria needs a loan of 800 soles, which she will invest it in buying sweatshirts and jeans. Maria’s ambitions are to grow her business, finish to build her house and have a warehouse.


Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Martinez Cairo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jeans and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana L. y su esposo el señor Esteban Evaristo tiene dos hijos a los cuales les quieren lo mejor para ellos. En esté momento se les presento un problema que tiene que pagar el semestre de la universidad de su hija pero en esté momento no cuenta con el dinero para poder liquidar la inscripción, es por eso que nos esta solicitando un préstamo,para poder  pagar la escuela de su niña y que pueda terminar sus estudios.
Planean pagar este crédito con los ingresos de su trabajo como cajera de un súper mercado, su esposo Don Esteban se dedica a la construcción.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adriana L. and her husband, Mr. Esteban Evaristo, have two children and they want the very best for them. Right now the family has a problem, they are not able to pay the university tuition for their daughter. This is why they are requesting a loan, to be able to pay for their daughter's schooling and so that she is able to finish her studies. They are planning to repay this loan with the income they receive from their jobs. Adriana works as a checker in a supermarket, and her husband Don Esteban works in construction. (Translated by Mariela of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay for a university tuition

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer trabajadora, que a sus 40 años es madre soltera, vive en una casa alquilada y quiere salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos económicos. En el mercado Santa Bárbara (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), tiene un pequeño lugar donde vende choclos, montada en su triciclo sale todas las mañanas muy temprano, su puesto es muy concurrido y por lo general acaba con todos los choclos que vende. Tiene 8 años en este negocio, el cual le a dado el dinero para alimentar a sus hijos y pagar sus estudios, pero siente que más adelante va a tener más gastos y el dinero le va a faltar, por eso desea poner una tienda, donde pueda vender más cosas y así mejorar su ingresos económicos. A Maria le gusta conversar con sus clientes, disfruta mucho haciéndolo, pero le es muy difícil caminar todo el día empujando su triciclo bajo el ardiente sol, pero igual no decae en su afán de salir adelante y está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para lograrlo. Este es el tercer préstamo de Maria con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo y no traerle problemas a su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita planea comprar más choclos y arreglar su triciclo.
texts.en:
Maria is a single, hard-working, 40-year old who lives in a rented house and wants to move ahead in her life and increase her income. She sells corn in a small space at the Santa Barbara market, a big market in the city of Juliaca. She heads out on her 3-wheel bicycle, early every morning. She sells out of corn almost every day, as her kiosk is much frequented. She has had this business for 8 years and it has allowed her the means to feed her children and pay their studies. She worries, however, that in the future her expenses will increase and her income won't. That's why she wants to have a store in which she can sell more items and in turn, increase her income. This is her third loan with MFP and she hopes to pay it on time so as not to cause problems with her village bank. Maria likes talking to her clients, she enjoys it very much, but it's difficult for her to walk all day and pedal or push the 3-wheel bicycle under the hot sun. However, that won't deter her from success and she's determined to work hard to achieve it. This is Maria's third loan with MFP and she hopes to pay it all back on time. With this loan, she plans to buy more corn and fix her 3-wheel bicycle.

Translated from Spanish by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase amount of merchandise

loans.name: Adji Penda

texts.fr: Adji Penda Dramé a 33 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle souhaiterait avec ce prêt renforcer le capital de son activité de vente d’huile de palme. Ce petit commerce lui permet de subvenir à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Adji Penda Dramé, age 33, is married and has five children. She would like to use this loan to bolster her working capital for selling palm oil. This small business enables her to improve living conditions for her and her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell palm oil

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en: Fatina R. is a Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur and businesswoman. She runs a food shop in the Makangarawe ward of Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of crop products, including cereal crop products. She purchases the business goods from the Kariakoo city market and sometimes direct from the producers wholesale and sells to customers on a retail basis. She has been in the business for four years. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Sanjar

texts.en:
A. Sanjar is 26 years old, married and has one child. His goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business activities by offering better service to his customers. His dream is that God will provide him with a long life so he can get ahead and fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels through the streets of Penjikent, Tajikistan in search of customers. He has owned his business for the last two years. Currently Sanjar’s car needs repairs, and he wants to borrow $1,500 for 12 months. The financing will allow him to repair his vehicle and also buy parts he needs, including new tires. Sanjar thanks Kiva and all lenders who make this help possible.      


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is home to a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to fix his car and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Eleuteria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Eleuteria de los Ángeles M. tiene la edad de 47 años, es madre soltera. Y tiene 3 hijos y todos estudian. La actividad económica es la venta de vegetales y verduras. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en el mercado central, anteriormente solo tenia un pequeño canasto de verduras todos los días por la mañana se levanta muy temprano en busca de sobrevivir. En la actualidad tiene mayor mercadería y variedad de la misma, con los créditos que se le ha otorgado sus hijos han podido estudiar y mantener este negocio. El dinero que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de plátanos, cebollas, tomates, piña entre otros. Su sueño es mantener siempre este negocio que tanto le a servido en su vida.
texts.en:
Eleuteria de los Ángeles M. is a 47-year-old single mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She has been making a living selling fruits and vegetables for the past 10 years. Her business is located in the central market. Previously she only had a small basket to sell vegetables from every morning after waking up very early looking to survive. Now she has more products and more variety, and thanks to the loans she's received she's been able to maintain her business and provide for her children's education. She plans to use the money she's requesting for the purchase of bananas, onions, tomatoes and pineapple, among other fruits and vegetables. Her goal is to always keep this business that has been such an aid in her life.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bananas, onions, tomatoes and pineapple, among other fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia is 38 years old and married to Armando, a farmer. They have three children: one is a vocational graduate while two are still studying. Her family lives in the village of Sta. Rosa, Gamu, Isabela. Her family is happy and has good bonding. 

Lucrecia believes that “time is gold”. She makes use of her time wisely for her business to become productive. She always thinks about the sake of her children. She would like to request a loan of PHP 30,000 as additional capital for her general store business. She hopes to improve her business and somehow expand to other businesses so that she will able to make the loan productive and profitable to her family members.

loans.use: To use as business capital for her general store

loans.name: Sabino

texts.es: Sabino tiene 34 años, es casado, vive en la casa de la suegra durante 13 años, cuenta con 3 hijos. La actividad se encuentra en la avenida juan pablo ii, cuenta con 7 años de experiencia. Su competencia es media, ya que el negocio se encuentra en un lugar estratégico que cuenta con demanda de clientes. El crédito fue para la apertura de otra actividad "ferretería", en la misma zona. No tiene antecedentes negativos en ninguna de las centrales de riesgos.
texts.en:
Sabino is 34 years old, married and has lived in his mother-in-law’s house for 13 years. He has three children.
He works in bookbinding on La Avenida Juan Pablo II and has seven years of experience. He has a bit of competition since his business is strategically located to meet customer demand.
The loan was used to open a hardware store in the same area. He does not have any negative history with any credit bureaus.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To set up his new hardware store

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes M. tiene ya más de veinte años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada y nueva, es el única ingreso que cuenta para salir adelante ella sola. 
Le están ofreciendo una mercancía a muy buen precio pero no cuenta con el dinero para hacer la comprar de inmediato.
Esta solicitando un préstamo y así obtener esa oferta que se le está presentando en este momento, esto le permitirá comprar la mercancía a un precio baja y así sus ingresos se incrementaran y con el cual pagara el crédito.
texts.en:
Mercedes M. has been selling new and used clothing for over twenty years now. This is the only source of income that she disposes of to make it on her own. She is being offered a batch of merchandise for a very good price but she doesn't have the money to make the purchase right now. She is requesting a loan to be able to get the deal that she is being presented with at this moment. This will allow her to buy the merchandise at a very low price and in this way her income will increase and she will be able to pay off her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Shimmin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en:
Altangerel D. lives with his family in the province Arkhangai. He and his wife have 4 children. 3 of them go to school. He started his business in 2003, selling clothes in the market stand. Altangerel goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city, once or twice every month to purchase men's and women's apparel at cheaper prices. His business is running successfully and  his working capital has increased from a start-up capital of 300,000 to 3,000,000 tugrigs. 

As a result of his successful business, they could afford to build a house and buy a truck. In the future, they want to expand their business by producing construction blocks. He is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 to purchase more types of clothing.

loans.use: to purchase more types of clothing

loans.name: Decsi Asuncion

texts.es:
Decsi P. es una de las socias del Banco Comunal 3 de Mayo, se reúnen cada quince días en la localidad de Picoaza una parroquia perteneciente a la ciudad de Portoviejo en la Provincia de Manabí.

Ella vive en el sitio el milagro a tan solo 5 minutos del centro de la parroquia, tiene 41 años de edad,  comparte su vida con Cruz Tóala su esposo y  6 hijos de entre 23 y 11 años, Decsi y su esposo luchan a diario por dar a sus hijos mejores días, nos dice todos sus muchachos estudian excepto la mayor que ya tiene compromiso.

Decsi esta solicitando a la fundación un crédito comprar herramientas para poner un taller de ebanistería en su casa, además tienen un negocio familiar de legumbres y frutas  donde todos ayudan, ponen de su parte para  tratar de incrementar el mismo, ya tienen 4 años en esta actividad. 

El sueño de Decsi es que sus hijos sigan adelante, que estudien sean unos profesionales  y porsupuesto incrementar sus negocios y ser independites para sentirse realizados.
texts.en:
Decsi P. is a member of the “3 de Mayo” communal bank, which meets every two weeks in Picoaza, a parish that belongs to the city of Portoviejo, in the province of Manabí. She lives in the El Milagro neighborhood, just 5 minutes from the center of the parish. She is 41 years old and lives with Cruz Tóala, her husband, and 6 children between the ages of 23 and 11. Decsi and her husband work hard every day to provide their children a better life. She says that all of them are studying, except the oldest, who already has a job. Decsi is requesting a loan to buy tools so she can open a woodworking shop in her house. She also has a family business selling vegetables and fruits, in which all members of the family help and do their part to try to make the business grow. She has been working in this business for 4 years. Decsi’s dream is that her children will get ahead in life, that they will study and become professionals; and, of course, that her businesses will grow so that her children can be independent and feel fulfilled.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy tools for their woodworking shop and to expand her fruit and vegetable business

loans.name: Marisella Del Carmen

texts.es: Marisella es soltera, trabaja en la colonia Providencia a 34 km de Nueva Guinea como enfermera, esta solicitando su 2do crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo compra de materiales de construcciòn para repellar y hecharle el piso que le hacen falta a su habitaciòn, todos los dias tiene que madrugar para dejar hechos sus quehaceres del hogar y viajar en el camiòn que sale a las 5 de la mañana para estar  a las 8 en punto en su trabajo,  a pesar que no tiene hijos le ayuda a su mamà con los gastos familiares, ya que  son una familia muy unida, su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad, contar con trabajo,  salud y  seguir estudiando  para llegar a ser una excelente profesional,  tiene como meta el proximo año estudiar una licenciatura para asi mejorar mas sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Marisella is single. She works as a nurse in the zone Providencia, 34 km from Nueva Guinea. She is requesting her second loan with AFODENIC to invest in the purchase of building material to repair and build the floor of her room. She gets up very early every day to do her chores and then commute by bus at 5:00 am to her work which starts at 8:am. Even if she does not have any children she helps her mother with the family expenses as they are very united. It is her dream to build her own house to be more comfortable, to have work, health and to continue her studies to become an excellent professional. It is her goal for next year to study a bachelor's degree in order to increase her knowledge.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair a room and build the floor

loans.name: Glendise

texts.es:
Glendise es socia del Banco Comunal Tulipanes.
Glendise es casada, tiene 39 años y 3 hijos, Glendise viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende frutas y de las ferias compra cereales, quesos, productos que vende en los mercados y de casa en casa.
Glendise necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de trigo y cebada.
Los sueños de Glendise son terminar de construir su casa y comprar otro terreno.
texts.en:
Glendise is a member of "Banco Comunal Tulipanes". She is married, 39 years old, and has 3 children. Glendise travels to different regional markets to sell fruits and to buy cereals and cheese to be sold on the markets and from door to door.

Glendise needs a loan of 1500 soles to be invested in buying wheat and barley. It is Glendise's dream to finish building her house and buy another plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat and barley.

loans.name: Nhinh

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhinh P. lives in the village of Tuol Kandal in the province of Takeo. She and her husband, Mr. Nget Keo, are farmers who own a three-hectare field of land where they earn a living by cultivating rice.

They face a problem in their planting because of infertile soil in their field, which negatively affects the success of their crops. In order to deal with this problem, Mrs. Nhinh P. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, which will support the rice field and make the crops more productive.

She is 48 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a laborer. The other attends the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support the rice field and make the crops more productive

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun N. is 57 years old and lives with her husband in Takeo province. The couple has two children, one of whom is a student and the other of whom is a wedding chef.

Since 1999 Srun N. has been raising pigs and making rice wine to earn a living. She is able to make about $3.70 USD of profit each day. Her husband is a rice miller and makes $1 USD per day. Srun N. would like to take out a loan of $1000 USD for her husband to purchase rice and take off the husk with the intention of reselling the rice and turning over a profit. She is confident that this will be a good business venture, and sees it as a tool to increase her income and raise her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase rice to take off the husk and resell

loans.name: Salif

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Salif Y.  a 51 ans, polygame et père de sept  enfants. Il réside avec ses deux femmes et ses enfants dans sa propre maison à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école et après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, il s’est vite initié aux activités commerciales notamment à l’achat-vente des appareils électroniques (radios, cassette (K7), panneaux Satellitaires, Batteries, Antennes Paraboliques, téléphones portables et divers) il y a maintenant plus de 20 ans. 
Avec une si grande expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources financières nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins font défaut. 
Ainsi, il sollicite ce 3ème prêt individuel  auprès de Soro Yiriwaso qui lui permettra d’acheter, 20 radios de marques différentes, 7 panneaux satellitaires, 3 batteries blindées, 8 antennes paraboliques et 180 cassettes. 
Il  s’approvisionne à Bamako pour venir les revendre à Sikasso dans sa boutique à la gare routière à côté de la compagnie Kènèdougou Voyage. Il a pour clients potentiels les voyageurs, les routiers , même d’autres qui sont sur place c’est à dire  vivant dans la ville de Sikasso. Ses ventes se font au comptant comme à crédit.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité principale.
texts.en:
Mr. Salif Y., aged 51, is a polygamist and the father of seven children. He lives with his two wives and his children in his own house in Sanoubougou I, one of the working-class neighborhoods of Sikasso in the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

He didn't have the chance to attend school and after having tried several activities without success, he finally initiated himself into commercial activities and began a business trading in electronic appliances (radio sets, cassette recorders, satellite dishes, batteries, dish antennas, cell phones and similar products). That was over 20 years ago. Today he has gained such an experience in his trade that he enjoys a solid reputation among his customers and attracts a lot of orders, but he lacks the financial resources to fully meet this demand.

This is why he came to Soro Yiriwaso and applied for his third individual loan. He will use it to buy 20 radio sets of various brands, 7 satellite dishes, 3 armor-plated batteries, 8 dish antennas and 180 tape cassettes. He gets his supplies in Bamako and brings them to his store in Sikasso, which is located at the bus station, right next to the office of the travel company Kènèdougou Voyage. His potential customers are travelers, carriers and even other people around his place, i.e. residents of Sikasso. He sells for cash and credit.

Thanks to this loan Salif expects to make a monthly profit of 200,000 CFA francs, which will be enough to pay for most of his expenses, those of his family and the interest payments of his loan. He will reinvest the remaining amounts in his business.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic appliances and accessories

loans.name: Puth

texts.en: Puth S., 38, is a married man and the father of four school-aged children, one of whom is married. To earn a living, Puth S. built a pigpen next to his house where he raises many pigs for slaughter. He sells all his mature pigs to buyers four months after he begins raising them. His wife is a vegetable seller and is also a homemaker who cooks delicious meals for the family. Because raising pigs is a profitable business for this family, Puth S. is applying for a loan to buy more piglets to feed.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to feed

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda E. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Erlinda owns and operates a business planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eighteen years and earns approximately 1,400 PHP a month. In 2007, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her 6th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is from the village of Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, married, and has three adult children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a business, buying and selling coconut in the local community. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $115 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Rosalinda joined the Kiva field partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue that is generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Olman Antonio

texts.es:
Olman S. Ramirez es un caballero que se dedica con gran esfuerzo a la actividad ganadera en el municipio El Sauce de León donde da lugar a la crianza de ganado con el fin de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación y así beneficiar a su familia compuesta por sus dos hijos en edades escolares.
Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de cinco terneros de desarrollo con un peso aproximado de 270 kilos. De esta menera logrará llevar a cabo su crianza y engorde para luego sacarle el máximo provecho a dichos terneros y así continuar con el beneficio a su familia que tanto ama.
texts.en:
Olman S. Ramirez is a gentleman who works raising cattle in the municipality of El Sauce de León. Here he raises cattle to provide for his home and benefit his family, which includes two school-aged children. Currently he is seeking a loan to buy five calves who are approximately 270 kilograms each. He will then finish raising them and fattening them to maximize the profits from the calves and thus continue to benefit his family, whom he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves

loans.name: Lawoulath

texts.fr: M. Lawoulath est née le 4 décembre 1972 à Sakété, dans le departement de Plateau au Bénin.  Il y a environs 10 ans que Lawoulath vit au quartier Cadjehoun à Cotonou, capitale économique de Bénin. Lawoulath est mariée à ZOHOUN Marcel, inspecteur à l’OPT (l’office de poste et télécommunications), et est mère de deux enfants.  Tous les enfants de Lawoulath sont scolarisés.  Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille.  Lawoulath n’a fait que l’école primaire.  Pour faire face à ses besoins, Lawoulath vend des produits cosmétiques. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Lawoulath s’approvisionne. Lawoulath exerce cette activité depuis trois ans. Lawoulath a déjà obtenu des crédits à ALIDé.  Ces crédits ont été bien remboursés. Lawoulath sollicite un autre crédit de ALIDé pour acheter des produits cosmétiques pour renforcer ses activités et de mieux répondre à la forte demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Lawoulath M. was born on December 4, 1972, in Sakété, in the Plateau Department, Benin. For approximately 10 years, she's been living in the Cadjehoun neighborhood in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She's married to Marcel ZOHOUN, an OPT (post and telecommunication office) inspector, and she's the mother of two school-attending children. The couple supports the family together. Lawoulath only attended primary school. To provide for herself, she's been selling cosmetics for three years. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international marketplace in Benin. She already benefited from several loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé. These loans were repaid without problems. Lawoulath is seeking another loan from ALIDé in order to buy cosmetics in order to bolster her business and better meet high customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell cosmetics

loans.name: Future For Life Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the 'Future for Life' group from the small town of Waterloo, about 26 miles away from Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. They are small-scale businesspeople who want a loan of SLL 3,000,000 in order to expand their business, make more sales, and consequently improve their standard of living.

Mohamed B. K. is the head and leader of this group of entrepreneurs. The 27-year-old was born in Kabala, northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have 2 children. For more than 10 years now, Mohamed has been selling phone accessories. With his share of this loan, he will buy phone accessories like batteries, chargers, ear-phones, phone covers, etc.

loans.use: Buy phone accessories such as batteries, chargers, ear-phones, phone covers, etc.

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
La señora ROSMERY S. R. tiene 31 años, vive en la provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. Pertenece al Banco Comunal LA PERBOLA II. La socia  presenta estudios hasta 5to de Secundaria, está casada, tiene 2 hijas pequeñas quienes dependen económicamente de ella. Rosmery se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños, jóvenes y adultos que trae de la cuidad de Lima. Ella refiere que viaja a Lima cada 2 meses y sobre todo para fechas importantes como: el día del padre, día de la madre, navidad, año nuevo.. porque son las fechas donde puede vender hasta el doble de lo que usualmente vende.
Así mismo ella considera que este negocio es rentable porque puede generar ganancias desde un 50% hasta un 100% y gracias a estas ganancias ella puede generar dinero para el hogar y sobretodo para la crianza y educación de sus hijas.
Su primer crédito de 300.00 nuevos soles lo utilizó para comprar cosméticos como: colonias, labiales,, talcos, cremas, etc. y ahora con su próximo crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles lo utilizará para viajara Lima a comprar uniformes escolares al por mayor, ropa interior y utilices escolares por campaña escolar.
texts.en:
Rosemary is 31 years old and lives in the Trujillo province in the La Libertad department of Peru. She is a member of the La Perbola II communal bank and has a junior high school education. She is married and has 2 young daughters who depend on her for support. Rosemary sells children’s, teens’, and adults’ clothing that she brings in from Lima. She travels to Lima every two months, especially around important dates, such as fathers’ day, mothers’ day, Christmas, and New Year, because it is around these times where her sales increase to as much as double what they normally are. She believes that this business is profitable because she can generate profits between 50% and 100% and thanks to this revenue, she can generate money for her household and above all for raising and providing an education for her daughters. She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy cosmetics such as cologne, lipstick, talc, creams, etc. She will use the money from this loan of 500 PEN ($200) to travel to Lima and buy school uniforms, underclothing, and school supplies for the school year.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School uniforms and supplies for resale

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en: Teresia is a diligent and hardworking lady. She lives with her husband and their two children who go to school. She sells clothes in her residence to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for nine years. She also grows tea and keeps dairy animals to increase their family earnings. Since she became a member of Faulu Kenya, her business has improved since she can access loans. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more secondhand clothes for sale.

loans.use: To add stock of clothes

loans.name: Joisy

texts.es:
Joisy tiene 18 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 5 hermanos. Desde muy pequeña, aprendió todas las técnicas necesarias para preparar y fertilizar la tierra, observaba como sus padres sembraban con mucha dedicación. Ya cuando creció, lo aprendido le sirvió para trabajar en búsqueda de progreso. Es entonces que hace 3 años se dedica a la siembra de papa (tubérculo peruano), en esta labor cuenta con la ayuda de  sus hermanos, y según manifiesta, le gusta mucho este trabajo porque pone en prácticas su experiencia y con su esfuerzo obtiene productivas cosechas, que recoge orgullosa de sus campos para luego venderlos a los mercados mayoristas de su ciudad. Mas adelante tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad y aumentar así  sus  ganancias. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que han hecho posible que éste aporte le permita continuar trabajando, además considera que el trabajo dentro de su grupo comunal es muy organizado y solidario, pues todos los integrantes son muy responsables en el pago de sus cuotas.
Joisy tiene pensado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de semillas de arveja y fertilizantes para asegurar una buena siembra.
texts.en:
Joisy, 18, lives in her own home with her 5 siblings. As a very young girl she learned all the skills to prepare and fertilize soil for planting; she would watch her parents carefully. Once grown, she has been able to use her learned skills to work toward progress. For the last three years, then, she has farmed potatoes (Peruvian tuber). Her siblings help her with this work and she states that she enjoys her work very much because she puts her experience to practice and her efforts lead to productive crops that she very proudly harvests to sell to wholesalers in the city. Later on she plans to plant greater amounts so that her profits will increase. This is her 3rd loan with MFP; she is very grateful to all the people that have made this possible because these contributions allow her to continue to work. She also considers that the work within her communal bank is organized and unified because all the members are very responsible when it comes to repaying their loan installments. Joisy will use the requested funds to buy pea seed and fertilizers to insure a good crop yield.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a consignment of drugs for her pharmacy

loans.name: Pheang's Group

texts.en:
Six people make up this group loan and they all live in Preaek Reang village in Kandal province. They will each use their loan for a different purpose in order to improve their family's living conditions.

Mrs. Pheang S. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. She is a vegetable seller in the local marK.. Her husband, Mr. S. Sen, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow vegetables to sell, in order to support his family. Her husband’s field is reading for growing, but they do not have enough money to support it. Therefore, in order to improve production, Mrs. Pheang S. is seeking a loan to buy bamboo to grow vegetables. She is a mother of a child who is a farmer, too.

loans.use: To buy bamboo to grow vegetables

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina I. is from the village of Natugod, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Divina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Divina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Divina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Divina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Divina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to  purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Divina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Divina from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida, de 49 años, es una mujer ejemplar con ganas de salir adelante, es soltera, tiene 3 hijos, que laboran de manera independiente pero viven juntos en su casa propia. Se considera una madre de familia capaz de hacer cualquier oficio que se le encomiende, pues actualmente tiene un negocio de venta de comestibles, también posee un espacio para recreo turístico llamado “Los Girasoles” y lo abre todas las tardes. Como si eso fuera poco se dedica a la agricultura los fines de semana, tiene terrenos donde crecen frutos cítricos, que luego serian vendidos al por mayor. Lleva 25 años realizando estás actividades y lo que más le gusta es disfrutar de la tranquilidad que siente en la zona por donde vive, en estos años de experiencia sabe que sus actividades son bastante rentables, ya que le permitió construir su casa, cubrir la educación de sus hijos y vivir cómodamente sin pasar necesidades, además una de sus hijas estudio la profesión “Hotelería y Turismo”, por lo que piensan construir los terrenos vacíos que tienen e instalar un hotel, asimismo desea que una de sus hijas viaje al extranjero por motivo de trabajo, en busca de una calidad de vida mejor. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y como conoce a las integrantes de su grupo comunal, se siente en familia, ya que confía mucho en las socias. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varias cajas de cerveza y bebidas gasificadas para llenar su bar.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 49, is an exemplary woman with a strong desire to get ahead. She is single and has 3 children who work independently, but they all live together in her own home. She is considered to be a mother who can succeed doing any kind of task. Currently she has a business selling food. In addition, she has a recreation area for tourists called "Los Girasoles" which is open every afternoon. And as if this wasn't enough, she also works in agriculture on the weekends. She has lands where she grows citrus fruit, which she later sells wholesale. She has 25 years of experience in these activities, and what she enjoys most is to enjoy the tranquility she feels in the area where she lives. Through her years of experience she has found that these activities are quite profitable, since they have allowed her to build her house, pay for the education of her children and live comfortably with all the necessities. Also, one of her daughters studied in the "Hotel and Tourism" career, since she is thinking of putting a hotel on some vacant land that she has. She also wants one of her daughters to travel outside the country to look for work, so that she can search for a better quality of life. This is her 3rd loan with MFP, and since she knows the members of her communal bank she feels at home since she has a lot of confidence in her fellow members. With the loan she requests, she will buy a number a cases of beer and soft drinks to stock her bar.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina Fernández tiene 34 años de edad, vive en la zona de la Maica Central parada 6, zona ubicada en la provincia Cercado del departamento de Cochabamba, zona rural, ubicada en la periferia de la ciudad.

La señora Alejandrina es madre soltera, tiene un hijo de 12 años que estudia en una escuela de la zona, el padre del niño nunca lo reconoció, los abandono desde que se entero que Alejandrina estaba embaraza. La señora se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, cuenta con 5 cabezas de ganado vacuno, desde hace 13 años que se dedica a esta actividad; que le exige mucho esfuerzo, tiempo y dedicación, pues día a día debe trabajar desde muy temprano e ir a ordeñar las vacas, llevar la leche a los tanques de enfriamiento para que no se agrie su producto, y se pierda su producción, y los lugares donde realiza todas sus labores, no cuentan con un transporte adecuado pues sus tachos de leche de 30-40 litros, los carga en la espalda. Este esfuerzo lo realiza todos los días, además debe dedicarse al pastoreo, aprovisionamiento de los insumos para su ganado. Son actividades que demandan mucho esfuerzo y tiempo, esfuerzo que Alejandrina con ayuda de su hijo lo realizan todos los días. Además debe cuidar de su padre de 83 años de sufre de múltiples malestares típicos por su edad, sordera, dolor  de huesos, malestares estomacales, y muchos otros más. Pero es un abuelito cariñoso que pasa sus últimos días junto con su hija y  su único nieto.

Alejandrina tiene el deseo de mejorar su calidad de vida, dar a su hijo mejores condiciones de vida, que su hijo pueda terminar el colegio, estudie veterinaria que es uno de sus mayores sueños. 
Es así que la Señora Alejandrina solicito el crédito para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, de este modo incrementar su producción y poder tener más ingresos, que le permitan poder ahorrar para el momento en que su hijo necesite para sus estudios superiores.
texts.en:
Alejandrina Fernández, 34, lives in the Maica Central area, stop #6, in Cercado province, Cochabamba department, a rural area on the outskirts of town. Alejandrina is a single mother of a 12 year old son who goes to the local school. Her son’s father never acknowledged him; he abandoned them when he found out Alejandrina was pregnant. She is a raw milk dairy farmer. He has five cows. She’s been in this line of work for 13 years. It requires much effort, time and dedication because she must work from very early in the morning every day milking the cows and taking the milk to the cooling tanks so that it won’t spoil and she lose her production. The places where she works lack adequate transportation services so she must carry her 30-40 liter milk cans on her back. She toils like this every day. In addition, she grows pasturage to have feed for her cattle. These activities demand much effort and time, effort that Alejandrina does daily with help from her son. In addition, she must care for her 83-year-old father who suffers from many age-related ailments: deafness, bone pain, stomach problems and many others. But, he’s an affectionate grandfather who spends his remaining days with his daughter and only grandson. Alejandrina wants to improve her quality of life, to give her son better living conditions, that her son finish high school and study veterinary sciences is one of her greatest dreams. Alejandrina has requested funds to buy another dairy cow so that production will increase and she can have more earnings that will allow her to have some savings for when her son needs funds for higher education expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en:
Luis Alberto A. V. is 36 years old. He lives with his 5 children, aged 5, 8, 12, 15 and 18, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Luis is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Luis is a farmer. He cultivates blackberries, corn and beans. He purchases and sells his products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where he lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and corn and beans once a year.

Luis requests this loan to be able to buy compost and seeds for blackberries. He hopes this credit will help him work and move forward with his products. His dream is to have enough to live. He faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn, that endanger the harvest. He is also at risk of losing his blackberries with the bad weather they had (heavy rain, frozen cultures…)

He likes to play volleyball in his free time.

loans.use: To buy compost and seeds for blackberries

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 5 enfants, Madame Bintou C. est âgée de 44 ans et vit dans une famille monogame avec son époux et ses enfants dans le quartier Sogomougou de la préfecture de Koutiala (région de Sikasso ). 
Pour des raisons sociales, Bintou n’a pas eu la chance de continuer  ses études primaires, c’est ainsi qu’elle s’intéressa tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus, depuis à bas âge. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour la vente des fruits et légumes il y a 10 ans. Apprise auprès de sa maman, cette activité lui procure bien de revenus et marche très bien, puisque les fruits et légumes sont des desserts qu’on a tous besoin pour notre bien être.  Pour satisfaire sa clientèle  en qualité et  en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 5 ans. Après 5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son sixième  prêt individuel dont les précédents ont été payer sans difficulté. 
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter 3 paniers de bananes,  5 paniers de pomme de terre, 7 paniers d’oranges et autres. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants de Koutiala et Sikasso et effectue sa vente au grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’ hommes,  au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 70.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement des intérêts, participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille et investir le reste dans d’autres activités génératrices de revenus.
texts.en:
Married and the mother of 5 children, Mrs. Bintou C. is 44 years old and lives in a monogamous family with her spouse and her children in the Sogomougou neighborhood of the Koutiala prefecture (region of Sikasso). For social reasons, Bintou did not have the chance to continue her primary schooling, which is why she interested herself in revenue-generating businesses from an early age. After having run several businesses without success, she finally opted to sell fruits and vegetables 10 years ago. Learned from her mother, this business makes her good revenues and runs very well, since fruits and vegetables are desserts that we need for our well-being. To satisfy her customers' needs of quality and quantity, and to increase the size of her business, she decided to appeal to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso 5 years ago. After 5 solidarity loans (group loans) all paid back in full, she is on her sixth individual loan, all of which were paid back without difficulty. With this loan, she expects to buy 3 baskets of bananas, 5 baskets of potatoes, 7 baskets of oranges and other things. She gets her supplies in the different weekly fairs in the villages surrounding Koutiala and Sikasso and makes her sales at the big market in Koutiala to a customer base composed of men and women, for cash and credit. She expects to make an average profit of 70,000 FCFA per month, which she plans to use to pay back her interest, to contribute to the daily expenditures of her family, and to invest the remainder in other revenue-generating businesses.

Translated from French by Martha Schmitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married with two children and all of them attend school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  Beatrice owns a stall in Bwaise market selling bananas. She has been in this business for four years. She plans to use this loan to buy more bunches of bananas.  

Beatrice sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week with no additional income and depends on this job for a living. Her business challenge is the  transportation of supplies of bananas from Masaka Villages to her stall  in Bwaise.  Beatrice aspires to sell at wholesale only.  She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital. She resides in and owns a house and the family has access to electricity but with no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school and food.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Yelba Rosa

texts.es:
Yelba es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada a su pequeño negocio venta de nacatamales, tortillas, frijoles cocidos, lleva tres años en ventas.
Esto lo comenzó con iniciativa propia ya que tiene un taxi que su esposo lo trabaja pero las carreras habeces no están buena lo que decide apoyar haciendo ventas en su casa y lograr atraer clientes.
Su venta de nacatamales que es su plato fuerte en el negocio lo vende ambulante pues su esposo en el taxi sale a ofrecer a las oficinas y la otra parte en casa, ya que por vender tortillas tiene muchos clientes.

Atreves de Afodenic comienza hacer mejoras a un  cuarto lo cual está contenta.
Ahora con este tercer ciclo invertirá en la compra de materia prima para aumentar la producción de nacatamales.
Comprara: quintales de Maíz, carne de cerdo, manteca, quintal de frijoles y lograr mejores ventas.
c
texts.en:
Yelba is a hard working woman who is devoted to her small business selling Nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) tortillas, cooked beans. She’s been in sales for three years. She started this on her own initiative because she has a taxi that her husband drives but sometimes the fares aren’t good so she decided she had to go into sales from home to help him out and attract customers. The Nacatamales are the best sellers in her business so she sells them in an itinerant manner because her husband takes them out in the taxi to sell at various offices; she also sells them from home because she has a lot of customers that come to buy tortillas. Through Afodenic she has started to make some improvements to a room which makes her happy. Now in her third cycle she will buy raw materials to increase Nacatamal production. She will buy quintales of corn, pork, lard, a quintal of beans to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy quintales (weight measure equivalent to 46 kilos) of corn, lard, pork and other ingredients for Nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) like quintales of beans to increase production.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en:
Noah is a 49-year-old father of four. He is married to Eunice, who is currently in college furthering her studies. He runs a shop in the center near his home and he has been in the business for 13 years now. He also does farming on his farm and sells farm inputs to the residents around his home and at the center.

He learned about Kadet through an existing member and with this second loan, he plans to buy additional stock like flour, rice and other household materials.

He plans to open another shop at the center and diversify so that he is able to earn more income, which will enable him to educate all his children in good schools.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for his shop with things like flour, rice and others

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is 31 years old. She is married with three children whose ages range from 4 to 12 years and all of them go to school. She has a restaurant where she sells African food, tea and drinks. Her husband works at a travel agency. It has been one year since she started her business. With the loan she will buy food for sale and utensils to use in the restaurant. With the profit she will use it to rehabilitate the house. Sabina’s business is well known because she provides good customer service to her clients. She wakes up very early in the morning to keep the place clean and welcoming. In the future she hopes to be provide catering services to the whole district.

loans.use: To buy food for sale  and utensils to use in the restaurant

loans.name: Walter Daniel

texts.es: El Sr. Walter Daniel C. C. él es trabajador por cuenta propia brindando el servicio de ciclo taxi   ofreciendo su servicio en el casco urbano de san Rafael del sur, tiene  ocho años de trabajar por cuenta propia, es casado actualmente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  cinco  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para compra de repuesto de sus ciclo taxi, y este lo esta solicitando para la compra de un ciclo taxi mas, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera él ha  mejorado su condición de vida de él y su familia.
texts.en:
Señor Walter Daniel C. C. has been a self-employed, motorcycle taxi driver in downtown San Rafael del Sur for the past eight years.  He is married and has two school-age children.  

He has had five loans with CEPRODEL and has used them to buy parts for his motorcycle.  He is requesting this loan to buy another motorcycle.  The loans from CEPRODEL have been very beneficial as they have helped him to improve his quality of  life and that of his family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Shairbubu

texts.en:
Shairbubu K. is 53 years old and married.  She has four children and also is responsible for three children of her deceased brother-in-law.  

Shairbubu graduated from college and worked at the local kindergarten as a nurse.  In order to find a means of subsistence for her large family, in 1995 she began to breed livestock.  Her persistent and hard work allowed Shairbubu to maintain a farm with one cow, eight sheep, and two goats.  With the revenue from this activity, she was able to pay for education for her daughters.  

Currently, Shairbubu is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kyrgyz Soms to purchase three calves. Using the revenues from this loan, she plans to marry off her son and build a house for him. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ervin Santiago

texts.es:
Ervin Santiago L. es un hombre trabajador, esforzado y emprendedor quien tiene un taller de calzado desde 1998. Este negocio lo inicio junto con su esposa con unos cuantos materiales actualmente cuenta con nueve colaboradores y una producción diaria de 118 pares de zapatos. 
L. comercializa sus productos en Masaya y Managua donde cuenta con clientes fijos. En estas fechas tiene un encargo que requiere de una gran inversión en materia prima como cuero, cuerina, hilos, pega, adornos, remaches, bonte, forro, hebilla, elástico etc.
texts.en:
Ervin Santiago L. is a hard-working and enterprising man who has had a shoe shop since 1998. He started this business with his wife with a small amount of materials. He now has new partners and makes 118 pairs of shoes a day.

Mr. L. sells his products in Masaya and Managua where he has regular customers. He now has an order that requires a large investment in raw materials such as leather, faux leather, thread, glue, adornments, nails, lining, buckles, elastic, etc.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials such as leather, glue, insoles, thread, nails, etc.

loans.name: Pathani's Group

texts.en:
Pathani is the wife of M. and resides in a city named Vehari in Pakistan. Vehari is a small city known for its agriculture industry. She lives there with her family in a two-room brick house.
  
Pathani is a good-natured lady who always keeps a smile on her face and makes her family brave with encouraging words. She prefers to stay at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife very well.
 
Her husband has an animal sales business. He has been in this business for many years. He has a good knowledge of animals and, due to this and his good experience, he gets orders from butcher shops. He buys animals from the animal markets for cheap rates, raises them up and sells them for a good profit. 

Pathani helps him in his business by taking care of his cattle. She gives them food and water and keeps their places clean to avoid diseases.
 
Pathani has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will buy goats and buffalo and sell them for a good profit.
 
Pathani is hopeful that through this investment, her husband will be able to expand his business and improve the financial condition of the family.

loans.use: To buy animals to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that does not have electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.
Mariam has operated a charcoal sales business for the past four years. She sells charcoal retail and from home to her neighbors and passers-by. In addition she has a food vending business that contributes another source of income. Mariam faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.
With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Saniya sont mariées majoritairement  dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 26 ans et 2 enfants par femme. Elles habitent ensemble dans le village de Cinzana Gare chef lieu d’une commune rurale dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le petit commerce de tubercules (pomme de terre, patate et igname), jus locaux, foulards et boissons locales. 
Dans le souci d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont intégré Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Marama Traoré est connue à Cinzana Gare pour sa vente de tubercules au bord de la route nationale N° 6. 
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 10 sacs de patates et de pommes de terre en gros à Koutiala avec les producteurs. La revente se fait au comptant et à crédit, à domicile et à sa place de vente au bord du goudron à Cinzana Gare à une clientèle mixte. 
Madame Marama Traoré espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 30.000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les besoins de condiments du foyer. 
Elle a pour objectif d’augmenter le volume de son activité tout comme les autres membres de son groupe dans ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The women of the group Saniya are married for the most part in monogamous families.  They average 26 years of age and two children per woman.  They live together in the village of Cinzana Gare, the seat of the rural commune, in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  The group members know one another through ties of kinship, and they have small-scale businesses involving tubers (potatoes, sweet potatoes, and yams), local fruit juices, scarves, and local beverages.  

Concerned about increasing their working capital, the group members joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle.  

Ms. Marama Traoré is known in Cinzana Gare for selling tubers on the roadside of National Road N° 6. She plans on using her loan to buy 10 sacks of potatoes and sweet potatoes wholesale from producers in Koutiala. The goods are resold out of the home and at her spot along the asphalt in Cinzana Gare.  Her customer base is varied.

Ms. Marama Traoré hopes to use this loan to make an average monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and for meeting the food needs at home. Her goal is to increase her business volume, just like the other group members in this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: Buying tubers (potatoes)

loans.name: Charles Mwameso

texts.en:
Charles Mwameso M. is a 55-year-old man. He is married to Ethiel, and they have been blessed with three children. Charles has been a retail shop owner for the last eight months as a primary business and also sells clothing materials.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to purchase cooking oil, salt, sugar, rice, and flour. The anticipated profits will be directed into the expansion of his business.

His dream is to own his business premises.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, salt, sugar, rice, and flour.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence M. is a married lady with three children between 25 and 14 years old. 

Florence owns a banana store at a busy market in Nairobi. She sells bananas wholesale to the retailers who resell to consumers. She has been in this business for seventeen years now. 

She says that this business is profitable. The only major challenges she has are hot weather destroying the bananas and, during some seasons, bananas are not easily available, reducing the profits she makes during the high seasons. 

However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of KES 80,000 to buy bananas to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. 

In the future, she hopes to improve her living standards and also to buy a vehicle to transport bananas in bulk. She describes herself as humble.

loans.use: To buy more bananas

loans.name: Hussein

texts.ar: حسين في عمر 43 سنة متزوج وله اربع اولاد يعمل في محل لبيع المواد الغذائية والسكاكر وغيره له في عمله 7 سنوات يحب عمله ويسعى الى تطويره دائما يريد من خلال تطوير نفسه الى تطوير عائلته يسعى جاهدا الى تأمين العيش الكريم له  ولعائلته له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة حيث كان يلقى الدعم الكامل من محيطه يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى زيادة البضائع وتطوير المصلحة يسعى دائما الى التطور والتجدد في العمل لكن تنقصه بعض المادة ليزيد من مدخوله
texts.en: Hussein is a 43-year-old husband and father of three who constantly strives to secure a dignified life for his family. He has been working in a shop selling food and confectioneries for the past seven years. Hussein very much likes his job and is constantly looking for ways to make it more dynamic. Hussein has a good credit history with Al Majmoua and wanted to ask for another loan to purchase more inventory for his shop and further develop the business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es: Martha Elena se dedica desde hace 6 años a la compra y venta de cerdo. Sus inicios fueron por su esposo quien anteriormente se dedicaba al negocio. Esta es su principal fuente de ingresos ya que la mayoría de sus clientes saben que ella siempre se esfuerza por proporcionarles a sus clientes una buena calidad en sus cerdos. El financiamiento que solicita actualmente es para la compra de materia prima como cerdos por lo que tiene que recorrer grandes distancias en ciertas comunidades para obtener precios favorables. El sueño de Martha es mantener este negocio activo que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Martha Elena has made her living for the past 6 years buying and sellling pigs.  It began with her husband, who previously made his living with the same business.  This is her main income source, and most of her customers know that she always makes the effort to provide them with high quality pigs.  The loan that she is currently requesting is for the purchase of raw aterials, for instance, pigs.  She has to travel great distances in certain communities to get favorable pricing.  Martha's dream is to keep her business active as her prinicpal income source.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CHOQUEQUIRAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teresa; la socia tiene 58 años de edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de artesanía en cerámica decorativo, la socia tiene su stand que se encuentra ubicado en la plaza de armas del cusco en el salón de exposición, la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le gusta mucho ya que este negocio hace que ella pueda brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar de mercadería para así poder tener más variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Teresa is a member of the Communal Bank “Choquequirao” which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 58 years old, married, and has four children. Teresa divides her time between her daily activities and managing her craft business in which she sells decorative ceramics. She has a stand located in a showroom at the Plaza del Armas in Cusco. Teresa has been in this business for several years and enjoys what she does. With this business, she is able to provide a better quality of life for her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to purchase merchandise so that she can offer more variety to her customers.

Teresa is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Maria Eduarda

texts.es:
María de 28 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de frutas y ropa, reside en San Miguel, junto a un hijo de 6 años de edad, viven en casa propia, ella trabaja en el mercado municipal de San Miguel, vendiendo las frutas y la ropa en un puesto fijo, este negocio lo aprendió de su madre desde que era pequeña creció ayudándole a vender.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como blusas, camisas, short, entre otras prendas de vestir, esta compra es oportuna ya que viene la época donde la mayor demanda las presentan los shorts y camisas, por el verano, dándole a ella la oportunidad de estar preparada para atender la demanda.
Su objetivo es crecer en el negocio y ayudar a su hijo para tenga todo lo necesario y también pueda iniciar ya sus estudios.
texts.en: Maria is 28 years old and lives in her own home in San Miguel with her 6 year old child.  She sells fruit and clothing in a stall at the San Miguel municipal market.  When she was young, she helped her mother selling and learned the business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise such as blouses, shirts, and shorts, amongst other clothing.  This purchase is important because the demand for these items is approaching and having them by summer will give her the opportunity to meet the demand.  Her goal is to grow the business and help her child to have everything needed to start his studies.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as blouses, shirts and shorts.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 49 años. Vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el distrito de Paiján, perteneciente a la Provincia de Ascope ubicado en la región de la Libertad, que está a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y productos natura para la salud. Vende por catálogo sus productos a sus vecinos y sus amistades en su caserío y sus alrededores. Tiene aproximadamente 5 años de experiencia en este negocio. Cuenta con una clientela fiel. Tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos que dicen que es una persona trabajadora y responsable. Solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio con la compra de más productos como maquillaje, perfumes y humectantes por su nueva campaña y también para entregar pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gladis is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the District of Paiján, which is part of Ascope Province in La Libertad region. This community is more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Gladis sells beauty products and natural health products. She sells her merchandise through catalogs to her neighbors and friends who live in her village and in the surrounding areas. Gladis has approximately five years of experience in this business. She has a loyal customer base.

Gladis has good references from her neighbors and acquaintances who state that she is a hardworking and responsible person. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business by acquire more products such as makeup, perfumes, and moisturizers for her new sales campaign so that she can fulfill the orders of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase makeup, perfumes, and moisturizers.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school.  Florence has had a small retail shop for three years.         

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Florence hopes to build rental houses. Florence is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being hardworking and learning more on how to save money.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities like soap for resale.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 37 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su conviviente y su menor hijo, residentes en la ciudad de Ferreñafe. Juan vive en una parte  rural de este distrito,  aún así tiene los servicios básicos de agua y luz.


Juan se dedica ala comercialización  de verduras y tubérculos en el interior del mercado de Ferreñafe.  Esta actividad la iniciando como ambulante y ahora cuenta con un establecimiento en el mercado desde hace más de 10 años,  lo que le ha permitido tener clientela fija y con mucha experiencia en el rubro. 

 Juan desea adquirir un préstamo en Edpyme Alternativa de 2200 nuevos soles para poder mejorar sus servicios higiénicos dentro de su vivienda, lo que le  permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Juan,  es un cliente nuevo para edpyme alternativa, se cuenta con muy buenas referencias de su trabajo y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Juan is 37 years old.  He lives in his own home, together with his partner and one dependent child.  They live in the town of Ferreñafe.  Juan lives in a rural part of this district but has basic services of water and electricity.

Juan sells vegetables and tubers in Ferreñafe market.  He started out in this business as an itinerant vendor but he has had an establishment in the market for 10 years now.  This has allowed him to gain a regular customer base and a lot of experience in his field.

Juan would like to acquire a loan for 2,200 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that he can improve the bathroom facilities in his home.  This would allow him to enjoy a better quality of life.

Juan is a new client of Edpyme Alternativa.  He has very good work references and is responsible.

loans.use: to improve his home's bathroom facilities

loans.name: Laiheng

texts.en: Laiheng, 54, resides in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. Laiheng is a farmer, earning an income of USD 2 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a traditional musician and purchases cows to resell, earning an income of USD 8 per day. Each month, the family has to spend USD 56 on food and USD 25 on the other necessary expenses. Laiheng is requesting a loan of USD 900 to purchase more cows to resell. This will be her first from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more cows to resell

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
