Ekua, married with seven dependents, has been a fishmonger and a chop bar operator in Elmina for 20 years. She cooks foods such as banku, fufu, rice-balls, etc. Her income helps to pay the utility bills and school fees.

Ekua will use the loan to purchase fish, maize, cassava, plantain and other ingredients to cook for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further her children's education. The photo shows her standing close to the oven she uses for the fish.

loans.use: to purchase fish, maize, cassava, plantain and other ingredients to cook for sale.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with two children. One of her children attends school and the other is too young. Asha owns a house that has electricity and piped water and her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, Asha has operated a boda boda (motorcycle transport) business. Her customers are her neighbors and passersby. Asha’s main business challenge is delayed payments by her customers. She dreams of owning a matatu (public service vehicle) in the future.

Asha decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to start a clothing business and purchase clothes and cloth material to sell.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and materials to start a clothes-selling business

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 36 years old. Elchin is married and has two children.

Elchin has worked as a barber for many years. He is very talented and maybe that’s why he has so many clients. Also, he doesn’t charge much for his services. Now he wants to borrow money so he can buy newer instruments for hair cutting. This way, Elchin thinks, he can offer better service for his clients and in that way, earn more and improve his family's standard of living. For this purpose, he applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN. Elchin has a good client history and promises to pay this loan as well as his previous one.

loans.use: to purchase newer instruments for hair cutting

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
La señora Evangelina es  casada con el señor  Inocencio y cinco  quien  procreo cuatro hijos quienes tres ya están casados y uno está a su responsabilidad y es  Carlos Eduardo de dieciocho años de edad.
   Ella se dedica a su hogar a la elaboración de tamales de mole, de masa y de chipilín, y solicito  el préstamo para la compra de ingredientes que necesita apara realizar su actividad  que es con la que se está apoyando  con los ingresos de su hogar.
   Lo que  lo motivo a ello fue su familia ya que para salir adelante y tener lo más necesario   se dedicaría a una actividad que el de un mejor rendimiento para tener un poco mas de dinero.
     Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda tener sus propios ahorros para seguir apoyando a su hijo que está estudiando.
texts.en:
Sra. Evangelina and her husband, Sr. Inocencio, have four children, three of whom are married and independent.  Their youngest child, Carlos Eduardo, is eighteen years old.  
Evangelina operates a business making and selling tamales de mole, tamales de masa, and tamales de chipilin.  She is applying for a loan so that she can buy the ingredients she needs to continue the business and generate the income that she needs to support her family.
She started the business to help her family and she hit upon making and selling tamales because it seemed like the most likely way for her to earn the income she needed.
What she most wants now is to ensure that her little business generates enough income to allow her to help her son finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tamales business.

loans.name: Maimounata

texts.fr:
Madame Maimounata est une femme mariée de 30 ans et mère de 2 enfants qui vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, cette femme s’est initiée à une activité génératrice de revenus qui est la teinture, à Sikasso avec une teinturière de la place il y a environ quatre ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout lors des cérémonies (Mariage, baptême, fêtes, etc.). 
Ses ressources propres ne pouvant pas lui permettre de satisfaire ses besoins, elle sollicite ce prêt auprès de Soro Yiriwaso, pour acheter 10 pièces de bazins blancs, 10 boites de teintures de couleurs différentes et 12 sachets de soude caustique afin de satisfaire sa clientèle qui ne cesse d’augmenter.    
 Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les commerçants en matières premières (bazins blancs, soude caustique et teinture) pour les mettre dans les différentes couleurs. Bien teintés les bazins sont ensuite revendus soit au comptant et à crédit, elle a pour client(e)s potentiel(le)s, les revendeuses des bazins teintés, les couturiers et les femmes de son quartier.
Madame Maimounata  est en relation avec Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ huit années Après 4 prêts solidaires dans une association des femmes de son quartier et elle est maintenant à son 8ème prêt individuel et tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 200 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales en aidant son époux, payer les intérêts de son prêt et renforcer son activité de teinture.
texts.en:
Ms. Maimounata is a 30-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She lives with her husband and their children in Hamdallaye, a working-class district in Sikasso city (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Four years ago, after having run several businesses unsuccessfully, this woman became familiar with a revenue-generating business, which is the dying of cloth, in Sikasso with a local expert. She enjoys a strong reputation in this business and receives many orders, especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, holidays, etc.) 

Because her own resources cannot allow her to meet her needs, she is requesting this loan from the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to buy 10 lengths of white damask cloth, 10 containers of dyes of different colors, and 12 pouches of caustic soda in order to satisfy her ever-growing customer base. She gets her supplies locally from merchants supplying the raw ingredients (white damask, caustic coda, and dyes) and places them into the different dyes. The dyed damask is then sold, either for cash or on credit. Her potential customers are retailers of dyed damask, tailors, and women in her neighborhood. 

Ms. Maimounata has had an association with Soro Yiriwaso for about eight years. After four solidarity loans in a women's association in her district, she is now on her eighth individual loan. The previous loans have all been repaid correctly. 

She plans on making an average monthly profit of 200,000 francs CFA that will be put toward covering family expenses by helping out her husband, paying the loan interest, and bolstering her cloth dying business.

loans.use: to buy white damask, caustic soda, and containers of dye

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old and married with seven children.

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Lucia has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 17 years and earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Lucia aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell.

loans.name: Fanny María

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Ave Fénix.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Fanny, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de  12 y 4 años de edad, el mayor  estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante. Nuestra amiga lleva en el Banco Comunal 10 Años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos tiene su negocio en el que se gana la vida sin tener que salir de su casa y descuidar a sus hijos.

Ella tiene un negocio en su casa en el que vende tarjetas y recargas telefónicas, además de productos Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). También vende helados, sodas y cervezas, trabaja todos los días ya que como su negocio lo tiene en casa no se le hace difícil estar al tanto de su negocio y su hogar, solo a veces en las noches ella se va a ofrecer sus productos por el lugar donde vive aprovechando que su esposo ya está en casa, lleva 5 años dedicada a esta actividad y nos cuenta que a pesar de la crisis le va bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, tarjetas y recargas telefónicas.
 
Sus sueños son tener una tienda de víveres con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Ave Fénix Communal Bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.

This is the place where we meet Fanny, age 40.  She is married and has two children, ages 12 and 4.  The oldest goes to school.  Her husband is a merchant.  Our friend has been in the communal bank for ten years.  She likes it because, thanks to the loans, she has her business.  The business is her way of earning a living without leaving the house or neglecting her children.

She sells rechargeable phone plans and calling cards at the store she has in her house.  She also sells Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women’s accessories).  She also sells ice cream, soda, and beer.  She works every day.  As her business is in her house, it is not difficult for her to keep track of her business and her home.  Only sometimes she goes to sell her products at night in the place where she lives, taking advantage of the fact that her husband is at home.  She has been doing this for five years.  She tell us that in spite of the crisis it is going well for her.

The loan is to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, phone plans, and calling cards.

Her dream is to have a grocery store that has everything it needs.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, phone plans, and calling cards.

loans.name: Sophin

texts.en:
Sophin (in the photo), 42, lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She is a widow with two sons and one daughter. Two assist their mother in the business and the other one is still young. 

Sophin is a banana and flower farmer. Her two children sell the flowers and bananas in Phnom Penh market.  

Sophin is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to carry bananas and flowers to market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to transport flowers and bananas to market.

loans.name: Narannyam

texts.en: Narannyam is 27 years old and a television broadcaster. He is unmarried and lives with his mom and brothers in the ger district of traditional Mongolian nomadic tents in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He is a very hard-working man who want be busy all the weekdays. He has a plan to start a grocery store business near his home selling basic food commodities needed by the households around his store. This month he will start to build his store and needs money to buy the building materials necessary. He took a loan from other bank which he repaid successfully on time.

loans.use: To buy building materials necessary to build his grocery store.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: Elena, de 55 años, habita en el caserío de Shururuyoc. Ahí formó su familia junto a Fidel, su esposa. Ambos tienen 3 hijos menores que le ayudan en el trabajo diario y los que cuidan en su casa propia. A pesar de su avanzada edad, está trabajadora mujer empieza cada día con su faena agrícola; se despierta con los primeros rayos de sol y se dirige a sus campos para vigilarlos y brindarles mantenimiento. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, arvejas y habas; junto a su esposo recogen la cosecha cuando esta lista luego de meses de esfuerzo, ven recompensada su labor cuando venden toda su producción a los diversos mayoristas de la zona, que cargan todo para venderlo en la ciudad de Tarma. Dice que el trabajo en el campo no es tan complicado ya que todos los miembros de su familia trabajan en conjunto. Además recibe el apoyo de su esposo, que trabaja en el mejoramiento de carreteras, donde recibe un salario del estado. Ahora desea mejorar sus sembríos y así obtener mejores ganancias en la cosecha. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Campo verde” y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde está muy agradecida, por la oportunidad que le brindan para continuar trabajando sin dificultad; además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Elena de recibir su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja, 3 sacos de semilla de habas y fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en: Fifty-five-year-old Elena lives in the small village of Shururuyoc.  That is where she started her family with Fidel, her husband.  Together they have three young children who help them with their daily work and whom they take care of at home.  Despite her age, this hardworking woman starts each day with her farm work; she wakes up at sunrise and heads to her fields to watch over them and maintain them.  The main crops she grows are potatoes, peas, and broad beans.  Together with her husband she harvests the crops when they are ready after months of effort.  Their work is rewarded when they sell all their produce to different wholesalers in the area, who take everything to be sold in the city of Tarma.  She says that working in the fields is not that complicated since all her family members work together.  In addition, her husband helps support her with his work in road improvement, for which he receives a state salary.  Currently, she wants to improve her fields and thus earn more from her harvests.  She belongs to the Campo Verde Communal Bank and this is her sixth loan with MFP, to whom she is very thankful for the opportunity it offers her to keep working without obstacles.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  Upon receiving your help, Elena will invest the loan money in buying two bags of pea seed, three bags of broad bean seed, and natural fertilizers for her next sowing.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seed, three bags of broad bean seed, and bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Clemencia Concepción

texts.es:
La Señora Clemencia es socia del banco comunal Alianza Unida, vive por la parroquia de Chiquintad (Cuenca), este lugar tiene hermosos paisajes para admirar y disfrutar, su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, se caracterizan por ser personas amables, gentiles y solidarias, mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Clemencia tiene 64 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados e independientes. Su esposo es comerciante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Clemencia trabaja en su propio negocio, ella tiene un restaurante y entrega de viandas, esta actividad la desempeña hace 6 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes todo el día. En sus tiempos libres también se dedica la costura realizando todo arreglo de prendas de vestir.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 13 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de vajilla y víveres para su negocio. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Clemencia is a member of the “Alianza Unida” communal bank.  She lives in Chiquintad Parish (Cuenca).  This place has beautiful scenery to admire and enjoy.  Its residents are merchants, raise livestock and farm.  They are noted for being kind, charming and mutually supportive; they keep their customs and traditions.

Clemencia is 64 years old, married and has two children who are adults, married and independent.  Her husband’s a merchant.  They do not own a house; they are renters.

Clemencia works in her own business. She has a restaurant and also delivers meals.  She’s been in this business for six years.  She works Monday through Friday all day.  In her free time she also sews making all sorts of clothing repairs and alterations.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for 13 years and will use her new loan to buy dinnerware and foodstuffs for her restaurant.  Her dream is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy dinnerware and foodstuffs.

loans.name: Djidemi Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DJIDEMI est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Brigitte, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Brigitte est âgée de 52 ans et est une veuve. Brigitte a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et encore à sa charge. Brigitte vit seule avec ses enfants et assure leurs différentes charges. Brigitte n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis trois ans, Brigitte exerce comme activité, la vente d’akassa (aliment local fait à base d’amidon de maïs) accompagné de poissons frits de façon ambulante ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Brigitte désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Brigitte sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DJIDEMI, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The DJIDEMI group consists of three people who live in the same Benin neighborhood.  Brigitte, the representative of this group, is the person whose hand is raised in the photo.  This is the second time that this group has sought financial support from ALIDé to increase their business.  Brigitte is a 52 year-old widow.  She has two children who have been to school and are still in her care.  Brigitte lives alone with her children and takes care of their expenses.   Brigitte didn’t attend school.  For the past three years, Brigitte has been working as an itinerant vendor selling akassa (a thick corn meal porridge) with fried fish.  This enables her to take care of her family without having to struggle a great deal.  Hoping to respond better to customer demand, Brigitte wants to build up her stock of products and to expand her business.  In order to do this, Brigitte, together with the other members of the DJIDEMI group, is seeking a second loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: To buy corn, vegetable oil and fresh fish.

loans.name: Suiumkan

texts.en:
Suiumkan, 55, is a widow who has raised a son and three daughters. The older children are married and live with their respective families. The younger daughters are students, and when they are not working on their studies, they help their mother with housework. In order to earn her livelihood Suiumkan sells meat at the market. She started this business in 1995 with an initial investment of 1000 soms. Her monthly profit is now about 5000 soms, which has enabled her to provide her children with an education. She wants to use her loan to purchase six livestock animals. In the future Suiumkan would like to open her own butcher shop.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society); Planet (remaining environmentally friendly); and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.  If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team: "Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance" at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase six livestock animals.

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.en:
Dionicio has operated his rice farming business for almost 38 years. Though he didn't finish his education, he is still proud because he is a good farmer. He is 58 years old, and settled into marriage at a young age. He is grateful because he is blessed with four children, and he spends his income on them. 

Dionicio's wife is a business woman because she is running her variety store. The couple is aiming to obtain plentiful harvest this next cropping season because his rice crops were destroyed by a typhoon last October. He needs to improve his rice fields so that he can gain greater profits to earn a living. Dionicio can't make his dreams come true nowadays because he suffered from the shortage of income, so he is requesting for a loan amount of PHP 25,000. This amount would really help him in making the land more productive by providing the necessary farm inputs. He will be using his loan request to buy hybrid seeds, insecticides, fertilizer, and some amount will be use to pay for the labor cost of transplanting and sowing rice crops for his farm land. He would be glad if his request would be approved.

loans.use: to buy hybrid seeds, insecticides, fertilizer; some amount will be use to pay for the labor cost of transplanting and sowing of the rice crop to his farmland.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is married to Richard, and she is the mother of two children. She is 30 years old and lives Nazareth, Buenavista, Pagadian City, Philippines.

For the past five years, she has earned her living by raising hogs. Marissa has requested a loan of 50,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase feed, vitamins, and pigs for her hog-raising business. She has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cement and sand.

loans.name: Lolito

texts.en:
This is Lolito, who is 21 years old and single. He is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines who works hard to continually provide income for his everyday expenses. Lolito operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal in the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP's worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Lolito earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling small quantities. His store is located adjacent to his house and his regular customers are his neighbors and local community members. Lolito earns a minimum of 300 PHP every day.

Lolito is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan to help continue to operate his business. He will buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand his product inventory. Lolito expects a boost in his business income as he expands. Lolito faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God. 

* All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and products to sell

loans.name: Rigoberto De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Rigoberto posee una tienda en el municipio de Bello al norte de la ciudad de Medellín, con la que sostiene los gastos de su hogar donde convive con su esposa y su hijo. En la tienda vende principalmente productos de la canasta familiar, además de snack y licor. Con el ánimo de aprovechar la temporada de fin de año, donde el consumo de licor se aumenta, el señor Rigoberto requiere de la compra de mercancía para tener un inventario prudente de acuerdo al nivel de la demanda de la temporada de fin de año. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y se consolide como un buen negocio en el sector y las ventas le permitan tener unos ingresos con los que pueda mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y brindarle la mejor educación a su hijo.
texts.en:
Rigoberto owns a store in the community of Bello north of the city of Medellín that produces income to meet household expenses for his home where he lives with his wife and son.  

He sells basic staple items in the store as well as snacks and liquor.  In hopes of taking advantage of end of year sales when liquor consumption increases Rigoberto needs to buy merchandise to have a prudent inventory of stock available in tune with end of year demand.  

His dream is that the business grows and become established as a good business in the sector and that sales will allow him to have income with which to improve his family’s quality of life and to provide a better education for his son.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La señora Zoraida, es casada, tiene 50 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que viven con ella pero ambos trabajan y la ayudan con la manutención del hogar. La señora Zoraida es comerciante, vive en  la ciudad de Itá, donde posee una despensa bien surtida, allí provee a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes de todo tipo de insumos de primera necesidad para el hogar, tales como azúcar, arroz, leche, bebidas en general y otros productos.
Solicita el préstamo para compra de dichos insumos y así aumentar el stock de su despensa a modo de incrementar sus ingresos familiares y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
La solicitante es cliente antigua de la Fundación Paraguaya, demuestra ser una mujer emprendedora y muy trabajadora que lucha por el bienestar de su familia y por ir creciendo cada día como miro empresaria y como jefa de familia.
texts.en:
Zoraida is married, she is 50 years old, and has 2 children who live with her, though both work and help her with household expenses. Zoraida is a merchant. She lives in the city of Itá, where she has a small, well-stocked grocery store. She provides her neighbors and occasional other customers all kinds of items of daily use for the home, such as sugar, rice, milk, a variety of drinks, and other products.

She is requesting a loan to buy these products and increase the stock in her store so that she can improve her family’s income and improve her family’s quality of life.

She is an established client with Fundación Paraguaya who has shown herself to be a very enterprising and hardworking woman who works hard for the well-being of her family. She also works to continue growing as a small businesswoman each day and as a leader of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, milk, a variety of drinks, and other products

loans.name: Butende T/c Group

texts.en: Moses, pictured in a blue shirt and a cap, has dealt in coffee for two years now. He does this business to meet the needs of his family. He would be doing well now, given the fact that coffee is a major cash crop, but his challenges are limited capital and price fluctuations. He hopes with time and with the help of loans his income will improve and his standard of living, as well as that of his family, will improve. His hope is to build a better future for his family. He is hard working and honest. He would like to be trusted so that he can be given more money any time he needs it. (The seventh person, at far right in the photo, is the group chairperson, who is not acquiring a loan this cycle.)

loans.use: To buy organic manure for his coffee plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an additional lot of merchandise

loans.name: Kelly Martha

texts.es: La cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó hace unos años atrás cuando trabajaba con una prima vendiendo ropa por catálogo.  Desde entonces le ha gustado esta actividad y la realiza con la finalidad de ayudar a su esposo en la economía familiar.  Trabaja con él por las mañanas especialmente, que es cuando realiza las cobranzas de sus pedidos.  Además, su esposo labora en un taxi el resto del día.  Tiene 2 niñas pequeñas y desea en un futuro incrementar su negocio de ropa con mucha más mercadería.  Necesita el dinero para la adquisición de blusas, pantalones y ropa interior,
texts.en:
This borrower is from the city of Libertad. A few years ago, she began working with her cousin by selling clothes through catalogs. Since then, she has enjoyed this line of work and it has enabled her to help her husband with the family’s finances. The borrower works at her business mostly in the mornings, which is when she collects her orders. In addition, her husband works the rest of the day by driving a taxi. They have two young daughters. In the future, she would like to increase her clothing business by adding more merchandise.

The borrower needs money so that she can acquire blouses, trousers, and undergarments.

loans.use: to buy blouses, trousers, and undergarments.

loans.name: Octavien

texts.en: Octavien is 47 years old. He is married with three children aged between 10 and 20 years. They all go to school and they are in private schools.  One of them joined in University called ULK. He owns a shop and he has been doing business for the past 4 years. His wife is business woman also. He is requesting a loan for school fees and he would like to pay in installments. After paying school fees, he plans to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to pay in installments for school fees.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: At 75 Mama Anna M. is our most senior client and very active. Mama M. sells vegetable and fruits at her local market in Akites to support herself and 5 grandchildren (orphans) left behind by her children who died of HIV/AIDS. Her first loan of $ 43 from PEMCI was repaid timely. She has requested for a second loan of $150 to grow her vegetable business. Mama M. is a source of pride to us at her age she is not out begging for handouts to support these orphans to instead works hard. She deserves all the support she can get from us and we are very proud to be associated with her. She is also a source of encouragement and inspiration to other elderly grand mamas facing similar situation. We at Pemci are willing to help such elderly care givers to be self-sufficient.

loans.use: To boost vegetable sales

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Mrs. Margaret O. is a 50 year old woman with seven children. She studied her trade for 3 years and finally opened her own business in 2001.$800 is requested to help buy more goods for sale.

loans.use: To buy more goods for sale

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a widow and she has four children. When her husband passed away, the oldest child was 17, and even though Teresa was working for a company it was not sufficient to cover the expenses of the home and the school fees of the children. For that reason she decided to start her own business selling food. After a short time, she changed it to selling shoes and new and used clothing. Fortunately, her customers and her income have both increased. Thanks to Teresa's work, her oldest son has now finished his studies, and she hopes the rest can too.

In order to keep her business growing, Teresa is requesting a loan in the amount of $475, which she will use to buy merchandise with the goal of offering better service to her customers and new buyers. She will repay the loan over a period of 5 to 10 months. Now is the moment to help someone who really needs it. Please decide to support Teresa.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

Teresa es viuda y tiene cuatro hijos, cuando su esposo falleció sus hijos estaban estudiando, el mayor tenía 17 años, a pesar de que ella trabajaba para un empresa no era suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar y la escuela de sus hijos, razón por la que decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de comida, que poco después cambiaría, ahora se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa nueva y usada, afortunadamente sus clientes se han incrementado así como sus beneficios, gracias al trabajo que realiza Teresa sus hijo mayor ha logrado concluir sus estudios, y desea que los demás también puedan hacerlo.

Para que su negocio pueda creer, Teresa solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía con la finalidad de brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y nuevos compradores, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Hoy es momento de ayudar a quien más lo necesite, no lo pienses más y decidete a apoyarla.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda started  her business of buying clothing in Desaguadero and Juliaca and selling it in the gold mining towns of Ananeya five years ago, joining her uncles´ family business. She spends most of her week traveling. On Tuesdays through Thursdays she travels to Desaguadero or buys in Juliaca and on Fridays she leaves for Ananeya to sell all weekend to miners. This is an extremely profitable business since goods are very cheap in Desaguadero and Juliaca, but are in high demand and very little supply in Ananeya. She hopes that with a new loan of $1,200 she will be able to buy household appliances such as blenders, microwaves and food processors to add to her current range of goods for sale in Aneneya.

loans.use: Expand sales business to include household appliances.

loans.name: Dora Julia

texts.es:
Dora is a selfless mother, and very entrepreneurial. When her husband decided to abandon she and their children, she had to take the reins of her home and do many of the tasks that, up until that point, he had done. Without any other help than that of her children’s, she started a business selling newspapers in a small place near an area with a lot of traffic. Little by little, and with a lot of work, she was able to buy a stand and also offer other products of the type customers want to buy when they get their daily newspaper. The improvements she has made to the stand have made it look better, however there is still much to be done. Dora is requesting a loan of $200.00, which she is committed to repaying in 6 months, so that she can fulfill this wish she has in her heart.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Dora es una madre abnegada y muy emprendedora, cuando su esposo decidió abandonarlos ella tuvo que llevar las riendas de su hogar y tuvo que suplir muchas de las funciones que hasta ahora las había realizado él.Sin otro apoyo más que el de sus hijos emprendió el negocio de la venta de periódicos en un pequeño espacio cerca de los lugares de mayor concurrencia poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo pudo adquirir un stand ofrecer también otros productos a los que ya están acostumbrados los clientes que a diario adquieren un ejemplar para informarse del acontecer nacional.Sus mejoras han contribuido a que el puesto se vea cada vez más vistoso pero aún así existen muchas reparaciones y acabados que deben ser atendidos con urgencia con el fin de brindarle comodidad y novedad a cada uno de sus lectores.Por esta razón Dora solicita un préstamo de 200 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses para que pueda cumplir el deseo que mantiene dentro de su corazón.

loans.use: To repair and renovate her newspaper stand

loans.name: Identity

texts.en: The entrepreneur is 33 years old. He is married and has two children. His mother moved in with him after his father died. He has a small computer shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new internet system to share out internet lines with houses and shops near to his shop. He also wants to renovate the shop to increase his income and develop his business. He wants to save for a better life for his family.

loans.use: Purchase a new internet system

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en: Joumana is a 29 year old woman. She lives in south Lebanon, in the region of Nabatieh. Joumana produces processed food and sells plastic containers for kitchen use. Joumana is single and needs to provide for herself. She therefore also works in an industriA. plant that makes jams. She needs $200 to buy the necessary provisions to sustain her own business in producing processed food.

loans.use: Joumana would like to buy provisions for her business.

loans.name: Masanda (Iv) Group

texts.en: Rebecca is 38 years old and married with four children. She heads a small retail shop, and would like to use the extra profits to finish her shop sites that are under construction.

loans.use: To add stock in a retail shop.

loans.name: Chibike

texts.en: Chibike I. specializes in the sales of cosmetics and weaves. According to him, if the loan amount of $600 is given to him, it will go a long way to buy more cosmetics and improve his business. He is 27 years old and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He learned this business for 6 years and started in 2005. He has been with LAPO for 2 years and he thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Sampois

texts.en:
Mrs. Samphois Y. and her husband have been married since 2000. They have two children; one son and one daughter. The son studies in the local school and the daughter still is young and stays at home. The family lives along Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Samphois has been in the business of weaving silk for ten years. She learned her skill from her sister. Her husband is a worker and does farming and raising pigs. Samphois is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1000 for purchasing silk material for weaving and buying baby pigs for raising.

loans.use: For purchasing silk material for weaving and buy baby pigs for raising

loans.name: Julie

texts.es:
Julie has been a member of Los Sauces Communal Bank for one year, where she learned values and how to save.

Julie is 40 years old, and married with three children. Julie sells caña (liquor made from sugar cane) to local stores, and her husband travels to the city of Apurimac to buy the caña. Julie recently installed a store in her house where she sells caña, sodas, candies, and would like to expand her selection.

Julie needs a loan of 1500 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of caña, sodas, sugar, rice, and noodles, thereby supplying her business.

Julie dreams of helping her children get ahead, so that they can become professionals. Julie would like to expand her business and own her home.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

Julie pertenece al Banco Comunal Los Sauces hace 1 año, en su Banco Comunal aprendió los valores y a ahorrar.

Julie es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Julie vende caña (aguardiente elaborado de caña de azúcar) y sus ventas lo realiza de tienda en tienda, su esposo es quien viaja a la ciudad de Apurimac para comprar la caña. Recientemente Julie aperturó una tienda en su casa donde vende caña, gaseosas, golosinas y piensa surtir más su negocio.

Julie necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de caña, gaseosas, azúcar, arroz, fideo y así surtir más su negocio .

Los sueños de Julie es sacar adelante a sus hijos y sean profesionales, ampliar su negocio y tener casa propia.

loans.use: Julie needs a loan of 1500 soles, which she will invest in the purchase of caña, sodas, sugar, rice, and noodles, thereby supplying her business.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Investment of First Loan:

Graciela could buy all the necessary agricultural supplies to attend to the demands of her clients. That is to say that she could buy everything in time, harvesting her crop as expected and marketing all her product.

Development of Business:

The 5 blocks that she possesses have permitted her to have sufficient land to cultivate not only rice but also related products such as corn. Five years of experience vouch for the quality and quantity of her products.

Personal information:

Graciela is 21 years old. She is a single woman. She has 1 son, that still is small and does not go to school. Her dwelling is of mixed construction; cane and wood. One of her aspirations is to improve the quality of life of her son and to improve her house.

Use of Second Loan:

With this new loan she will buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment, rent machinery and contract labor to take advantage of the winter season and to save irrigation. The advantage of her location is that it is in the high part of this coastal sector.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=12648

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Inversión de Primer Préstamo:

Graciela pudo comprar todos los insumos agrícolas necesarios para atender la demanda de sus clientes. Es decir que compro todo a tiempo, terminando su cosecha como el esperaba y comercializando todo su producto.

Desarrollo de Negocio:

Las 5 cuadras que posee, le han permitido tener terreno suficiente para cultivar no solo arroz sino productos afines como por ejemplo el maíz. 5 años de experiencia avalan la calidad y cantidad de sus productos.

Información Personal :

Graciela tiene 21 años. Es Soltera. Tiene 1 hijo, que todavía es pequeño y no estudia. Su vivienda es de construcción mixta caña y madera. Una de sus aspiraciones es mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y mejorar su casa.

Uso de Segundo Préstamo:

Con este nuevo préstamo comprara abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, equipo menor, alquiler de maquinarias, contratación de mano de obra, y otros insumos necesarios para aprovechar la época invernal, y ahorrar el riego. La ventaja del sector es que esta en la parte alta de este sector costero.

Previous Profile: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=12648

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplements, seeds, fertilizer, small equipment, rent machinery and contract labor to cultivate a winter crop on her land.

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Ardiani

texts.id:
Gusti Ayu is a mother of two. She and her husband together with their children live a simple life. Gusti Ayu works as a manufacturing worker in a furniture factory, however her salary is not enough to meet her family's daily needs. Therefore around 6 months ago she decided to take for a loan from Dinari so she can afford to buy a breeding pig and to start a small pig breeding business as her side business.

With the loan money she bought 2 breeding female pigs which in turn can produce 18 piglets. These piglets were sold for IDR 250 thousand/ piglet (around USD 31/ piglet) so her revenue was IDR 4.5 million (around USD 562). This revenue was deducted with money spent for pig feed for a 6 month period of IDR 1.4 million (around USD 175), so she earned a net profit of USD 387 in a 6 month period.

Therefore she is now decided to again applying for the 2nd loan from Dinari so she can continue expanding her business. She hopes she can improve her family's welfare more and also to enable her to get more money for her's children school fees.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Gusti Ayu Ardiyani adalah seorang wanita yang ulet dalam melakukan pekerjaannya. Dalam keadaan ekonomi sekarang yang semakin sulit, Gusti Ayu yang kesehariannya sebagai buruh mebel belumlah cukup untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya yang terdiri dari suami dan 2 orang anaknya yang masih bersekolah. Dengan situasi seperti ini Gusti Ayu Ardiyani mengambil keputusan untuk ikut memelihara atau berternak babi. Melalui program DINARI, pada periode pinjaman pertama digunakan untuk membeli 2 ekor induk babi. Dari 2 ekor induk babi tersebut melahirkan 18 ekor anak babi dan bisa dijual dengan harga Rp. 250.000 / ekor. Dari 18 ekor anak babi tersebut diperoleh hasil penjualan sebesar Rp. 4.500.000.- / 6 bulan, yang dipotong untuk pakan induk sebesar Rp. 1.400.000.- / enam bulan. Jadi Gusti Ayu mendapatkan keuntungan sebesar Rp. 515.000.- / bulan. Dari hasil yang diperoleh dari pinjaman pertama tersebut Gusti Ayu memutuskan untuk kembali meminjam ke DINARI untuk meningkatkan penjualan anak babinya dengan menambah induk babi yang ada. Sehingga Gusti Ayu dapat meningkatkan penghasilan keluarganya untuk mencukupi kebutuhan keluarga dan untuk biaya anak sekolah.

loans.use: To buy breeding pig (Membeli induk babi)

loans.name: Tiki

texts.en:
Tiki P. is a 40-year-old married woman with 2 children. She has 3 years of experience in the farming/chicken business. Accordingly, she is able to sell her products to the publics 6 days per week. On average, her weekly net cash flow is approximately 300 Tala ($125 USD).

She has received 2 previous loans from SPBD. In fact, SPBD loans are Tiki’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from any of the traditional banks. With the loans proceeds, she is hoping to expand and improve her business by purchasing wire.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing wire

loans.name: Nsengiyumva

texts.en:
Greetings from V., a businessman in Kabuga, Rwanda.  V. is 27 years old and married with two children and two adopted orphans.

In 2005, as an orphan from the Genocide, V. had to take care of his mother and sisters and started selling bananas in the market, transporting them on the local wooden bicycle, with a loan of about $110. He has been able to build his house and operates his own shop selling different items like bananas, soap, and cassava flour, fertilizers and chemical sprays. He grows tomatoes and bananas and sells them in the local market. He employs 3 people in his business. The loan request is for 515,000 frws to be repaid in 8 months.

loans.use: The loan will be used to increase his stock.

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.ru:
Сафарова Наргиз родилась в 1983 году. Она замужем и имеет 1 ребенка. Наргиз является одним из преуспевающим бизнесменом в своем городе. Начала бизнес как продавщица у своей знакомой, которая продавала ткани и материалы. Набрав опыта в продажи тканей и материалов, изучая востребованость рынка, решила открыть свой бизнес. И вот уже 4 года  торгует тканями самых разных  видов. Ее ассортимент состоит из ворсовых, шелковых шифоновых тканей. У нее есть постоянные клиенты. Местом ее деятельности является рынок «Сафина» города Рудаки, а закупает она товар в оптовом рынке «Корвон» города Душанбе.
Наргиз хочет получить займ в сумме 4100 сомони и увеличить оборотный капитал.
texts.en:
Nargiz S. was born in 1983. She is married with one child. Nargiz is one of the most successful businesspeople in the city. She began in business as a saleswoman for an acquaintance who sold fabrics and materials. After she received experience in selling fabric and material and researched demand in the market, she decided to open her own business. Now, she has been trading in different kinds of fabrics for four years. Her inventory consists of velvet, silk, and chiffon. She has regular customers. Her shop is in the Safin market in Rudaki, and she buys her goods in the wholesale market Korvon in Dushanbe. Nargiz wants to receive a loan for 4,100 somoni to increase her working capital.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Getu

texts.en: N. Getu is a single mother of 5 children with her own business ("Gomesi") sewing school uniforms and ladies' traditional wear.  She makes uniforms for three schools and often gets commissions from the Kampala City Council to make uniforms for orphans, and this ready market helps to boost her income. She is so grateful for the loans that have been like a partner to her after her husband's sudden disappearance without a trace 8 years ago (she is unsure whether to say she is married or a widow). She now cares for three grandchildren whose parents (her own children) died of AIDS. She needs a loan to be able to buy more material for making both school uniforms and ladies' traditional wear.

loans.use: Nabaweesi Getu needs a loan to buy more material for making both school uniforms and ladies' traditional wear.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 31 años de edad, estudió tercero de secundaria, es casada, tiene 02 hijas de 06, 04 años de edad, vive en el Jr. José Carlos Mariategui S/N, del Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo – Puno.

Es socia del Banco Comunal “La Yunyuyeñita”- Yunguyo, con su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró: papa, chuño. Avena, para ser comercializado en las ferias de Huapaca, Huacullani. Desde los 18 años de edad se fue a la ciudad de Tacna a trabajar como empleada de hogar, a los 20 años de edad tuvo su pareja y ambos hacían negocio de productos (abarrotes), durante los últimos 04 años se dedica al negocio de productos agrícolas (papa, chuño, haba), que compra de Yunguyo, Centro Poblado de Chacachaca y vende en las ferias de Huapaca, Huacullani.

Con el crédito de S/.1200.00 nuevos soles, que pagará en 06 cuotas, comprará: 10 arrobas de haba con S/.250.00, 10 arrobas de chuño con S/.350.00, 10 arrobas de avena con S/.200.00.

Su meta es tener una casa propia, aperturar su tienda de abarrotes o ferretería  y que sus hijas estudien.
texts.en:
Marleny is 31 years old, studied to the third year of high school, is married, has 2 daughters of 6 and 4 years of age, lives at Jr. José Carlos Mariategui S/N, of the District and Province of Yunguyo – Puno. She is a member of “La Yunyuyeñita” Communal Bank in Yunguyo and with her first loan of S/. 300.00 new soles she bought: potatoes, chuño (freeze dried potato) and oatmeal to be sold at the markets of Huapaca, Huacullani. When she was 18 years old she went to the city of Tacna to work as a domestic employee and at 20 years of age she and her partner both had businesses selling products (groceries). In the last 4 years she has worked selling agricultural products (papa, chuño, fava beans), which she buys in Yunguyo, the populated area of Chacachaca and sells in the markets of Huapaca, Huacullani. With the loan of S/.1200.00 new soles, which she will pay in 6 installments, she will buy: 10 sacks of fava beans with S/.250.00, 10 sacks of chuño with S/.350.00, 10 sacks of oatmeal with S/.200.00. Her goals are to have her own home, to open her grocery or hardware store and that her daughters are educated.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fava bean, freeze dried potatoes, oatmeal (agricultural products).

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Amanda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Bellavista”, ubicado en el PSJ. Coronel Bustamante Nº 157, distrito D. Callería, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 46 años D. edad, es madre soltera con 3 hijos, 2 mayores D. edad y uno que aún dependen D. ella. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. gaseosas. 

En la actualidad cuenta con la venta D. comida y bebidas. En las mañanas va al mercado a comprar lo necesario para preparar sus deliciosos platos D. comida. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, comprará 10 pollos, 9 kilos D. carne, 7 kilos D. arroz, 4 paquetes D. gaseosas, etc.

Amanda se siente contenta porque pertenece a un banquito D. mujeres luchadoras y  trabajadoras, que tienen el deseo D. seguir triunfando en la vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amanda belongs to the community bank of Bellavista, located in the district of Calleria, department of Ucayali. She is 46 years old, single mother of 3 children, 2 of them are adults and one of them is still a dependant. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.300 she bought sodas. Currently she sells food and sodas. She goes to the market in the morning to buy supplies to prepare her delicious meals. With the loan she is requesting of S/.3,000, which will be paid in 5 months, she will buy 10 chickens, 9 kilos of meat, 7 kilos of rice and 4 packs of sodas, etc. Amanda is happy to belong to a bank of hard working women and wants to enjoy life.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 chickens, 9 kilos of meat, 7 kilos of rice and 4 packs of sodas, etc.

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika es una joven de 24 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres. Desde pequeña aprendió el oficio de la familia, que es el cultivo de productos agrícolas, y gracias a su gran habilidad se ha independizado de sus padres y desde hace 2 años empezó a invertir en sus  propios cultivos, en los cuales le va muy bien, ya que el mercado es altamente demandante de estos productos durante todo el año, y Erika trata de aprovechar en todo tiempo de mejorar la calidad de su producción, para así poder incrementar el valor de venta y tener mayor competitividad entre los demás agricultores, pero para ello requiere de buenos abonos que es lo más costoso. Erika inicia su primer préstamo y está muy feliz de poder formar parte de un grupo que confía en su persona. Para mejorar su producción tendrá que invertir 1000 soles en la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para sus terrenos, pero ella por ahora está pidiendo 300.
texts.en:
Erika is 24 years old, single, and lives with her parents. She began to learn the family farming business at a young age, and thanks to her skills, Erika is now able to support herself. For the last two years, Erika has been investing in her own crops. Things are going well because there’s a year-round high demand for these particular crops. Erika always tries to take advantage of the demand by increasing the quality of her products, which can boost sales prices and allow her business to compete with other farms. In order to improve her crops, she needs need good fertilizer, which is very expensive. This is Erika’s first loan, and she’s very happy to be involved with a group that has so much confidence in her. In order to improve her products, Erika will need to invest 1,000 Soles in fertilizers for her land, but for now, she’s only asking for 300 Soles ($100 US).

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizers for crops

loans.name: Farogat

texts.en:
Farogat H. is 34 years old. She is a divorced mother with two children. When her husband left her, she was left without steady income. Supporting her family on her own was very difficult. With the purpose of improving living conditions, she decided to start her own business of processing dried clingstone apricots and selling them at the local market. The business went very successfully after starting and now Farogat needs a loan in order to meet her customers' demand. She is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni ($ 600 USD) for the term of 11 months for purchasing still more apricots. Farogat feels this is the only way to earn enough to ensure that her children can stay in school and have a bright future.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing apricots for processing and sale

loans.name: Virginia Inés

texts.es:
La Sra. Virginia Ines B., desD. muy niña era una persona dedicada y con vocación al cuidado D. las plantas, es así que con el tiempo ella ve como una forma D. vivir y trabajar con la venta D. diferentes variedades D. plantas.
Al inicio ella compraba semillas, tierra, abono y hacia el cuidado D. las plantas durante todo el tiempo D. su crecimiento, pero esto le tomaba tiempo e inversión para el cuidado.
Es así como conoce a su esposo el Sr. Lucio G. que se dedicaba a la venta D. plantas especiales llamadas Árboles Enanos o Bonsái, y ambos dedican su tiempo a  vender este tipo D. plantas, ella ya compra las plantas grandes y formadas a precio económico y las revenD. a un precio mayor, y el esposo sigue con su actividad.
Los préstamos que solicita son D. montos bajos, destinando exclusivamente estos fondos a su capital D. trabajo.
Es una cliente puntual y responsable con sus pagos, también hay que destacar la seriedad y responsabilidad que inspiran como personas.
texts.en:
Ever since her youth, Mrs. Virginia Ines B. has been a very dedicated person, with a strong inclination towards plant care. With time, she began to see working with and selling plants as a way to make a living. At first she’d purchase seeds, dirt, and fertilizer and would care for plants during their growth period. However, this took much time and investment. This is how she met her husband, Mr. Lucio G., who sold specialty plants called Bonsai trees. Now they both dedicate their time to selling these plants. She buys the fully-grown and formed plants at a reduced rate and resells them at a higher price, while her husband continues with his activities. The loans she requests are of small sums, and the funds are used specifically for working capital. She is a responsible client, prompt in her payments. We also admire the seriousness and responsibility that they inspire as people.

Translated from Spanish by Maya Wisnievitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various plants

loans.name: Germán Alberto

texts.es: Germán Alberto G. A., reside en cantón el Zunzal, junto a su esposa e hijos. Posee una venta de medicinas naturales, las cuales las distribuye de manera ambulante en los diferentes cantones del puerto de La Libertad, así también los vende en su hogar. Germán tiene 50 años de edad y posee una excelente reputación por ser una persona muy responsable y trabajadora. Cada día Germán sale de su hogar decidido a vender lo más posible con el fin de poder brindarle un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y un mejor futuro a sus hijos, ya que el sueña con que sus hijos logren finalizar sus estudios para que puedan tener una vida mejor. Es por ello que Germán solicita un préstamo el cual le permita comprar más medicinas para poder tener mayor variedad y poder  brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ya que esto contribuirá a que obtenga mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Germán Alberto G. A. resides in the zone of Zunzal, together with his wife and children. He has a business selling natural medicines, which he distributes door to door in the different zones of the port of La Libertad. He also sells them in his home. Germán is 50 years old, and possesses an excellent reputation for being a very responsible and hard-working person. Every day Germán leaves his house determined to sell the most that is possible, at the end hoping to be able to give a better lifestyle to his family and a better future for his children. He dreams that his children achieve finishing their studies so that they can have a better life. It is for this that Germán is seeking a loan, which will permit him to buy more medicines to be able to have a better variety and give a better service to his clients; and this will contribute to obtaining better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more medicines for his business

location.town: Puerto de La Libertad, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Freol

texts.es: Freol tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero y actualmente vive en la casa de tus tíos. Por ser numerosos hermanos, se fue a vivir con sus tíos a los 12, quienes le inculcaron el trabajo, la perseverancia y los buenos hábitos. A los 18 años sembró empezó sembrando 5 kilos de semilla de alverjas en terrenos de sus tíos, le resultó bien esa cosecha y la vendió a buen precio. Desde entonces se propuso incrementar sus sembrios, actualmente siembra alverjas, habas, verduras y flores en chacras alquiladas, pero siempre trata de darse tiempo para apoyar a sus familiares en los trabajos y cultivos de sus plantas, y del mismo modo son sus tíos muy condescendientes con él. En este año piensa sembrar 5 hectáreas de papa, Freol se siente muy feliz y orgulloso de ser campesino. Este es su 8va préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado ser un cliente puntual en sus pagos, y nunca se descuidó de ahorrar mensualmente, del cual se siente muy feliz por pertenecer a este banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes para sus cultivos, tanto de papa, verduras y flores.
texts.en:
Freol is a 31 year old single man who is currently living with his aunt and uncle. Because he had so many siblings, he went to live with his aunt and uncle when he was 12 years old. They instilled in him a strong work ethic, perseverance, and good habits. At 18 years old he began planting with 5 kilos of seeds for peas on his aunt and uncle's land, and got a good harvest his first year, which he sold for a good price. Ever since, he set the goal of increasing his plantings, and currently raises peas, beans, greens, and flowers in rented plots, but he always tries to give himself time to help his family in their own work and crops. His aunt and uncle do the same for him. This year he is thinking of planting 5 hectares of potatoes. Freol is very happy and proud to be from the country.

This is Freol's eigth loan with MFP, and throughout this time has shown himself to be a client who pays on time and never fails to save a little every month. He feels very happy to belong to this communal bank. The money that he asks for is to buy fertilizers for his crops, as well as potatoes, greens, and flowers.

Translated from Spanish by Shaun Haines, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Alice

texts.fr:
K. Alice est née le 20 Juin 1970 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Alice est allée à l’école jusqu'en première année du lycée. Alice a abandonné l’école par manque de soutient financier. Alice est mariée et mère de six enfants dont quatre scolarisés; les deux autres n'ont pas encore l'âge d'aller à l'école. Après l’abandon de l’école, Alice aidait sa mère pour la vente de noix d'acajou grillés. Mais depuis 1989, Alice s’est mise à son propre compte, toujours pour la vente de noix d’acajou grillés.  Alice grille les noix d’acajou qu’elle met en bouteille pour vendre. Alice enregistre une forte demande de ce produit. C’est pourquoi Alice a besoin de plus de moyens financiers qu’elle en a pour acheter de noix d’acajou; afin de mieux faire fasse à la demande de sa clientèle.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
K. Alice was born on June 20, 1970 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She attended school through the 11th grade, although she dropped out due to a lack of financial support. She is married and the mother of six children, four of whom are in school; the other two are not yet school-age. After dropping out, Alice used to help her mother with selling roasted cashew nuts. But in 1989, she got started on her own, again selling roasted cashews. She grills the nuts and then places them into bottles for sale. She notes the high demand for this product. This is why she needs more funds than she has to buy cashews, so as to address the demands of her customers.

ALIDÉ means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. ALIDÉ offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Naziha Group

texts.en:
The name of this group is Naziha. It is made up of three ladies who live in the Bekaa region of Lebanon.

Aadla is a 41-year-old married woman. Aadla has been working in agriculture for 15 years. She requested a loan of $300 from Kiva's partner A. Majmoua in order to increase her herd of livestock. This is the first time that Aadla has requested a loan. Aadla is speciA. in her work because of her experience. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulties. Aadla decided on doing her business because there is demand for this work in her region. In the future, she plans on expanding her livestock herd.

Tayoubah is a 51-year-old married woman. Tayoubah has been working in agriculture for 25 years. She owns livestock. She requested a loan of $300 from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock herd. This is the first time that Tayoubah has requested a loan. Tayoubah is speciA. in her work because she likes what she does. Her clients are people from her region. When she first started her business, she didn’t face any difficulties. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Naziha is a 31-year-old woman. Naziha has been working in agriculture for 15 years. She owns livestock. She requested a loan of $300 from A. Majmoua in order to increase her livestock. This is the first time that Naziha has requested a loan. Naziha is speciA. in her work because of her experience. Her clients can be anyone from her region. Naziha decided on doing her business because she likes animals. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each member of the group receives an individuA. loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: The Naziah group will use the loan to increase their livestock herds

loans.name: Uljonoi

texts.ru: Алиева Улжоной живет в районе Рудаки. Возраст 47 лет. Незамужем, имеет двоих детей.  Улжоной имеет торговую точку на рынке "Сафина", она торгует материалами. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 22 года.Сын работает таксистом. Дочка помогает маме по бизнесу. Клиентка хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы пополнить свой ассортимент.
texts.en:
Uljonoi A. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 47 years old. She is not married and has two children. Uljonoi has a vendor space on the Safina market where she sells fabrics. She has been in this type of business for more than 22 years. Her son works as a taxi driver. Her daughter helps her mother with the business. Uljonoi wants to take out a loan to increase her inventory assortment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Chim R. currently sells a few cooking items in her village and has been earning an average of $2 per day since early 2008. As another source of income, her husband raises poultry in a stall behind their house. 
Chim is 41 years old, married and the mother of a teenage child, who is a student and under her care. The poultry business is growing, so Chim would like a $300 loan in order to purchase ducks to raise for laying eggs. Chim R. and her husband are in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase ducks to raise for laying eggs

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth still looks like a teenager at her age of 30 years. This is in relation to her direct selling business in which she sells different beauty products and personal things for men and women in their village at San Isidro, Ilagan, Isabela.

Janeth is married to Ramon, a government employee, and they have a daughter who is already 8 years old attending the third grade in the elementary. Janeth is so thankful for having a responsible husband and a loving daughter. They have a good relationship in the family. She hopes and prays that the good relationship they have for each other will remain as time goes by.

Janeth has been running her direct-selling business for almost three years. She uses the different company brochures of Avon, Boardwalk, Natasha, Sara Lee and MSE to encourage customers to place their orders which she will then purchase in the company branch outlet in the market.

Because she wants her business to grow further, Janet decided to request additional business capital of PHP 4,000 from Kiva lenders. She strongly believes that having enough capital will lead to a better business output if managed wisely. Furthermore, Janeth is saving not only for her daughter’s education but also for their house repairs somehow.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es: “Zapatito veloz” es un grupo de señoras que trabajan alegremente junto a su asesora de crédito y cuentan con 12 integrantes. Marcelina A. es una de las más antiguas socias, ella cuenta que hubo un tiempo en que decidió dejar a su grupo, pero con el pasar del tiempo extraño a sus amigas y decidió regresar, además dice que en otras entidades financieras les piden garantías reales para acceder al préstamo y en  Pro Mujer solo piden la garantía solidaria. Todas las integrantes tienen diferentes negocios como la venta de refresco, ropa, pastelería, muebles, fruta, cafetería, carnicería, ellas necesitan el préstamo para la compra de mercadería o instrumentos de trabajo como licuadora, carrito para llevar las frutas, mueble para exponer los pasteles.
texts.en:
“Zapatito veloz” is a group of ladies who work happily together with their credit assessor. There are twelve members of the group/ Marcelina A. is one of their oldest members, and she remembers that there was a time when she decided to leave the group, but as time went by she missed her friends and decided to go back to the group. She also says that in other financial groups they ask for cash guaruntees in order for the loan to be processed, but in Pro Mujer there only ask for a verbal one. All the members have different businesses like selling soft drinks, clothes, confectionary, furniture, fruit, coffee, meat, and they need the loan to buy merchandise or instruments for work like blenders or a cart to carry fruit in or a table to put display their cakes on.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchanise and work tools/COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y HERRAMIENTAS DE TRABAJO

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en: Señor Virgilio is 40 years old and married to Señora Danisa Villamayor. They have five young children and own their own house in the rural area of Almadas, Tobati district. In 2002, with the help of his wife, Don Virgilio started a hair salon downtown in the city of Tobati. They now have an established clientele thanks to the quality of their service. Moreover, Don Virgilio buys hair to sell in Sao Paulo, Brasil, an activity that provides much profit. He is now requesting a loan to increase his operating capital and to provide services to satisfy the demand of his clients.

loans.use: To purchase hair extensions/wigs and to improve his services

loans.name: Adetola

texts.en: Adetola lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells textbooks and notebooks in her shop. Adetola learned her business in 2 years and she has been in the business for the past 7 years. She supplies books to schools when they are in section. Adetola has been borrowing from lapo for a year and the loan has expanded her business. She is 34 years old and married with 4 children. She is requesting for the loan amount of N150, 000 to purchase more textbooks and notebooks to sell. She says thank you to kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks and notebooks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her husband's taxi business

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es: El grupo "San Expedito" esta representado por la señora Anita del Rosario y conformado por 12 miembros que en su mayoría se dedica al comercio de diferentes productos como comida, cosméticos, repuestos, artesanías y al servicio de jardinería y poda de árboles. Dentro del grupo existe un parentesco entre la señora Eugenia y la señora presidenta ellas son hermanas, pero cuentan con ingresos independientes. Como en todo rubro comercial siempre existe la competencia de la oferta y la demanda, pero las socias saben como salir adelante para obtener mejores ingresos para poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Este crédito esta destinado para la diversificación de productos y para invertir en la compra de telas al por mayor, mercadería acorde a la época e insumos para elaborar mas y mejores productos. Las socias van cursando su segundo ciclo dentro de la institución por lo que cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios y saben como administrar los fondos con responsabilidad y honestidad, es por esta razón que la fundación les brinda un segundo apoyo económico para que puedan sacar adelante a sus familias.
texts.en:
The group “San Expedito” is represented by Mrs. Anita del Rosario and made up of 12 members, most of whom work in businesses dealing with different types of products such as food, cosmetics, spare parts, handicrafts, and in the service of gardening and the pruning of trees. Within the group, there is a sister-like kinship between Eugenia and the president, Mrs. Anita, but they rely on themselves, and have independent incomes. As in all commerce there is always the competition of supply and demand, but the associates know how to come out ahead; to earn the best incomes in order to give their families the best quality of life. This loan is intended for the diversification of products, and to invest in the purchase of fabrics in bulk, merchandise agreeing with the times and supplies to produce more products of higher quality. The associates are proceeding with their second cycle in the institution, so they can rely on their experience with mutual support within a group, and know how to administer the funds with responsibility and honesty. It is for this reason that the foundation has blessed them with this second economic assistance, such that they can progress their businesses for the sake of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Kirkvold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for operations

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es: La joven María R., tiene 26 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo. Como madre soltera la seguridad de su familia es primordial, trabaja en su negocio de comercializar ropa para damas y caballero. Desde hace siete años vende en su casa y lo inicio con fondos propios, cantidades pequeña. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic a logrado ir aumentando su inventario, con el préstamo que ha solicitado en Afodenic es para comprar materiales de construcción como: cemento, cerámica, arena y cerámica para poner en la parte de la sala obteniendo una mejor comodidad. Unos de sus proyectos a corto plazo es tener en su casa una tienda en la cual se venda no solo ropa sino artículos para el hogar u otros productos que le generan mayores utilidades. Da las gracias ala institución por el beneficio de lograr los objetivos de hacer la mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
María R. is 26 years old, single, and has one child. Like any single mother, providing security for her family is of utmost importance. María earns a living selling clothing for women and men. She started her business seven years ago selling clothes out her home. Using her own funds, she bought and sold a few quantities at a time. Thanks to loans from AFODENIC, she was able to increase her inventory.

She is now requesting another loan from AFODENIC to buy construction materials such as cement, ceramics, and sand in order to finish part of her living room to make it more comfortable. One of her short-term projects is to have a store where she sells household items in addition to clothing. María hopes this will help her generate more income. She thanks the Institution for assisting her with making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials needed to finish a living room

loans.name: Mrs. Thorn Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The president of this village bank, selected by its 19 members, is Mrs. Thorn C.. Like her fellow group members, she lives in the village of Dong in the province of Takeo. Each member of the group intends to use the loan for individual business purposes.

Mrs. Thorn C. is a silk weaver, so she is requesting the loan to buy more silk to weave. She also buys baskets to re-sell in the local village. Her husband, Mr. T. Hi, is a farmer who makes a small income to support the family.

Mrs. Thorn C. is 47 years old and is the mother of three children, who are all attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave and more baskets to re-sell in the village

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly D. P. is from the village of Sinayawan. Valencia, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children.

Nelly owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products and sometimes  they sell fish using improvised motorcycle design for fish peddling in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Nelly joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Nelly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell.

Nelly is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 


About HSPFI:
