HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 42 years old. He is married and has five children. Two are in junior high school whilest the rest are still in elementary school. He is very hard-working and supportive to his wife in providing food and shelter for their household. He looks smallish but is grown in age. He owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items like sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk and biscuits, etc., in his neighborhood.

James also owns a cocoa farm in the community. With the loan, he wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc., to expand his inventory. He hopes to increase his savings to support his wife in taking care of the home and their children's educational needs. He has been in this business for eight years now.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water and boxes of biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy T. is from the village of Estrella, San Guillermo, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Daisy is a single mother with an infant child. To make a living, Daisy works in someone else's business venture, running a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Daisy earns approximately 500 PHP daily net income for these activities.

In 2009, Daisy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Daisy is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the first loan taken out by Daisy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Carmen Liseth

texts.es: Carmen Liseth M. S. de 34 años, Reside en Ciudad Delgado. Vive junto a sus cuatro hijos, los cuales estudian. Carmen posee una venta de ropa para niños, mujeres y hombres en el Mercado Municipal de Ciudad Delgado. Sus dos hijas mayores le ayudan con el negocio atendiendo a los clientes. Carmen solícita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar más variedad de ropa, ya que tiene muy buena clientela y ella desea poder brindarles más opciones de tallas y colores, de manera que pueda obtener mayores ganancias. Carmen es madre soltera pero esto no le ha impedido trabajar para poder brindarles todo lo que sus hijas necesitan, al contrario esto la incentiva a seguir adelante y seguir luchando por ellas.
texts.en:
Carmen Liseth is 34 years old and resides in Delgado City. She lives with her 4 children who are all students. Carmen has a clothing store for children, women and men in the Delgado City Municipal Market. Her two eldest daughters help her with the business, attending to customers.

Carmen requests a loan to buy a greater variety of clothing, since she has a very good clientèle and wants to be able to offer them more options in sizes and colors, in order to obtain greater earnings.

Carmen is a single mother but this hasn't stopped her from working in order to offer everything that her daughters need. On the contrary, this motivates her to forge ahead and continue struggling for them.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A VARIETY OF CLOTHING TO SELL

location.town: Ciudad Delgado en el departamento de San  Salvador

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie B. is from the village of Malibacsan in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Virgie is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Virgie plants, harvests, and sells bananas. Virgie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500.00 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Virgie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000.00 PHP from GDMPC. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: El señor Julio Rincón M. es casado con la señora Placida Salto ellos son clientes distinguidos y recomendados por nuestra Institución ya que anteriormente obtuvieron un crédito con nosotros para el mejoramiento de su hogar colocando una barda,mejora que se realizo, nuevamente están tramitando para la instalación de las protecciones de su hogar, ya que requieren de mayor seguridad por el horario de su trabajo ya que son personas muy trabajadoras y responsables, así ellos estarán mas tranquilos cuando salgan de casa.
texts.en:
Señor Julio Rincón M. is married; his wife is Señora Placida Salto. They are distinguished clients, recommended by our institution, because in the past they obtained a loan from us to improve their home by building a wall, an improvement that was completed. Now they are negotiating for the installation of protection on the doors and windows of their home, since they require better security because of their work schedule. They are very hard-working and responsible people, so their minds will be more at ease when they leave the house.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install protection on the doors and windows of his house

loans.name: Bokoli Plus Group

texts.en:
Bokoli Plus is a Community Bank made up of 26 members whose chairwoman is Mado T.. These members are united for the same goal, to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC.
Mado started her business in 2002 selling soft drinks. Today, she has a facility where she sells soft drink crates in her area. She is 55 years old, single and has six children between 14 and 36 year old. Three of her children go to school. Currently, Mado is happy to be part of one of Hope’s groups. She has already received eight loans that she paid back correctly and her business has been reinforced through the loan she received. She is planning with the coming loan to purchase 20 crates of soft drinks to resell in order to increase her profit. Her dream is open a soft drink store. She sells in the eastern area of Kinshasa.

loans.use: To purchase 20 crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Emilce Catalina

texts.es:
Emilce C. D. M. vive en el barrio Galán D. la ciudad D. Barranquilla. Está casada con cuatro hijos, todos mayores D. cuarentena años y vive con su esposo, un hijo y tres nietos. Tiene un negocio D. confecciones D. ajuar D. bebé y ahora solicita un crédito D. $2.000.000 que quiere invertir en la compra D. telas e insumos y adornos para elaborar ropa y elementos para bebe.
Emilce es una clienta D. largo plazo con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que inició su negocio hace alrededor D. 20 años por medio D. una amiga que le sugirió vincularse a esta organización mediante   un grupo solidario; allì le prestaron por primera vez $15.000, así fue como compró sus primeras telas y fue avanzado su negocio desD. ese momento. Mientras estaba en grupo solidario, ellas se ayudaban mutuamente, pero ahora recibe crédito individual, es decir por su propia cuenta. A lo largo D. los años con la Fundación, su negocio ha consistido tanto en hacer ajuar D. bebé, sábanas, toldos, decoraciones D. canastos, como en vender comida frita. Ahora se dedica más a las confecciones D. ropa D. bebé y por ello una gran parte D. sus clientes se compone D. mujeres embarazadas, pero también tiene como clientes a misceláneas que le otorgan espacio en sus negocios para exhibir los productos que ella elabora.
Mediante su negocio ha conseguido, alquilar un espacio donD. venden minutos D. celular, una peluquería y un apartamento que tambien arrienda y son parte D. sus ingresos adicionales. Dice que siempre escoge bien a sus inquilinos y que ahora sueña con adquirir su propio apartamento, para tener un espacio personal para ella sola al final del camino.
texts.en:
Emilce C. D. M. lives in the Galán neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. She is married with 4 children, all over 40 years of age and she lives with her husband, a son and 3 grandchildren. She has a business where she makes layettes and needs a loan of $2.000.000 (pesos), that she will use to buy fabrics, materials and decorations to make clothing and items for babies.

Emilce is a long-term customer with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation (Kiva’s field partner) that started its business some 20 years ago because a friend recommended her to be a part of this organization in a group loan. There they lent her $15.000 (pesos), for the first time and that is how she bought her first fabrics and developed her business from that moment. While she was in the group loan, they helped each other mutually but now she has an individual loan. Throughout the years with the foundation, her business has consisted of selling layettes, sheets, awnings, decorations for baskets, as well as fried food. Now she is more into making baby clothing and a big part of her customers are pregnant women but she also has others that exhibit the products she makes in their businesses.

Through her business, she has been able to rent a room where they sell cell-phone minutes, a barbershop and an apartment that is rented and all are part of her current income. She says that she chooses her tenants very carefully and now dreams of having her own apartment to have a personal space for her at the end of her life.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, materials, and decorations to make clothing and layettes for babies.

loans.name: Djerry

texts.fr:
Monsieur Djerry Sidibé est un homme marié de 39 ans et père de 4 enfants qui  vit avec sa femme et ses enfants chez lui même dans le quartier Torakabougou de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Djerry, en plus de ses activités de comptable dans une société de la place, mène des activités génératrices de revenus notamment la gestion d’une cabine téléphonique. Avec la prolifération de cette activité, il décide  de la diversifier en  y ajoutant l’achat et la vente des poissons fumés. Il s’est initié à cette activité auprès d’un ami.
Pour renforcer son commerce, il décida de prendre un prêt avec son partenaire qui est Soro Yiriwaso pour acheter des paniers de  poissons fumés. Il a correctement remboursé son prêt précédent.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de république du Mali et souvent à Mopti 5ème Région administrative du Mali). Sa clientèle est composée essentiellement  de femmes.
Avec ce prêt il compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 52.500 FCFA
Ce bénéfice va lui permettre agrandir son entreprise, payer les intérêts du prêt  et subvenir à ses besoins.
texts.en:
Mr. Djerry Sidibé is a married man who is 39 years old and has four children. He lives with his wife and children at home in the Torakabougou district of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). As well as his activity as an accountant in a local company, Djerry also carries out other income-generating activities, notably managing a telephone kiosk. As this business is growing rapidly, he has decided to diversify by buying and selling smoked fish. He has started up this business with a friend. In order to strengthen his business, he decided to take a loan out from his partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to buy baskets of smoked fish. He repaid his previous loan without problem. He gets his supplies in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) and often in Mopti (the fifth administrative region of Mali). His customer base is made up essentially of women. With this loan he plans to make a monthly profit of 52,500 FCFA. This profit will allow him to expand his company, pay the interest on his loan and provide for his needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fish

loans.name: Dennys

texts.es:
El señor Dennys M. M. se dedica a la venta de Verduras en el mercado  del Bisne, sector de verduras, es  casado tiene 5 hijos todos en edad escolar, pero también su esposa tiene otro tramo de verdura en el mismo sector, ambos trabajan mutuamente para sacar adelante a sus hijos. 

El señor M. solicito el crédito para cubrir unas compras de verduras para tener producto fresco y ofrecer a su clientela,  ya que la mayoría de sus clientes  son restaurantes, y comideras del mismo sector, lleva ya 8 créditos con ceprodel y ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable.
texts.en:
Sr. Dennys M. M. sells vegetables in the produce section of the market in Bisne. He is married and has five children who are all of school age. His wife also manages a vegetable stand in the same part of the market. They both work together in order for their children to get ahead.

Sr. M. is requesting a loan to cover the purchase of vegetables so that he can have fresh products to offer to his customers. The majority of his customers are restaurants and eateries located in the same area of the market. He has already received eight loans with CEPRODEL and demonstrated that he is a very responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fresh vegetables

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Maria es casada, y tiene 5 hijos una de las cuales sufre el mal de Epilepsia. María comenzó su negocio vendiendo productos de belleza pero este tipo de ventas no le generan muchos ingresos así que opto por cambiar de negocio Un buen día una amiga le recomendó los productos naturales de la empresa Omnilife para su hija, ella probo y los resultados fueron favorables para su menor hija así que pensó en comercializar estos productos y poder ayudar a otras personas, esto le trajo beneficios y ganancias para su familia, ella se siente contenta y al igual que su hija ha mejorado su salud.
texts.en:
Maria is married and has five children, one of whom suffers from epilepsy. Maria started a business selling beauty products, but the kinds of sales she made didn't generate much of a profit, so she oped to change businesses. One day a friend recommended natural remedies from the company Omnilife for Maria to give to her sick daughter. She tried it with her daughter and the results were favorable, so Maria decided to start selling the products and help out other people. This has yielded benefits and profits for her family. Maria feels pleased, and her daughter's health has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase natural products

loans.name: Las Colinas Group

texts.es:
El comité “Las Colinas”  está conformado por 20 integrantes, en la ciudad de Las Colinas de Mariano Roque Alonzo. Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes y de servicios, como son las ventas, y de servicio.
Es un grupo de señoras muy activas, emprendedoras y muy responsables en todo.
Todas las integrantes del comité son mujeres amas de casas y madres  que se dedican a varias actividades con el fin de fortalecer la economía de la casa.
La Sra. Bernarda C. integrantes del comite ella es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, se dedica a la compra-venta de ropas.
Ella ofrece sus prendas de vestir en un salón que alquila en centro de ciudad y atiende el negocio con su hija. Está interesada en incrementar sus ingresos mediante la inversión en adqusición de prendas de temporada como camperas, pantalones, tricotas, medias, gorras, camisas, etc., teniendo en cuenta la llegada del invierno y la clientela formada que ya posee.
texts.en:
The Las Colinas Communal Bank is comprised of 20 members. They are in the city of Las Colinas de Mariano Roque Alonzo. All of the members work at independent activities or service like sales or providing services. It is a very active group of women who are hard-working and very responsible in everything. All of the members of the communal bank are housewives and mothers. They work at various activities in order to strengthen their household economies. Bernarda C. is a member of the communal bank. She is a tenacious and hard-working woman. She buys and sells clothes. She sells her clothing in a salon that she rents in the center of the city. She and her daughter take care of the business. She is interested in increasing her income by purchasing seasonal clothing like boots, pants, sweaters, hosiery, hats, and shirts, etc. She is keeping in mind the arrival of winter and the fixed customers that she already has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seasonal clothing like boots, pants, sweaters, hosiery, hats, and shirts, etc.

loans.name: Lom

texts.en:
Mrs. Lom C. (shown in the photo), 49, is a widow with three children: one son and two daughters. One of them is married and lives outside the family home and the other two work in a garment factory. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Lom has been a silk weaver since 1979, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh market. 

She is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Taman Indah Group

texts.en:
I Ketut S. U.  is a 33-year-old man living in the town of Melaya - Bali.  I Ketut is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by MUK.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  

I Ketut is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, I Ketut owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  I Ketut has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 300,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2010, I Ketut joined MUK to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  I Ketut is requesting from MUK his first loan of 1,375,000 IDR which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  I Ketut plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business.

About MUK:

The mission of Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) is to assist small businesses in Bali by providing training, business consultation, and loans thereby helping the owners and their families improve their everyday lives.





I Ketut S. U. (0) merupakan 33 tahun pria.  Dia (laki-laki) tinggal di kota Melaya - Bali.  I Ketut adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  0


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber U. penghasilan bisnis tersebut terU. berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  I Ketut sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, I Ketut menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 IDR.  Dalam 2010, I Ketut bergabung MUK untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  I Ketut meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari MUK.    Dia (laki-laki) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,375,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari MUK.


Tentang MUK:

Misi Koperasi Mitra Usaha Kecil (MUK) adalah untuk membantu usaha kecil di Bali dengan memberikan perlatihan, konsultasi bisnis, dan pinjaman uang, dengan demikian membantu pemilik usaha dan keluarga mereka memperbaiki hidup sehari-hari.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Maria Nilda

texts.es:
la señora Maria Nilda E. V. tiene 39 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de ella,   Maria se dedica a vender tortillas, baleadas, chocobananos tiene 2 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, el credito lo utilizara para la compra harina de trigo, frijoles, queso, mantequilla, huevos, bananos y chocolate en polvo para hacer los chocobananos y para elaborar las baleadas.

Maria vive con sus tres hijos dos de ellos estudian en el colegio y la otra esta en la escuela, su meta es graduar a sus hijos y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria Nilda E. Vasques is 39, divorced and has 3 dependent children. Maria sells tortillas, baleadas [popular Honduran tortilla containing beans, grated cheese and butter] and chocobananos [chocolate bananas with peanuts]. She has been doing this for two years. This loan will be used for the purchase of wheat flour, beans, cheese, butter, eggs, bananas and powdered chocolate to make her chocobananos and baleadas. Maria lives with her three children, two of whom study in college and the other in school. Her goal is for her children to graduate and to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of bananas, powdered chocolate, wheat flour, beans, cheese, butter, eggs, lard and oil

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna B. is a widow who lives in Prk. Saging, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns a living by operating two business ventures: vegetable sales and the operation of a general store.

Myrna joined Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF)-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of 4 previous loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and through her hard work, Myrna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan in the amount of PHP 10,000 enabled her to earn a monthly profit of 9,000 PHP, which helped to improve her family's standard of living.

This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP ($275), which she intends to use to buy vegetables and additional inventory for the general store. In turn, she hopes to continue to save up for future home repairs and the betterment of her business. Myrna B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, NWTF is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 per day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon, which is a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional vegetables and inventory

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana C. G. is 23 years old. She lives in a common-law relationship, with her 3-year-old kid named Fernando, in San Miguel canton, in the province of Bolivar.

Diana is a member of the rural loan group called “Hope of the sower”, which is located 2 hours away from San Miguel. There are 14 group members, who are dedicated to agriculture: corn, beans, potatoes and blackberries mostly.

Diana is a farmer who grows blackberries, corn, and beans. She purchases and sells her products in the town of San Pablo (an hour away from where she lives). Blackberries sell weekly, and other crops once a year.

Diana is requesting this loan to invest in agriculture: to buy compost and fertilizers. She thinks the credit will help her invest more. Her dream is to purchase a house. She faces major challenges with crop diseases, such as “lanchas” in corn and beans, that endanger the harvest. She lacks money for her family

She likes to sew and take care of her animals in her free time.

loans.use: To buy compost and fertilizers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther P. is currently in the business of selling local brew and beer in a bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell.  Esther is 31 years old and is married to a peasant. She has two children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to extend the floor of her bar.

loans.use: Stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: James

texts.en:
N. James is a 54-year-old peasant farmer who grows food crops and owns a banana plantation. He normally sells his produce to grocery and restaurant businesses. James is very hardworking and determined to achieve his goal of owning a large agricultural farm in his home area of Kyarurera, Ibanda. 
With his strong attribute of determination and hardworking skills, James has gotten his 20-year-old enterprise a dependable niche. He makes monthly profits from banana and milk sales to the tune of 150,000 UGX. With this loan, he hopes to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs for next season. He also wants to buy a plot of land. This will improve his yields and therefore his sales revenue, and he will be able to live a more satisfying life and educate his children, which is his main goal.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizers and manure, as well as a plot of land

loans.name: Etevise

texts.en:
Etevise T. is 56 and widowed with 5 children.  She owns a business venture, planting and harvesting fruit and vegetables for sale.  Etevise has many years of experience in this business.  Etevise needs a loan of 1000 talas to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 340 talas or US $140 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Etevise joined SPBD.  This is her 1st loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Etevise's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita A. is from the village of Siempre Viva Norte. She is 50 years old. Jovita is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jovita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Jovita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jovita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 22,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Jovita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Jovita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Benancia

texts.es: La señora Benancia es  casada tiene 4 hijos su esposo de profesión músico ellos viven en  casa familiar  de su tío de parte  de la señora ubicada en la zona Ballivian el alto. Su negocio principal es la venta de ropa nueva  de señoras de pollera (mantas, enaguas de paño, centros de encaje blusas, polleras, chompas, sombreros, etc.) con el dinero del crédito comprara una cantidad de ropa variada para  surtir su puesto de venta. El negocio lo realiza mas en los pueblos, ferias de provincias como por ejemplo Tiahuanaco, Laja. Tambillo y otros. Su aspiración es ser dueña de casa en la que actualmente vive, por lo cual trabajan en mutuo apoyo y esfuerzo para alcanzar ese objetivo, es un apersona muy decidida y muy trabajadora esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada.
texts.en: Benancia is married with 4 children; her husband is a musician.  They live in her uncle's home in the Ballivian El Alto neighborhood.  She works selling women's clothing (ponchos, wool skirts, fitted blouses, t-shirts, sweaters, hats, etc.).  With this loan, she will buy a variety of new clothing to stock her store.  She does most of her business in villages and in provincial markets such as Tiahuanaco, Laja, Tambillo and others.  Her goal is to have her own home; she works together with her husband to achieve this goal.  She is a very dedicated and hard-working person who is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for showing the confidence in her to give her this loan.

loans.use: Purchase new stock for the end of the year

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. LOS TEMBLORES II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco  y departamento D. Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Adelaida; ella tiene 58 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. venta D. golosinas, ella tiene una carreta en una D. las calles D. la ciudad D. Cusco, ella trabaja desD. las 7:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere tener una tienda D. abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar golosinas como caramelos, galletas y gaseosas.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR D. LOS TEMBLORES II”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco  y departamento D. Cusco.

Adelaida, 58, is a member of the “SEÑOR D. LOS TEMBLORES II” (Lord of the Earthquakes II) communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

She is married and has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with snack sales.  She has a cart in one of Cusco’s streets and works from 7am until 7pm.  She’d like to have a grocery store and is asking for the loan to buy snacks like: candy, cookies and soft drinks.

She avails herself of this forum to thank all those who share her dream and at the same time pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy snacks like candies, cookies and soft drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old married woman with one child. She is from Lebanon. She has been working as a beautician since 2007. She works from her home and also as a traveler. This young woman works hard to help her husband to raise her little child. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase wholesale beauty products from a cosmetic company. In the future, she plans to open a formal beauty salon to offer her services to her clients and add new beauty services.

Women continue to play an important role in Lebanese society, especially in the development of the family. Women are able to serve as strong role models for their children while also helping to supplement their household incomes. In almost all parts of Lebanon, demand for beauty and fashion products continues to be high.

loans.use: purchase beauty products wholesale

loans.name: Lucero Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lucero está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras proveniente de Managua una de ellas es Aurora García de 33 años quien inicio hace 5 años con la compra una paca de ropa usada y con los préstamos y su labor su negocio fue creciendo e invirtió en una camioneta para comprar chatarra. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su familia con los cuales ha podido salir adelante y poder proporcionarle una mejor calidad de vida a sus cuatro pequeños.

García invertirá el crédito en sus dos negocios con el firme propósito de salir adelante, por otra parte ella ha participado en tres capacitaciones en Adim la cual le ha ayudado mucho a trabajar.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Marta L. inicio vendiendo ropa luego invirtió en variedades de productos como  platos y  perfumes y Oneyda de M. compra y venta de reciclaje la cual tiene poco tiempo como un año aproximadamente alquilando una camioneta y actualmente obtuvo la propia.
texts.en: Lucero group consists of three hard-working, determined and enterprising women from Managua. One of them, Aurora García, is 33 years old. She started five years ago by buying a selection of used clothing and with loans and hard work her business grew and she invested in a small truck to purchase merchandise. She counts on the support of her family with whom she has been able to succeed and provide a better quality of life for her four children. García will invest the loan in her two businesses with the intention of augmenting them. On the other hand she has participated in three trainings in Adim which has helped her work a lot. The other members of the group are Marta L., who began selling clothing and later invested in a variety of products like dishes and perfumes, and Oneyda de M. who buys and sells recycled goods and has been doing so for about a year using a rented truck and later her own.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise like clothing as well as recycled goods.

loans.name: C1186 Ituze Group

texts.en:
Ladislas is 45 years old and married with six children between the ages of 8 and 23. He is the president of a group called “Ituze” and this group have a variety of businesses including boutiques, bars, bean and sorghum sales. Ladislas has a bar and shop selling a variety of general store items. He has been in this business for about one year and is open from 7am until 5pm every day. He employs two people.
Ladislas and his team are now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more stock for their various businesses. With the use of this loan, Ladislas and his team expect to earn more profits which, in turn, will be used to reinvest in their businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more products for his bar and general store

loans.name: Haykaz

texts.en:
Haykaz P. is 53 years old.  He lives in Kapan city with his wife and his son.  His two daughters are married and live separately from their parents. 

For about 15 years Haykaz and his wife have been engaged in clothes, shoes and household goods trading.  At the same time, Haykaz drives a taxi; so thanks to his occupations he provides for his family's needs and was able to marry off his daughters.  Haykaz works in his shop without any days off and he says he has a lot of regular customers.  He buys merchandise from Yerevan and sells it in Kapan market. 

Haykaz is asking for a 700,000 AMD loan to buy house slippers, underclothes, pajamas and high boots to resell. Haykaz has already received 9 loans from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy house slippers, underclothes, pajamas and high boots to resell.

loans.name: Ladiri  (Loyalty) Group

texts.fr:
Ladiri est un regroupement de femmes  du quartier Hamdallaye de Koutiala qui  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et mères d’au moins 5 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, le  bois de chauffe, les habillements et autres produits alimentaires etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. 
Saran  Touré qui est la présidente du groupe Ladiri  vend le bois de chauffe et divers autres articles tels les bonbons, biscuits, croquettes, arachide, chocolat, etc.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des chargements de charrettes en  bois de chauffe auprès des producteurs et divers autres produits alimentaires qui seront achetés au point final à Koutiala. Elle se procure en bois dans les villages tels Beleso, Sanga et Welengana. Son stock de bois est entreposé dans un endroit de la concession, est très important. Elle vend le bois en détail et au comptant  à  la maison à une clientèle composée exclusivement de femmes de ménages. Les produits alimentaires sont vendus aux abords de 
l’école privée Komi Diossé pendant la recréation. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe Ladiri comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Saran  Touré compte réaliser 70 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles comptent utiliser une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
Ladiri is a group of women from the Hamdallaye district of Koutiala who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other parents.  The group members average 43 years of age and are mothers of at least five children.  They do commerce in a variety of goods, such as firewood, clothing, and food. To increase the size of their businesses, the group members decided to join the loan program at the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso.  

Saran Touré, who is the president of the group Kotognontala, sells firewood and various goods, such as candies, cookies, croquettes, peanuts, chocolate, etc.  She plans on using her loan to buy a few cart loads of firewood from producers and also some food items, which will be purchased at the end point in Koutiala.  She acquires firewood in the villages, such as Beleso, Sanga, and Welengana.  Her stock of firewood, which is very substantial, is warehoused in a place at the concession.  She sells the wood retail and for cash at the house to a customer base composed exclusively of housekeepers.  The food items are sold at a spot adjacent to the private school Komi Diossé during recess. 

While the group members each plan on making an average profit of 60,000 francs CFA over the course of the cycle, Saran Touré plans on making 70,000 francs.  In addition to repaying the loans, they plan on using a part of the revenues for coping with common family expenses.

loans.use: Buying a variety of items

loans.name: Maria Narcisa

texts.es:
Maria Narcisa C. A., tiene 31 años, es soltera con los hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. VALLE ALTO se encuentra en el recinto Voluntad de Dios, pertenece al cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto a la siembra de maíz y arroz.

Maria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembre de maíz y arroz, compra y vende los productos en ventanas en comercial Peña y vende en la casa o en el mercado de ventadas todos los días.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es ver el bienestar de los hijos.

Le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Maria Narcisa C. A., age 31, is single and lives with her children in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 3 children.

The members of the V.R.C. Valle Alto are located in the Voluntad de Dios district, belonging to the Ventanas Canton. The members of this community bank work in short-cycle agriculture, sowing corn and rice.

Maria works in agriculture sowing corn and rice. She buys and sells her products in stalls in the Peña market and sells every day from home or at the market.

She is requesting this loan for sowing corn and purchasing supplies and seeds. The support of this loan will help her economically to supply her needs. She confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to secure her children's well-being.

She enjoys watching television.

loans.use: the purchase of supplies and seeds

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Fatmata K.. She is married and has one 7-year-old child. 

In 2007, Fatmata established her cosmetics business because she wanted to help her husband educate their children. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about 480,000 SLL every month. 

Fatmata has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now she requires a new loan of 4,000,000 SLL in order to add business stock to increase profits. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 350,000 SLL. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to sell in larger quantity to traders from the capital city, Freetown. She wants to travel internationally to earn more profit and would also like to hire workers. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more assorted items for her shop

loans.name: The Sulaiman Kpaka Group

texts.en:
These are some of the teachers of the Luke Memorial Primary School in Kenema, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. The school was founded in September 2002 by the community to improve the educational standards of the children in the community. It is currently staffed with 8 teachers and has an enrollment of 373 students.

This is the first loan that teachers of this school have requested from SMT/Kiva lenders. They are requesting a group loan of 4,800,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, these teachers will be able to buy or invest in something that they could not afford with their salaries. 

Sulaiman K. is the leader of the group. He is 36 and married with five children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Sulaiman was born in a place called Joi. He has been a teacher for eight years. With his share of this loan, Sulaiman will buy household items such as a fan, radio cassette recorder, a bed, etc.

loans.use: to buy household goods such as a fan, radio, and bed

loans.name: Apec Al Ouma Gueume Sa Bopp 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Geume sa Bopp  1 est un sous groupe de la cellule APEC  Al  Ouma  située dans la localité de Yoff. C’est un groupement  mixte de 19 personnes  qui habitent  dans le même  quartier et exercent des activités diversifiées de commerce. Les différents  produits qui sont généralement commercialisés par ces femmes sont les tissus, chaussures, céréales et produits de consommation diverses. Elles s’activent dans  le commerce depuis plus de 20 ans. Elles sont représentées  par leur présidente madame Ndeye   qui est en même  temps  la présidente du groupement des femmes de l’association APEC -AL-OUMA. Elle sollicite un crédit de 2 250 000 destiné a l’achat de produits alimentaires  dans le but de renforcer  et d’élargir l’activité des membres  du groupe. L’objectif du groupe est d’accroitre leur bénéfice  pour éventuellement améliorer le bien être  et le cadre de vie de leurs familles respectives.
texts.en:
The group "Geume sa Bopp 1" is a subgroup of the cell APEC Al  Ouma, located in the town of Yoff. This is a mixed association of nineteen people who live in the same district and who have diverse businesses. The different products marketed generally by the women are fabrics, shoes, grains, and a variety of consumer items. The women have been active in commerce for over twenty years. 

Ms. Ndeye, who presents the women, is the president of the women's group of the association APEC -AL-OUMA. She is requesting a loan of 2,250,000 francs for buying supplies with the goal of bolstering and expanding the group's businesses. The group's goal is to grow their profits in hopes of improving the well-being and the living standards of their respective families.

About this loan:
Al Ouma is a Senegalese nonprofit whose full name is The Association for Koranic Education and Teaching. 

Originally founded to work with at-risk children, especially talibés (young boys from poor families who beg in Senegalese metropolitan areas),  Al Ouma has evolved its mission to work with adults as well as children.   They currently have over 10,000 members, and are actively engaged in supporting the economic development of their members in the hopes of improving their quality of life, and that of their at-risk children.

Al Ouma's members are currently organized into smaller associations which meet each week to contribute to a group fund that helps finance small loans for members.  Members typically put in $2 USD per week.  Because UIMCEC and Al Ouma both share the mission of fighting poverty through economic empowerment, they have formed a partnership to provide loans to Al Ouma associations at a lower interest rate than UIMCEC usually offers its clients.

loans.use: Increasing their working capital

loans.name: Silvia Zoila

texts.es:
Silvia Zoila G. M. tiene 50 años, Es casada vive con el esposo y con los hijos Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 6 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R. C CALZADO SOLIDARIO se encuentra ubicada en el recinto   el Calzado pertenece al Cantón San Miguel, a media hora de la oficina esta ventanilla de 12 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra maíz, papas fréjol, y a la cría de animales de corral y ganado vacuno.

Silvia se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas, fréjol y a la cría de corral. Compra sus productos en el mercado de San Miguel cada semana y los vende en la feria de los jueves en San Miguel.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de semillas de sus cultivos y comprar comida para los animales. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un negocio propio.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Silvia Zoila G. M. is 50 years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children in Bolívar province.  She has 6 children. 

The 'Calzado Solidario' community bank is located in El Calzado, in San Miguel canton.  The bank, which has 12 members, is located half an hour from our offices.  Its members work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, potatoes and beans.  They also raise farmyard animals and cattle.

Silvia is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes and beans, and raises farmyard animals.  She buys her products in San Miguel market every week and sells her products in San Miguel market on Thursdays.

Silvia is requesting this loan to buy seeds and feed for her animals.  The support of this loan will help her to financially cover her needs.  She faces challenges in her business such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  Her dream is to own her own business.

Silvia likes to take part in sports.

loans.use: to buy seeds and feed for her animals

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucía tienen 38 años de edad, es originaria de Francisco Serrato, esta localidad se encuentra en el estado de Michoacán, es una comunidad donde predomina la cultura Mazahua donde todavía las mujeres usan vestimentas e idioma de esa cultura. Doña Lucí está casada con el Señor Antonio García desde hace 21 años.
Comenta la señora Lucía que ella pidió su préstamo para comprar abono y para fumigar sus árboles de aguacate, guayaba y andrinas, su fruta la vende por cubetas en el mercado de Zitacuaro Michoacán, ella lleva con su negocio desde hace 4 años comenta que empezó a vender frutas para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y que también le empezó a poner empeño por que sacaba fruta de sus árboles y para que no se le echaran a perder mejor las vendía. Una meta que tiene doña Lucí es algún día tener su negocio estable en el mercado de Zitacuaro por que se le hace un poco complicado ir a vender su producto a diario y trasladarse con ellos ya que para Francisco Serrato no hay casi Transporte ya que nada mas hay dos salidas al día y eso se le complica, ella sueña con tener algún día un carrito para poder transportar sus mercancía.
texts.en:
Lucía is 38 years old and is a native of Francisco Serrato. This town is located in the State of Michoacán and is a community where the Mazahua culture is predominant and the women still wear the clothing and speak the language of this culture. Lucía has been married to Antonio García for 21 years.

Lucía comments that she requested her loan to buy fertilizer and to fumigate her avocado, guava and sloe trees. She sells her fruits by the pail at the market in Zitacuaro, Michoacán. She has had her business for four years and comments that she began to sell fruit to help her husband with the household expenses. She also began to make an effort because she picked the fruit from the trees and sold it so that it would not go bad.

One of Lucía’s goals is to someday have a stable business at the Zitacuaro market because it is a bit complicated for her to go to sell her products on a daily basis, transporting them from Francisco Serrato. There is almost no transport from the town, as there are only two departures each day, making it complicated. She dreams of one day having a car to be able to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José tiene 20 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en el distrito de La Victoria, una zona rural en la provincia de Chiclayo en el norte de Perú. Cuenta con energía eléctrica pero no agua potable. Consume el agua de un pozo. Se dedica a la agricultura. Esta actividad lo realiza en un terreno de sus padres. Actualmente, tiene sembrado cebolla de rabo. Adicionalmente, José genera ingresos adicionales prestando su servicio de faenas agrícolas. Solicita un crédito para invertir en su cultivo de cebolla ya que necesita comprar abonos e insecticidas. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternative (Kiva Field Partner) un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Jose is 20 years old and he is single. He lives in the district of La Victoria, an rural region in the province of Chiclayo in Peru's north. He has hydro but he does not have potable water. He uses water from a well. He is an agriculturist. He carries out his work on his parents' fields.  Currently he has a plantation of green onions. Additionally, Jose also generates a supplementary income by providing agricultural services. He requests a loan to invest on his onion plantation, needing to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. For this reason he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 600 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his onion plantation

loans.name: Zivamuntuyo Kyamujanju Group

texts.en: Isaac is 55 years old and married with eight children aged between 11-18 years old. They live in Karuguuza Uganda. He is the leader of Zivamuntuyo Kyamujanju Group which is a group of hardworking people who sweat to earn a living. Isaac’s wife operates a retail shop and they live in their own home with seven people. Their goal is to be self sustaining. For 25 years he has been running a business of bicycle spare parts and has been able to pay school fees, though he faces a challenge of many of his customers defaulting on their payments. Isaac needs a loan to buy more spare parts for sale.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Maria Monica

texts.es:
María  es una madre de familia de 19,  tiene un hijo de 02 años a su cargo y vive en casa de sus suegros, cuenta con casa propia y vive con su esposo. En la zona donde residen las personas se dedican a las labores agrícolas así como al comercio de productos de artesanías. Ésta es una zona rural ubicada a 15 km de la ciudad de Piura, en el camino al distrito de catacaos.

Maria se dedica a la elaboración de chicha de jora (bebida hecha a base de maíz fermentado) esta es una bebida oriunda del Perú,  además vende harina  de maíz, esta actividad la realiza hace 3 años en sus mismo domicilio, años en los cuales ella ha podido adquirir clientela fija en su zona.

Maria se ha dado cuenta que  últimamente su clientela se ha visto en aumento,  ella no quiere perder la oportunidad de vender su producto en otras comunidades.  Es por ello que está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1500 nuevos soles para que ella pueda comprar más insumos como el maíz para la elaboración  de la harina y la chicha.(maiz, azucar,leña), así como para realizar arreglos en la parte donde funciona su cocina, ampliación y techado con calaminas, esta inversión ayudara en la mejora de su calidad de vida , cliente continuará su negocio a fin de seguir creciendo y desarrollando a su familia.

María  es una mujer bastante trabajadora y de muy buen carácter, las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
María is a 19 year-old mother.  She has a 2 year-old son in her care and lives in her in-laws' home.  She owns her own home and lives with her husband.  In María's area, people work in agriculture.  They also buy and sell handicrafts.  This is a rural area which is located 15km from the city of Piura, on the road to Catacaos district.

María makes 'chicha de jora' (a drink made from fermented corn).  It is a native Peruvian drink.  She also sells corn flour.  She has been in this business, which she runs from home, for three years.  Over this time, she has acquired regular customers in her area.

María has realised that her number of customers has risen recently.  She does not want to lose the opportunity of selling her product in other communities.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa so that she can buy more supplies such as corn for making flour and chicha (corn, sugar and firewood).  She will also make some repairs in her kitchen area, extending it and roofing it with corrugated metal sheets.  This investment will help her to improve her quality of life.  She will continue in her business so that she can continue growing and getting her family ahead.

María is a hard-working and very good-natured woman.  People who know her have a lot of respect and affection for her.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as corn for making flour and 'chicha' (corn, sugar, firewood)

loans.name: Jonjib

texts.en:
Jonjib, who is 29 years old, lives in the community of Sta. Josefa Agusan Del Sur. He is a rice farmer and a piggery owner. He has been in this business for 12 years. 

Through a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc., he will buy farm and agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers and seeds.

Jonjib is childless. His dream is to become a successful rice farmer in the future.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is married and has five dependents. Her husband is a farmer. As part of her responsibilities she helps to pay school fees and utility bills.

For the past ten years Adjoa has sold fruit such as pineapples, oranges, pawpaw and others in Elmina. Her 800 GHS loan will be used to buy fruit to sell. She hopes to reinvest all new profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is age 56 and has been in farming for 24 years in Nkubu, Central Kenya. Her farm produces cabbages,potatoes, milk and tea which she sells to the local market. She has employed one farmhand to help her on the farm.

Harriet has made her first loan request for 47,250 KES with Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says income generated will uplift her family's  living standards. She says the dairy business is promising and she will focus on buying more dairy cows in future.

Harriet mentions the high cost of feed as her main challenge, but she remains optimistic.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 44 year old married man, the father of 3 children and the owner of a stone factory since 1974.  Khaled's business is going fine, but sometimes, like every business, it needs support and extra cash to satisfy customers needs.

Khaled manufactures the stone used in construction, and this field is widening these days.  This is Khaled's seventh loan with A. Majmoua-Kiva partner.  All of his previous loans helped a lot in improving his business and he hopes this one will have the same effect.  His loan will help in buying necessary materials for his business.

Khaled cares a lot about his family's standard of living and he seeks the best for them.  He hopes to expand his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials for his business

loans.name: Raw Fish Seller Group

texts.en:
Hannah is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Hannah is 25 years old and was born in Panguma town. She is married to a trader, and the couple have two children who are attending primary school. 

Hannah has been in business for many years selling fish. This is the first loan that Hannah and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Hannah is going to use her share of the loan to buy dozens of fish to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy dozens of fish to add to her business.

loans.name: Nelly  Lucia

texts.es:
Nelly, se dedica a la venta de comida y bebidas refrescantes, es madre soltera de tres hijos de 15, 17 y 26 años de edad, ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años por iniciativa propia, trabaja todos los días de 8:00am a 6:00pm.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como arroz, carnes, embutidos, aceite y gaseosas, para la elaboración de la comida, este préstamo le ayudara al negocio surtiendo con todo lo necesario para atender la demanda y así mismo se beneficia ella con mayores ventas.
Su objetivo es ayudar a sus hijos en lo necesario, por tal motivo mantiene el negocio con todos los materiales necesarios para ofrecer a los clientes los mejores platillos.
texts.en:
Nelly sells food and refreshing beverages.  She’s a single mother of three children who are 15, 17 and 26 years old.  She’s been in business for 10 years and started it on her own initiative.  She works every day from 8am until 6pm.

She is currently asking for a loan to buy merchandise like rice, meat, cured meats, oil and soft-drinks to make the food.  This loan will help her business stocking it with everything she needs to meet customer demand as well as benefit herself with increased sales.

Her goal is to help her children in everything they need and this is why she keeps the business stocked with all necessary materials to offer customers the best possible dishes.

loans.use: to buy products for the business like: rice, meat, cured meats, oil and soft-drinks.

loans.name: Deus

texts.en:
Deus is a 57-year-old married man with five children living in his own semi-permanent house in Kamwenge, Uganda.

The responsibility to look after the family solely rests on him and his desire is to educate his children. He has been in the produce business for 12 years but the major challenge he faces is the effect of price fluctuations. His dream is to own a big store . 

Deus needs the loan to buy sacks of groundnuts for resale.

loans.use: To buy sacks of groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Tuk's Group

texts.en:
There are five members in this group and all of them reside in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia.
Mrs. Tuk is the person who is selected to be the team leader.  She is a 42 year old married woman and the mother of two single children.  One of her children is employed as a cleaner and has a formal salary each month.  Her other child attends the local school.

Mrs. Tuk is a domestic worker in the port.  FR. her job, she receives a profit of about $3USD per day to use in the daily expenses of the family.  Her husband also works in the same occupation by her side.  In order to increase her revenue, Mrs. Tuk would like to run a new business of selling many kinds of goods in front of her house.  Because of the lack of working capital, Mrs. Tuk has decided to ask for a loan fund fR. HKL and Kiva to buy some items such as sweets, soft drinks, cooking ingredients, plastic products and other necessary inventory. 

In the future, Mrs. Tuk hopes that with her income, she will expand her new selling business, and rebuild her existing house.  She also hopes to support her children so they finish the high school level of education.

The other four borrowers are:
Mrs. Sun, a domestic laborer, who is applying for a loan to repair her broken house.
Mrs. Sun, 32, is a domestic worker who requests a loan to decorate her old house.
Mrs. Mar, a cleaner, is taking a loan to mend her house.
Mrs. Houn is a Khmer cake seller who requests a loan to buy more ingredients for making her Khmer cake.

loans.use: to buy items such as sweets, soft drinks, cooking ingredients, plastic products and other necessary inventory.

loans.name: Gisma

texts.en:
Gisma is 27 years old with three children, two of whom are in school. She is married to a businessman. She has a business selling clothes in Buluk Branch in South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Gisma requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase designer dresses to sell. She says that she will use the extra income to build a very big shop for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell
